text: The food is great, service is professional and and fast! They also open late so it's great for Vegas! Would definitely recommend this place.

Even though the atmosphere is more like "club sushi" I still like this place.
I can put up with the big screen playing trendy music videos and the elevated volume for 3 reasons.

1. The fish was fresh, the rice was good and the selection of fresh fish sufficient!

2. They are open until 6am and I have another option for late night/early morning sushi cravings.

3. Great service!

Kaizen isn't cheap.  It's not sushi genius or the best thing you've ever eaten.  It's just really good fresh fish served till the wee hours of the morning so in my book thats pretty sweet.  

When I first moved to town from New York and had no car.   I lived in the ghetto area just north and would walk the 15 minutes in blistering heat for the sushi.  Well that and check out the boobs across the street at the hard cock.

Worked for me.
Late night fun with buy one get one free sake. Sushi is good fun place to be plus it's open late so that's a real plus
So far I love the decor and this trendy atmosphere. Very nice with a modern texture. Can't wait to dig into my 2 sushi rolls. They look delicious

Wow, am I glad I stopped by. Very nice atmosphere. Very friendly staff. I really like that the rolls I had had more of the ingredients than the rice. I don't like it when the rice over powers the rolls. I had the Kiss of fire and it was great. I will be coming back time and time again to go down the list of their special rolls.

The spring roll is surprisingly good! As well as the Las Nevada roll! The spicy tuna salad is fresh though the sauce isn't that spicy. We came from watching a show and found this open just in time for Happy Hour! The ambience is calm and the interior is pretty. The best part is that it's just across Hard Rock Hotel where we stayed!
I love the atmosphere of the place. We were greeted and serviced as soon we walked in.
perfect! food is great! good service with nice waiters. weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeereeeeeeee
Great happy hour: buy 1 get 1 free drinks. Sushi is fresh, and chicken katsu tempura roll is delicious. And it's open 24 hrs!
Decor was nice, sushi rice needs to be better, it was was a bit hard and needs a bit more sushi vinegar taste. Our side rice dish was also a bit dry.
This is a great sushi bar.  Very creative rolls, great atmosphere and acceptable service.

I'm shocked at all the good reviews this place is getting. We could hardly eat our sushi and had to return it to the chefs! Its nice that this place is open late but thats about it. The food was priced high so I was expecting incredible sushi. Turns out, the sushi you get from Costco or the buffetts at any LV strip hotel tastes way better. I was so disappointed at the quality and will definitely never dine here again. 

Here's a sampling of what we ordered:
CA roll - super dry
Tuna roll & various sashimis - the fish wasn't fresh
Chicken Teriyaki bowl - chicken was dry and inedible
Tamago roll - this one we sent back because it tasted funny

Very peaceful and possitive atmosphere,  This is are second time here, living in California. Every time we come to Las Vegas we just have to stop here. The sushi was fresh. My fiancée loves this place. Great service are waiter was very attentive and helpful both times that we've been here. The rolls are amazing. The parking situation could be a little hectic.
Nice lunch bento set and teriyaki bowl. The grill Saba fish is a must try! Nice, cosy and attentive staffs!
Awesome food and many varieties of sushi and other items. Service is excellent always greeted as soon as you enter the door and a nice place to go late night.
Great food and service!  Agadeshi tofu and fusion sushi rolls very good.  The atmosphere is great with nice music.  Everything that we ordered tasted great.  Will definitely come back again

I can't begin to explain how amazing this sushi bar is, To Start Our Dinner We Had The Miso Soup Very Delicious, Also The Monster Roll With The Spicy Tuna So Delicious Next To The Soft Shell Crab So Rich In Flavor But The Main Dish I Tried For The First Time Was TORO! oh let me tell you how fresh it was and the way it just melt in every bite was something else! I love this place! And the nice staff is a 5 star experience  definitely the place to eat and sake
Great sushi place! I am hooked and it's right next to campus. I will definitely be back for more and I plan to bring many of my friends. This was a great choice for dinner

Must try their sexy roll. It will make you sexy. Also, their dragon roll is much better than any other dragon roll I had before. Super Fresh !!!!!!!!!! Need to order both sexy and dragon roll. It will make your day.

This place suck, everything I order taste fishy!!!!, they are over price! Server was impatient to answer question about their menu! These people did not care about me!
We Will not return!! Ever!

While in town for a work convention my partner and I stopped by for dinner. We were on a budget due to being on work time. Fortunately we both had a decent amount of food for about $50. 
The sushi itself was a bit pricey; $8 for an order of salmon sushi. However, their cut rolls were the right price for the money. I had two full sized cut rolls for about 25. Not only was the price right, the chow was DAMN tasty. One roll had a house sauce made of a spicy mayo mix. YUM!!!
The one down fall was the sake. I didn't notice a house sake and the cheapest bottle was $10. Now please keep in mind I'm only criticizing this because I'm on the work budget. $10 for a bottle of good sake is very reasonable. I definitely recommend this place for the location; right off the strip; the price, the menu and the quality of the chow. DO IT!!!!
Best sushi in the world!!!!! Now my favorite and it makes you happy because it's so cool inside! EAT HERE!!!!
Decent place... rolls have way too much rice. I mean jeez the rolls were huge! Needed a knife to cut them in half. Flavor was good though. Service was extremely slow.

Good sushi spot close to the strip but not directly on the strip. Prices are much better than on the strip. Very cute decor and clean. We came on a Thursday night and it was not busy. We were seated immediately and got our food quickly. We ordered miso soup, edamame, teriyaki bowl and two tempura rolls. The food was fresh and tasted great. We will come here again the next time we're in Vegas.
The sushi here was horrible! We ordered two rolls, the dragon roll and California roll.... Both were so small! It's not worth your money.

This place has roaches crawling on the bar and into the food prep area! Who knows what else they have crawling around into the food prep area and pay no attention to. 
We picked this sushi location based upon the positive reviews. It was a cute location and appeared to be clean. We sat at the bar and once our food was served there was a roach crawling on the counter that ventured into the food prep side. The guys who make the sushi saw this and made no attempt to find the roach. They went back into the kitchen and started laughing and came out after laughing and acted like nothing was wrong. We were so disgusted that we had to leave. Never going back again. Obviously food cleanliness is not a priority for this restaurant.
Awesome late night sushi place ! Very attentive servers ! Sushi taste so fresh as well.. Both kaizen locations are awesome !

This was my 2nd visit to Kaizen, the first being a few months ago while visiting Vegas. Both times, we were able to get seated right away, the service was really good and the food even better! This time we sat at the bar and the sushi chef was very friendly and helpful picking some popular items. I'm pretty sure after each bite I said "ridiculous" to my boyfriend. Ridiculous = ridiculously delicious. It wasn't inexpensive, but the rolls are really big and everything tasted fresh and unique. The flavors and sauces were so good that I didn't use soy sauce or wasabi for any of it. Can't wait to go back!

The ambience was great! The layout of the restaurant has wood polished tables and benches in the middle while the back wall has booths and the front has a long sushi bar. I went with my son and wife. We ordered Unagi, sashimi appetizers, pork ribs, and Kaizen roll. The food was fresh and prepared well. The ribs took longer to cook then we expected. Overall a good experience.

When I am in Vegas for business I will usually make sure I check out Kaizen. I have brought co-workers as well as my wife here a few times and no one was ever disappointed. The prices are not as bad as on the strip, but a little higher than off the strip. The sushi menu is very extensive with items you will not find at other sushi restaurants. There are a few all you can eat places in Vegas, which Kaizen Fushion Roll and Sushi is NOT. Overall, I always enjoy coming here and it is easy to find as it is in a plaza across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino. They have a few TV's with sports on them usually, and play modern music. The Atmosphere is very modern and clean. I would recommend this place to someone looking for Fusion Sushi.

Place is clean and somewhat quiet.  The service was prompt.  Food did not disappoint.  Prices on the high side for the ambiance, location and the food itself, which is tasty, but not comparable to an equivalent sushi place on either coast of the US for the same price.
Always good food and good service. Love the lobster tempura roll. The miso soup is delicious too.
Amazing sushi. My favorite was the Hawaiian but I also loved the tuna tataki roll and Mexican fiesta roll. I would definitely come back if I am in Vegas again.

Lots of selections and everything is good! Shogun roll and dragon roll are so delicious!! The atmosphere the the place is decorated really nice. Price is very reasonable for good sushi! Love the music too. Awesome place!

Hmm I love sushi so always willing to try a new sushi place. On a friend's recent birthday we decided to stop here after enjoying Yelp's happy hour at Rumor. Perhaps it was a big mistake to come to sushi hungry after indulging in quite a few drinks. Let's just say it would have been beneficial for us and our pocket books to do AYCE elsewhere. Between 3 of us, we graciously cashed out at $100 on sushi on individual rolls not AYCE. Well it wouldn't have been that bad, however, when most AYCE places are around $24 a person, it would have been cheaper to go elsewhere! The rolls were enjoyable but not mouthgasmic and overpriced. I do give them credit for surprising the birthday girl with a tempura green tea dessert, which we enjoyed greatly. I'll stick to my sushi joints off the strip.

This place is awesome! I've been here a few times already and haven't been disappointed.. They have a variety of sushi rolls for everyone and it's worth every penny.. Taking another trip here with my girls the next time in Vegas!

The food is good! Ingredient fresh and the rolls are innovative . Out me first tune coming here , friend different rolls and is definitely it something you can find in a regular Japanese food restaurants. Location is convenient with ample of parking . Spacious seating And the services are attentive .

Good quality and creative interpretations.  Ambiance was good for a social gathering on a Monday night, but not too loud. The limited beer and saki selection was the only gripe I had, but by no means a show stopper.

Excellent sushi bar. Had just checked into Hard Rocky Hotel across the street and was very Hungry. Kaizen filled the bill. We had rolls and regular sushi. Everything was delicious and service was outstanding. We sat at the bar. Also, house sake was delicious.

Great sushi restaurant, just behind the Hard Rock Hotel on Paradise.  

I live here in Vegas, and like most other locals, I hardly ever eat on the strip.  I will usually only go to the strip to eat at Joes Stone Crab in the Forum Shops.  It's great to find nice restaurants like Kaizen to eat at when you're in the area.

The prices are not half as bad as Sushi places on the strip and the quality is excellent!  

My servers name was Sumi, probably misspelled.  It was the best service I've ever had in any kind of Japanese restaurant, I will definitely be going back again.
I love how this place is open late, the ambience is great and ALL their rolls are good! They have a banana roll which was surprisingly pleasant

By simply crossing Paradise Road, I'm pretty sure we ate two or three times the amount of sushi we would have received for the same price in the Hard Rock. 

Service was SUPER fast. That probably contributed to why we kept ordering roll after roll... we arrived hungry, and the food emerged as each dish was ready, seemingly two beats after we'd spoken the words. Delicious spicy hamachi, tuna sashimi in garlic ponzu, rainbow roll, unagi, various maki of salmon persuasions, I could go on... The vegetarian among us was also pleased with her rolls. I was quite impressed with the freshness of the fish (a feat of modernity I've never gotten over since inhabiting landlocked states).  

Even after several add-ons to our orders, sake for the table, and mango mochi, the total bill was still impressively moderate. Unless your heart is set on Nobu, give Kaizen a try. Just be careful of those speed-demons tearing across Paradise.

I had friends in town and wanted to find a local sushi place. Walking inside to a very clean decor relived the stress of a sub par sushi restaurant hole in the wall.  At first glance I was impressed! The service was good with very attentive servers. The sushi selection is above average and the sake was good! I would definitely revisit for a casual dinner.

Came here for lunch before leaving Vegas. The service was pretty fast and friendly. We ordered the miso soup, spicy tataki, salsa dancing roll, beef tataki, and the poke appetizer. All were pretty good, especially the poke.

The decor inside was very nice. When you stepped inside, everyone welcomed you even the chefs. You can hear music  playing along with the music video displaying on one of their walls. 

The waiter did not sat us down. He just went off and lay down the menus without even a heads up that it was our table. Seems like he really wanted us to leave, since he came by every minute to ask if we were ready. When we were finally ready to order, the waiter was glancing out the door and was waiting for other customers, which was so rude. One of the workers had to personally go up to the waiter and tell him that we wanted to order. Never experience this kind of situation in my life but it is what it is. 

The food tasted great. If you order stuff that is not in the menu book, the portion is quite big. The busser would always come by and refill our drinks, which was very nice of him. 

When more customers come in, the waiter paid even less attention to us. One of us had to stand up and get him so we can have the same attention as others.

Overall I like their food, but seriously the service is horrible.
Always ALWAYS the best! Kiss of Fire, Orange Blossom, Avocado Train.... and everything else.... just ridiculously awesome!

My bf and I were staying at the Hard Rock and we walked across the street to get lunch and saw this place and since we are hard core sushi lovers we gave it a try. Their menu is pretty big, they have a lot to choose from..My fav was the Las Vegas roll. I say if you are staying at Hard Rock and are in the mood for some good sushi go there.. prices are okay not too bad (compared to the bay area) lol...
Good food and music with friendly staff. Fun environment no issues.  Loved the miso soup and tempura with the salmon rolls! The decor is awesome.
I don't normally write reviews but this is the best sushi that I've had in years.  Try one of the restaurant's special rolls.

This place is one of the best sushi spots in Vegas!!!  When this place is packed or just has a few people scattered through the restaurant, the service is always the same......efficient and  amazing!  I've never had to wait more than a minute before someone comes up to greet me which is a rare thing these days.  The sushi rolls are unique, beautiful, and all have such diverse tastes.   When I have gone there by myself the sushi chefs are great at making you feel welcome and are very interactive, they are the same when I have gone with someone as well but are great for the lone ranger who's out looking for a great dining experience. I highly recommend this place for any local or if you are visiting, it will become you new fav sushi spot or at least be added to your list for sure!  LOVE ME SOME KAIZEN!  Keep up the great work you guys!
Come to Kaizen when you're in Vegas or you're missing out! Great atmosphere and friendly customer service!

We went to Kaizen because we got a recommendation from a local! So so glad we went. We got a sashimi platter and some nigiri and the fish was so fresh. We also got a few rolls. I believe one was the orange blossom. The sushi chef was awesome and he made us two rolls by our request.  We had a blast and did some saki bombs as well. This place is priced reasonably for Vegas and has awesome service. We will definitely go back when we are in Vegas again.
I had the chicken katsu bowl for lunch, it was great, portion size was big, tasted great. We ordered a ton of sushi and it was amazing. I recommend the sexy maguro roll.
I am blown away at how awesome they deliver with good food. The avocado train is amazing with the softshell crab the rainbow roll sexy roll, if you love sushi this is heaven on a plate!!
Great all you can eat, amazing Saké, have never tried a roll I didn't like ! Service is fast and friendly and location isn't too far into the strip but still great view of hard rock and other casinos
We ALWAYS come to this sushi place when we are in Vegas.  NEVER a disappointment.  Service is great and they will fabricate any type of roll you want, just tell them what your tummy desires.  =)
We called last minute for a table of 20 and they graciously accommodated us.  Not only was the food phenomenal, the service was even better!  Definitely will be coming back when in town.

The Rose roll is something else.  Seriously.

I went here with my cousin because he raved about the place for a long while, claiming it was the best sushi he's ever had.  Since he's from the West Coast and I'm a Midwesterner, I decided I had to see about this for myself.  Not sure if it was the saki bomb or the sushi itself, but damn, it was good.  A little on the pricey side for what you get, hence the 1 star reduction.  I guess that's in comparison to the sushi prices I'm used to in places that aren't Vegas, so it's probably good for Vegas prices.  But I'll definitely be back if I ever find myself in Vegas again, as unlikely as that is.
The freshest sashimi and most amazing sushi creations I have had in the US! I highly recommend coming here if you live in, or are visiting Vegas.  If you like Uni, they have the best!

I go here on every trip to Vegas. Every roll I have tried has been fantastic. Not the most fancy looking for the outside (strip mall) but inside is very hip and service is excellent. Ninja roll, unicorn roll and mango and lobster roll are a few of my favorites!

this is one of our favorite dinner hangout spots in vegas!!!

great hours, great location, great atmosphere, great service, great food/sushi! 

tons of sushi options and if you want something that isn't on the menu-- the chefs are great and will make whatever you want!

 can't wait to go back!!!!
I love this place and have been coming here for years, I am a sashimi girl and they have a great sashimi selection. I also like that they are open late. Also the new dessert menu is awesome.

I'm based in LA and have become a sushi snob.  I was in Vegas and craving sushi and thought I would take a chance at Kaizen b/c a local recommended the place to me.  My skepticism quickly disappeared - this place is amazing!!!  I continue to yearn for their seared ono - I have yet to find another restaurant who makes it as perfectly as they do.  

This place is perfect for a date or a big group.  Highly recommend!!!
Urban warehouse ambience. Great selection of rolls, bowls, and plates. Tokyo roll had lots of fresh fish. Large variety of full types.

this place is awesome! i'm always satisfied to find pretty good sushi for good prices, so that i found here ridiculously yummy, beautifully prepared sushi for very reasonable prices, i was totally stoked. 

whatever you do, order the Avocado Train, i think it's called - it will break your heart. the yellowtail with jalapeno is perfection, and the grilled ika is scrumptious!! 

i'll be back every time i visit vegas ...

I really enjoyed this sushi spot!!!  I went here with my girlfriends at midnight on a Sunday night.  The sushi is very fresh and tasty.  I ordered the Salmon Tempura Roll and loved it.  I tried little bites from all my friends' food and it was soooo good. I love how they played music videos! Perfect way to get pumped for a night out.  We walked across the street to party at Hard Rock.  Would definitely go back!
This place is amazing. I order to go all the time. It's consistently good which is hard to do with sushi. The garlic skewers are even better

One of the best sushi places in town. I love the decor of the restaurant and the staff is always wonderful!
I sushi chefs are great and the sushi always taste fresh. They play great music and the vibe is definitely pleasant. My favorite roll is the rainbow roll... you must try :)

This is one of my FAVORITE Sushi spots here in Vegas!! The very 1st day I flew into Vegas, my roommate Jef brought me to the Kaizen in Henderson and I automatically fell in love!

Kaizen is a very great sushi spot especially for one of the best HAPPY HOUR spots to go to after 12am-4am when your hungry and drunk! Can't beat a buy1get1 for Beer and Sake and $2 Hand Rolls!!

Workers: Very friendly staff and theyre always down to drink with you especially the chefs!! They always make sure you have a great time!

Menu: Its SUSHI!! Its a bit pricey but its worth! Try it and let me know! "First Kiss Roll" is my favorite Special Roll on that menu.. Pretty much everything on the menu is a great pick and I always bring all my out of towners to this spot and they always ask me to take them back again!

Location: Right across of Hard Rock Hotel and down the street from the Macarran Airport! Cant ask for any better. Better than it being off the strip than on the strip or in a high end Casino!

Check it out!!

Nope, not buying it... Non japanese sushi joint with large screen tv playing hip hop music video... Why???? Nice interior though. I usually don't like to give negative reviews... but this wasn't my place (sorry).

I'm writing this review as I'm eating sushi at Kaizen Fusion.  I'm a sushi lover and have tried many Sushi restaurants in LA where I live but this place really rocks. Awesome food at reasonable prices and great friendly service. A+
sushi is a little expensive but I order the teriaki bowl for 10 bucks, and every roll is pretty damn good!
Good price for the amount of sushi given. We really enjoyed their fried avocado! We are from out of town and when we come back we will make sure to stop here!

5 stars for the food and our awesome server, Joon! Came here for late night sushi and he offered excellent knowledge of the rolls and sake. The quality of the food matches the price. Best non ayce place I've had in Vegas!
Great place to hang out.  The sushi is awesome.  Would definitely recommend the scallop volcano sushi. The waitresses are very friendly.
Great little gem open late! I preferred the sushi here than at the upscale expensive Nobu. Fish tastes Fresh and they have an amazing variety.

Yoooooooo this place is the bomb! Im a big fan of AYCE which they offer here, which is awesome!

 Let me be completely up front and honest here, I've been seeing 1 sushi restaurant for years(which will remain unnamed), rarely straying from the exclusivity of our unity. 

The story goes Kaizen is right down the street from my girlfriends house. Naturally I was a little hesitant to go here, what would my other sushi house think? Would they find out? Would they be mad at me, jealous?! I was a complete mess and stressed out about the situation. Non the less I still went.
I nervously ordered the AYCE, immediately putting in an order for a few rolls, then I waited. Within no time my rolls started to be quickly delivered to me. After taking the first bite of the First Kiss roll all my nerves melted away and I was suddenly in a sushi heaven. I'll never forget that first delicious tempura roll from Kaizen, the First Kiss was very much a First kiss from Kaizen to my taste buds.

The Nigiri was so satifying and delicious it may have been made by God himself. Seriously I think God took the form of a sushi chef and made sushi at Kaizen that day. Everything was so delicious, amazing service, friendly staff, and I'm pretty sure god works there on occasion when he's board which happened to be the day I went. 

What are you waiting for?! Go to Kaizen now! The main thing I learned from all of this is that there is room in my life for two sushi houses. I will be back to see you soon my sweet sweet Kaizen.

Their food was great! We had the salmon skin salad. Ate the whole thing. We also order their rolls. Very good too. You will not be disappointed! We are from SF Bay Area. Next time we visit Vegas, this will be our must go Japanese restaurant !
I would recommend this place to any family because they have good food like the udon noodle. It has good service and they are very nice people.

Went after work late to get some sushi to go and some sides!!! The SERVICE WAS AMAZING, it took them just a few minutes to put my order together, the server was so polite and friendly, the food just amazing . I was in and out of there in less than 12 minutes and had 6 different things I ordered . So impressed !
If you're looking for sushi after hours...Kaizen is the place! Good service, clean & the BOMB sushi!! Thanks to the taxi man that took us here, if it wasn't for him I wouldn't of found this place. :)
This place is a must anytime you visit Vegas unless your lucky enough to live nearby. I would buy a second home here just to be close to this place. The rolls and service is amazing!!
The first kiss roll is one of the best sushi rolls I have ever had in my life. The spicy tuna crispy rice is really good too

Lunch at Kaizen?  Heck yeah.  Why does eating sushi on your lunch hour feel so scandalous?  Probably because spending $35 for two people is a little much for lunch hour. lol  It could be worse.

I got the lunch special California Roll with salad and miso soup.  Pretty good.  California Roll was really small but Im not really expecting much for it being the lunch special.  My friend got some sort of dragon roll and sashimi.  Her roll was much bigger than my baby Cal roll.  Both she said was pretty good.

My one gripe for this place is that they don't serve white meat chicken!  I love myself a teriyaki chicken but not with gross dark meat.  I understood back in the day the cheap way to go for these places is the dark meat, but now in a health cautious world a place such as this should have white meat for Gods sake. 

Anyways, food pretty good.  Service good...they guy actually remembered I needed a fork for my salad. hehe  The place is always empty for the most part.  I sometimes wonder why being that its across the street from the Hard Rock.  So yeah just an "okay three star review" because of the "no white meat".  Get with the times Kaizen!
Best late night Sushi in Las Vegas.  Great service every time.  I recommend the rattle snake roll.

I like Kaizen. It's hip, easy to go with a group of friends and they have some interesting rolls to choose from. 
My only issue is that it's a bit pricey for me. Two rolls and a drink - your check is about $40 before gratuity. I'd rather go to an all you can eat sushi restaurant for half that price and pig out! But this place is open super late (4AM) which is a plus for us industry folks who crave sushi right after partying at the club. HEYYY!!!!

This is my favorite sushi place, but they do not have ayce.  It's also great that they open until 6AM on weekend.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  I go here one a week and staff know us as I walk in.  Sushi are always fresh.  I try some dishes from the kitchen and it's all good too.  You Can't go wrong with anything you order on the menu.
Don't bother going here. The workers were rude and unprofessional, the miso soup was old, and the sushi was too fishy and just off. There's too many better places to eat then here.

I recommend the Nevada Roll it was super tasty! I also had the Lobster Tempura Roll, that was just good, not really what I was hoping for. 

BUT THE COSTUMER SERVICE MADE ME WANT TO ROLL SOMEBODY OVER WITH MY CAR! It was Horrible! I sat down at the bar and waited at least 10mins before the sushi chef asked if anyone has even took care of me. I ordered my rolls with him, only for him to delivery the order to a staff member. Even then nobody asked if I needed anything to drink, then the sushi chef had to remind someone to help me. They took forever to clear my area of plates and took forever to give me the check and come to pick it up! I am very unhappy with the Customer service here. 

But the pineapple saketini were great

I really enjoy a sushi fix when in Vegas.  In addition to my standard fare of gyoza and edamame, I have tried a couple different rolls and haven't been disappointed. I haven't eaten in the restaurant, but take-out is quick and the food is packaged for travel well. I will continue to come back.

Excellent food & good service. The men are Japanese (not Korean) & make delicious rolls without packing it with rice. The flavor is balanced and the rice amount is just right. All the raw fish taste well cleaned and fresh.
Amazing food! Pokie bowl was great! Great service, would recommend to anyone that visits Vegas!! You won't regret it
I've been three visits now.  Super great place.   Food is fantastic.  Ambiance is nice and service great.   I'll be back!

I come to this place at least twice a month on late Saturday night because it opens until 6 A.M. on weekends. This place is not AYCE but that's because they offer high quality sushi. I like to get the Unagi Bowl and Miso Soup if I'm trying to get something quick to eat. The presentation of the Unagi Bowl is great and it taste absolutely delicious. My favorite roll here is the Rattle Snake Roll and I get it every time I go. I recommend the Salmon Skin Hand Roll or the Philadelphia Hand Roll, bare in mind that their hand rolls are pretty large! They also offer extremely fresh nigiri and they always have a special fresh fish for the day so be sure to ask! When they have special fishes for the day, they are indeed special because I cannot find some of these fishes at any other sushi restaurants. The Hamachi Kama is also a must, it's perfectly seasoned and grilled and it practically melts in your mouth. They are getting ready for a new location at the Linq so they have been training new waiters so be patient if you get one of the new ones! The sushi chefs are also amazing and have fun personalities if you're sitting at the bar. They like to drink, dance and sing while making sushi! Note, this place is a bit pricy because of the quality but it's worth it!

WOW! This place is so good! The quality is fantastic and there is So much variety!  There is something for everyone. Keep in mind it's near the strip so it is a bit pricey,  but most good sushi is and this place is worth it.
Sushi roll are very tasty, sashimi are fresh. Our favourite dishes are: Kaizen Roll, and spicy tuna salad. So good! My parents love this place!

I was in town last weekend with friends celebrating my birthday (seriously, I'm still waiting on your presents...). I wanted to grab sushi, and not being a Vegas regular, knew I should check out Yelp to see where all you Vegas Yelpers are going.

Our party of 4 got in relatively early for dinner, about 5:00 on a Sunday, and we were the only ones there. We ordered about 10 different rolls, and they were served at a well staggered interval. I'd say 8 out of 10 were delicious, the other 2 average. The tuna, salmon, crab and more were all delish and fresh. We stayed for a few hours, I think we left after 8:00 since we were eating, drinking and having a great time. The wait staff were great, and were in no rush to get us out the door. In fact, they made sure to tell us they were open until 4 AM...so I guess we could've stayed for a while!

Ambiance was interesting. I dig the hip hop music and videos, and even though the place looks a little low budget inside, the food more than makes up for lack of decor. 

Price was super reasonable, we ended up spending about $50 each, but that's with drinks, all of those rolls and a 25% tip. Great value. I will definitely visit this place again next time I'm in Las Vegas. Thanks Yelpers, for helping out a San Diegan in your fine city.
My favorite sushi here in Las Vegas! I'm not sure I have had anything I didn't like! And the one on Eastern has happy hour specials!!

Hands down the best sushi place I've ever been to!!!! Although it is expensive I think you get what you pay for. I would recommend going with at least 3 or 4 people so you can try a bunch of rolls. The place is always busy which is good and they are open realllly late. My favorite roll is the jalapeno popper. Will be back soon.

Great place to eat and enjoy one of the best sushi restaurants in vegas. I always make it a point to eat here at least once every trip. One of the best things about this place is that it's open so late. It is never too late for a snow-corn roll (my fav) or the always-great rainbow roll. 
Also, the decor is pretty nice, as is the music. they have a live dj there and the service is always great.

As a local, I usually stick to what I know, especially when it comes to sushi..my boyfriend and I found this place during our "staycation"..we have come back again and again. The prices are great, hip vibe, excellent sushi menu. We have never ordered the same thing and are very pleased with our yummy choices!! This is our new "go to" place when I don't want to cook :)
Really fast and incredibly fresh. Lots of options to choose from. I'll go again. The staff was very friendly as well.

Fun little sushi spot open late with a casual vibe.  I ordered salmon sashimi and the spicy tuna salad.  Both were delicious. My friend ordered a roll (maybe hardrock roll?) that had lots of fish and no rice which was also tasty.  My complaint is that the prices are too high for a casual sushi spot.  I would come here a lot more if they were more reasonable or if they had a better happy hour.  There are so many great sushi spots in town with better deals unless it's really late i'll probably go elsewhere.  The happy hour starts around midnight and is only 1/2 off on booze and not much discount on any food other than certain hand rolls.

Love this place ! Sushi is yummy and affordable!
Eaten here like every night while working in vegas.

Best sushi on the west coast.  Fish is always fresh and the Korean BBQ roll is fantastic.  Located across from Hard rock.  This place is a must try. Inexpensive especially compared to the strip and a good staff too. Also they are open until 5am so after a late night of drinking definitely the place to be.

We come from LA and eat at Kaizen every time we come to LV at least once if not twice!   We are vegetarian and they accommodate us beautifully!   We love the monkey roll, the soba,  the shishito peppers, the veggie  tempura roll, and the jalapeño tempura roll.   The service is always great and the atmosphere is cool.  We love it! We went last night and will probably go back tonight!  ;)
This place is great. It was located right across from my hotel (Hard Rock). Everything I ordered was absolutely amazing. The rolls are a good size. The service is great. I loved the BBQ roll.

Walked in and was seated almost immediately by the friendly hostess. The ambience was laid back and relaxed. It was busy but you wouldn't notice it much because the service was quick. The noise level was just right. Music wasn't overbearing and the conversations throughout were at a low level. The seating arrangements have options. You can sit at the bar, separate tables, or picnic style table. We had the tuna hand roll, ceviche, and octopus and cucumber salad. The best hands down was the octopus and cucumber salad. It had the perfect blend of sweet, cool, sea, and spicy. The tuna hand rolls were simple but great. No frills, just tuna and rice; the way it should be. The ceviche was delicious but I wasn't too big a fan of the rice noodles inside. But, it was definitely 5 star ready. I will be returning next time I'm in Vegas.
I recommend the avocado train. It has lobster and soft shell crab. Has all my favorite things in sushi rolls in one!
The best sushi place in Lass Vegas!! The service and food are excellent!! I highly recommend this restaurant.
First time here and this place is great. Food is amazing and atmosphere is good. Will definitely be back

Friends and I decided to come here for some sushi since it was close to our place where we were staying at. Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi is located in a little shopping center. Inside they have nice decor with TV's, plenty of tables, a projector screen, and the sushi bar being visible wherever you sit at. The lighting is dim but it had a nice feeling to it. I ordered the KAI and Rainbow roll. Both tasted fresh and it was tasty. I thought the prices of the food was decent. The service was great because you didn't need to ask for a refill and the lady was polite and respectful. If you have a craving for sushi try this place out.

Favorite sushi place by far! I enjoy this location and the one in North Las Vegas. Their garlic edamame is definitely my favorite and would recommend it to everyone. I like going to the one in North Las Vegas because the location is more convenient but also because it has all you can eat.

Cool Sushi spot, right across the street from Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas.

I had sushi at this spot after a gig in Vegas at 4:00am in the morning. Place was jumpin' at 4am....lot's of people out eating sushi in the wee-early early morning hours. Kinda pricey...but if you're really craving sushi late night, this is the spot to go to.

Check my pic....this is one of the rolls I had, Bake Lobster Roll...was pretty good.

If you're a tourist looking for sushi this is only 1 of 2 places farily close to the strip. It's open til 4am Sun-Thurs & til 6am on Fri & Sat. They have quite the selection of rolls. However the rolls are a bit smaller than other sushi places I've been to. The food is good though & comes out rather quickly regardless of what the wait staff tells you. The wait staff is a bit slow at times even when it's not peak hours. Try a saketini if you get a chance they taste a bit like sangria. If you're like me & order a Sapporo you expect it to come w/ a beer glass chilled not a Modelo Especial glass. Deduction of points on that fro me. The atmosphere is well lit. You can sit at a booth area or at a table. The tables are picnic style so you could be rubbing elbows w/ neighbors during busier hours. 
If you're a local this place a bit pricier than other sushi restuarants for less of the food. Again great food, just need to eat more to be full. Normally 2 rolls & an app w/ a beer will fill me up. It took 3 rolls & an app w/ a beer to fill me up here. 
Tried 9 rolls last night out of our group:
Shrimp Killer - Good
Spicy Rainbow Roll - VERY GOOD
Teriyaki Roll - Not so good
Silver State Roll - SO GOOD
Dragon Roll - ok
Avacado Roll - ok
Tiger Roll - Good
Firecracker - SO GOOD

Ok so I am really torn. I came here for my bday party about 2 years ago, and actually had a great time, but came here last night and was really disappointed.

The service was fucking terrible. If you read my other reviews you will see that I am a very forgiving/reasonable person. The host was just plain uninterested and our server could give a shit less. The funny thing is we sat at the bar and the place was not busy. I was blown away, but my friend and I were craving sushi after a couple of drinks, so we decided to go for it.

We ordered a couple of beers and a couple of rolls, which were about 14$ a piece (kinda pricey) but really didnt care because I wanted to let loose. The rolls were really good; in fact we ordered about 5 more between the two of us. 

Ok, so here is the problem.
      1.No interaction from the sushi chefs
      2.The server had a piss poor attitude
      3.I tried multiple times to get recommendations from server and chef with no luck....they just didn't give a shit.

Ive come to a point were i am so sick of incompetent people,uninspired people (hence the reason most of us yelp so we can find no bullshit, highly recommended places to go). Well the unfortunate thing about kaizen is that they have the ability to be great, but the service is just non existent. If this was an instance in which only the sever sucked, I could probably blow it off. But no, this was the whole fucking operation.
    I will never come here again. I have never been so ignored or made to feel so insignificant at a restaurant in my whole life. I will give them 2 stars because the sushi was a sliver above average. Its a shame but the service was unacceptable. Oh and their prices just suck for what you get. Nothing but another glorified "sushi restaurant" in Vegas.

Went in for lunch on a weekday. Had the spicy salmon and Sunrise rolls. Rice was pretty stale--being that it was lunchtime, I'm assuming this was last night's rice :-/

The taste and the freshness of both were good. I was the only one in here so service was not surprisingly good and fast.

Would've given 4 stars if they had fresh rice.
In town for the weekend and we wanted something fast and really good this place did not let me down!!!!!
My fav place in Vegas. Have to try their sushi. I tried their sexy roll and dragon roll. So bomb . I can't believe. Best roll of my life

Last meal in Vegas before heading back to LA.
Kaizen was really close to our hotel and on the way to the freeway. 

It wasn't very busy when we got there so we were seated and served right away. We ordered the sashimi lunch combination, the first kiss roll, and the tokyo roll. The server said she accidentally poured two soups instead of one (claiming that the lunch special comes with one soup). She scored brownie points with that move. 

The sashimi combination was alright. The slices of fish were decent. Not the Best sashimi I've ever had but it hit the spot.

The first kiss roll was pretty scrumptious. Not entirely sure what sauce it's served on top of but it was absolutely delightful. 

The Tokyo roll looked scary. I've never seen a raw fish roll look so slimy before. But the server Shima informed us that there was a mustard ponzu dressing on top of it. Me and my boyfriend only ate half of the roll trying to stomach the unusual slime but the waitress insisted that she still discount the roll from the bill.

To make up for the Tokyo roll, our server brought out a deep fried green tea ice cream covered with whipped cream, cherry and drizzles with chocolate sauce. Never having tried this concoction, we were pleasantly surprised with such a treat. Thanks Shima!

We came in the waiter was very friendly and professional. The seats are very comfortable! We had unicorn roll and chicken yakisoba. It is not our first time to this restaurant. This restaurant has always exceed our expectation!

"Unique Rolls... slightly overpriced"

Unique offering of rolls and specials. Interesting interior, nice staff, easy access but a little overpriced. Try the baked rolls... I was very pleased.

atmosphere: 8
price: 7
food quality: 8
parking: too easy
Been back to Kaizen like three more times now and they never fail to impress me.  My favorite sushi place in Vegas.  Try the mussels.....they're great.
Really great place for that late night sushi craving, good calm vibe and friendly staff.
Staying at the Hard Rock and was in the mood for sushi. Walked across the street and I am glad I did. Food was amazing,fresh and delicious.

Seguimos novamente a indicação do Yelp.

Nossa melhor experiencia em Las Vegas em termos de Sushi.
Super good. Have not been diappointed by anything we have had. Totally recommend this place.

I wasnt wild about this place. I have 3-4 different sushi dishes and none were great. All were pretty average and forgettable. I was also kinda blown out by the bar bill, so didn't leave me feeling like I will be back. There are many better places in town.
Philadelphia sushi was good. Their BBQ Pork Ribs was very tender! Our server, Mai, was very nice.
I thought I have reviewed this place many times but it's asking me for one again. This place has consistency and large portions and decent prices.  I send everyone I know there!! No complaints ever!!

In Vegas not really knowing the sushi scene, so I relied on yelpers to give some recommendations.  This is a gem of a place that is solid and creative, about 1 mile off the strip.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are above average.  You'd pay almost twice the amount on the strip.  I'm a huge sushi fan in places all over the country.  Excellent dining experience.
Fantastic place to take a lunch break on a hot afternoon. Very quick service and tasty items. Great ambiance as well!

We went here one night very late.... though it's more expensive than other sushi restaurants we like here in vegas it was delicious. We indulged in a couple bottles of sake and had some of their rolls and sashimi. This place is a classier atmosphere, definitely a good place to bring a date. But as far as pigging out on Sushi... I wouldn't go too hungry unless you want to get a big bill.

Hands down an awesome sushi bar! We were staying at the Hard Rock Hotel and saw this place across the street. Boy are we glad we tried it. The menu was a bit overwhelming since it was our first time there. The server was very nice and great service. She made a few suggestions and they were so good! Their prices are typical of sushi places. Anywhere from $10 and up per roll. 

We tried a baked scallop roll that was full of scallops. The don't skimp on their ingredients and I love that. I tired a lobster and crab roll wrapped in halibut...FRESH! We also tried their banana roll. Different because it was slightly sweet and savory. 

I love the fact that there are real Japanese people working there and making sushi. Maybe it makes it feel more authentic. You just feel like you get the whole experience versus a Mexican guy making the sushi for you. Even though he probably has no problems making delicious sushi.
The atmosphere is excellent! Love the decor and the bar situation. I had the beef udon and i loved it. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal.

This is my go to sushi restaurant when I want better quality sushi than you get at all you can eat. The food is always really well prepared and the chefs do a great job. I've become close with most of the employees and I'd recommend Kaizen to anyone!

Who doesn't love Kaizen!?!?!?  It's convenient, consistent, and the food is fresh!  Service is always top notch and although they don't offer AYCE, I still walk out very full for about $25.  The staff is really polite and always on top of their game, even when it's super busy and they are clearly understaffed.  The waiters and waitresses they have know the entire menu and restaurant very well + their regulars.  The best thing about this restaurant is the layout and seating options.  When I dine with friends where we will be talking a ton and want a more private area, the tables on the left offer a nice view of the restaurant without all of the noise and busyness.  When I come alone I either prefer the bar top or the long tables on the main floor area, depending on the mood I am in.  

I love the music here and although it can seem a little bit loud sometimes when the restaurant is full and Lady Gaga is playing over the sound system to add to the noise, it somehow seems fitting to the energy of the servers here.  

I really do wish Kaizen would start doing an AYCE menu at least during certain hours.  Their sushi is really fresh and if they offered AYCE, I would likely get more nigiri than rolls as their nigiri and hand rolls seem quite pricey for being so small.

I recently stayed at the Hard Rock on a trip to Vegas, and considering the fact I was on a limited budget, I was very happy to find good affordable sushi across the street from my hotel!

The sushi there wasn't amazing or anything, but it was good and definitely cheaper than a lot of the alternatives in the area.

I come to this Sushi Resturant every time I want sushi. This is the Best in Las Vegas! Everything I mean EVERYTHING is good. My favorite is the Crazy Girl and the Shrimp Lover. The atmosphere is nice, they play good music, the desserts are awesome! Eve
sweetest ppl ever and amazing sushi! we eat here at least once a week!

Decent sushi, but not my favorite. I don't really get the rave reviews. The majority of sushi spots in Vegas are AYCE- and I'm fine going to a place that isn't, but the expectation is that the quality is higher. And while the presentation and service were good, the actual quality of product and freshness of fish seemed average.

When ordering takeout, this spot is great about carefully packing up your order so each roll has it's accompanying sauces alongside- this allows you to control how much is used and prevents the rice from getting soggy on your ride home! 

Menu features a wide range of specialty sushi rolls, and some grilled items and apps as well. Nigiri oddly did not seem to to be that common here. The Kai roll was recommended by staff and the best of what we tried. 

NOTE: Takeout rolls noticeably smaller than what is received dining in.

YUM-o!

my friend & i went here just because we stopped at CVS and was craving sushi. & i tend to be a sushi purist ever since going to Sugarfish in LA but sometimes i want a fatty heap of lobster-crunchy-ricey-mayo- goodness...& hey, I'm vegas! So we go in & mind u, we didnt yelp! it before so we has NO idea what we were getting ourselves into. BUT boy were we pleased. the menu is like a book so good luck choosing one thing. I ended up choosing the Japanese Lasagna, cause well i have never heard of it! and my friend ordered the Silver Plate Roll (for starters we got Monkey Balls and Seaweed salad-- Delish!)... Both dishes were bomb.com but The Japanese Lasagna will rock ur socks off!!! It was soo what i was looking for :)...Sigh, sadly they dont have a place in LA....but I'm sure as hell gonna find a rip-off...or maybe its just a sin city treat? ;)

Delicious! Would definitely visit again.  Their rice was not sticky enough for me and fell apart quickly after picking up w chopsticks.  Had their sushi combo w California roll.  Awesome!

And all this for $10.76...great food at bargain prices
Creative rolls, speedy service!  The only restaurant I HAVE to return to since living in Las Vegas.  And they have amazing hours for the Vegas lifestyle!

Yum-zo!  I'm typically a purist - chirashi, sashimi, miso - sign me up!  But the inventive rolls here caught my eye.  Photos in the menu don't hurt.  Nice, quick friendly service.  I think they put crack in the ceviche (actually maybe just lime and sugar) but I wanted to eat it (garnish and) all.

My friends and I hit up this place at 4am on Saturday night after some hard partying at Blush. The restaurant is slightly off the strip but it's well-worth the $12 cab ride from the Wynn. 

We had a group of 6 and we were seated right away. Our food came super quickly and everything was really fresh...shocking for 4am! 

I had a cucumber salad that was served in a martini glass (super fun). The clam on top was SO fresh. I also had the crazy boy roll which was delicious as well. 

Very reasonably priced. Our waiter even called two cabs for us after we were done. 

Also a plus: this establishment is non-smoking so it was a breath of fresh air...literally! Will definitely go back next time!

This is probably my favorite sushi place ever. It's not close to my house, so I don't go as often as I'd like. But every time I bite into something, I'm like, "THIS is what it's supposed to taste like."The fish is always fresh and buttery. Every roll is perfect. I can't even.

Their sushi was AMAZING! I live here in Vegas didn't even know this place existed. Great food HORRIBLE, RUDE SERVICE which makes me not want to go back.. Whet in a week ago about an hour before closing with a party of 6 our waitress IRENE gave us the worst service from the beginning even though she had an auto gratity already added to our check. Half of us at the table work in the industr and couldn't believe her attitude (rolling her eyes after asking questions in regards to the menu,etc.) I would definitely request a DIFFERENT SERVER if i ever went back.  She ruined our 1st time experience there!

The best value food I've had in Vegas- minus the taxi ride to get there. It's located way off strip- in a 'strip mall' across the street from Hard Rock Hotel. If you are staying at the Hard Rock, simply walk across the street to try the ridiculously good spicy tuna roll covered in tuna and dripping with roe sauce that they call the "Sexy Roll". I also tried the Scallop Volcano- a california roll exploding with tons of cooked mushrooms, scallops and spicy yummy sauce.  There are a lot of unique rolls with chicken or other cooked foods inside.  Sit at the bar and talk to one of the cool Japanese sushi chefs.  Good for large groups coming over from the hotels etc...

Stayed at the hard rock and was craving some sushi! This place was seriously so good! We came around 9pm on Friday. It wasn't busy at all. Service was quick and fish was really fresh. 

We had the -
Paradise Roll
Poke Mix - combo of ahi and salmon
Salmon sushi
Ahi sushi

You should definitely come here if you are in the area! You won't be disappointed.

Great place for the afterclub drunken munchies or lunch with the parents! I can't help but always ordering a snow corn roll and a scallop dynamite. This was the place that put "Vegas Sushi" on the map for me and distinguished it from sushi restaurants in ANY other city.

Not really a fan. I wanted sushi in Vegas and wound up here.  It was in a questionable strip mall.  The long tables were kind of cool and they played rave music with the concert videos in the background. The sushi wasn't to my liking.  I thought it tasted fishy, like in a not fresh kind of way.  I don't know, it wasn't bad, but it wasn't really good either.
Love the late hours and amazing menu! The Rose role and crab salad has it in along with the amazing sake selections
I love this place. I come here often after work and I am always pleased with the food
I had edamame, miso soup and a  BBQ roll. I'm stuffed. The roll was delicious and so were the appetizers. The Mochi ice cream is sweet. The service is fast and friendly.

I love that they are open late, and this is a huge selling point. Decent sushi but very mildly pricey compared to other equal-quality sushi joints (like $2ish more per roll). Consider it a convenience fee for being open late.

Their flavored sake was absolutely incredible. For you people raised in imperial measurements, the 250ml sake is a good quantity for two people who are going to be there for a little bit.

Careful in the parking lot, some folks be crazy due to proximity to the college, the strip, and the roads nearby.
Fun little place with good decor. Sushi is good. BIG variety to choose from. Orange Blossom is my pick. Reasonably priced. Strong on service.

If I could give it 3.5 stars I would! I will start on a positive note, the tuna nigiri melted in my mouth and the service was tag team so never had to ask for any refills. I ordered a few rolls, the ingredients were fresh but it just missed the mark. When you've had exceptional sushi in all parts of the US you know what your looking for. This place may be fun for late night or actually any time if your goal is to lap up the liquids as there was a really rowdy table in the place at 6pm. Lots of colorful loudness while one eats sushi, not my thing!
First time eating here and I was extremely impressed. Very good, large servings. Friendly environment, all around great experience. I will come back soon
Without a doubt the most interesting sushi bar with the freshest fish in Vegas. Never miss a chance to come here when in town.

Wasn't really in the mood for sushi after a long week in Vegas working a trade show, but my pal saw Kaizen in Yelp, and insisted we go. Quiet at 8ish on a Wed. evening (thankfully; woulda had NO patience for a loud party scene that night). The drinks were great and the food was remarkable--fresh, beautifully presented, unusual combinations--all delish. I will definitely return!

Best sushi in Vegas...love this place!!!! The rolls are amazing...cool music/vibe...almost a club scene.  It's understandable why locals come here....
 
Can't wait to come back!!

I love Kaizen!

I'd never been here, but I am always in the area when trolling around for food. Grabbed lunch here the other day for a team lunch at work.

Everything was delicious. The miso soup, the seaweed salad, the various rolls. Try the caterpillar roll, and share it with people. It's foodporn worthy.

Service was fast!

I can't wait to come back.

Sorry this review isn't as novel as my previous ones. I'm close to 400. I don't care. This place is just worth it, and I can't wait to come back!
Wow I love food and I had the blast here food was amazing the Korean bbq roll was just incredible very recommend I will visit again and soon
Not as tasty as i like.

This place is right across from Hard Rock in a shopping center.  Super good rolls although normal to slightly higher priced but very good.  Service was pretty good, I would definitely come back again.  The desert menu is awesome I have never seen so many options at a sushi restaurant which was really cool.  I had the chocolate truffle and it was really bomb.
Excellent sushi! I highly recommend it. Some of the best sushi we have ever had anywhere and we have had Sushi all over the country. Cheers!
another one of my great finds! just like firefly. delicious!  if ur in vegas, def plan a pit stop.
Grabbed some rolls on the way home. Great food & service. Can't wait till next visit. Yummy

Came here late night to eat with the family.
About 5 couples, a family of 4, and 3 people at the bar. Waitress sat us down immediately but after 15 mins no one came to acknowledge that we were even here.
No "hello I'll be with you shortly", no "can I start you guys with some drinks", NOTHING.
I get that there's only three of you, but why bother sitting down somebody you're not even gonna take care of?
Obviously the visit was already at a bad start and I was not happy, after getting the waitress' attention, the one that sat us down -- she asks "has anyone helped us?" LIKE SERIOUSLY?!!!
After 15 mins you FINALLY noticed?!
Food was a hit and miss. 
But honestly it was really hard to enjoy the whole experience with the terrible service provided. A revisit is unfortunately not in the near future..

Well I guess they read my last review because the nigiri sushi list is now taped inside the front cover of the menu!
Another great meal at a very reasonable price per person. We stuffed ourselves for about $40 each. 
Lots of choices. Nicely divided menu by type of roll - fried, tempura, etc.
Much better value than the high end places in the hotels nearby. 
Open late so you can eat a nice meal after a very long day working.
Love this place! Huge selection! Something everyone will love! Wish I lived closer, I will definitely come here again when I'm in town next!
Sushi is great! Good quality food. Restaurant is nice and clean. Absolutely loved the Strawberry Mochi!!

Perhaps one of the worst dining Experiences I've had in a long time.  I was part of a large party.  First they got the orders wrong.  Then their Chicken Katsu was dry and tough as shoe leather.  Then came the bill, which they didn't have correct and couldn't separate successfully.  To add insult to injury after each person telling the cashier what they had (in order to pay correctly) they insisted that they were going to add their automatic gratuity to each bill.  #nevergoingback

This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in Vegas. Service is always good along with the wide choices of fusion rolls. Money well spent for the quality! Serving size is generous and the variety keeps me coming back to try new items on the menu.
Love this place the food is awesome the sushi is so fresh, we watched then cut the fish.  Best sushi in Vegas by far.
Nice interior with good service, waitors and waitresses are the best thing in this restauran
Best sushi I have had anywhere in the U.S.  The service was outstanding as well. You must give it a try! I will be back every time I'm in town.

Fantastic and authentic sushi, and good sake selection. Staff is very friendly and helpful.
The menu has all the staples and is also very creative, the Spider Mania roll and Monkey Brain are amazing!
Kiss of Fire roll was not that great, but the service was prompt. Appreciated the late open hours. There probably are better options in town for sushi.
Great sushi spot! The white rose and Unicon rolls were awesome. The kaizen roll was good too. Everything was really fresh. Good service. Prices were pretty good too. Will definitely go back.

I absolutely love this sushi restaurant! I have eaten at Nobu , Katsuya, and Koi. This place is definitely the same quality of food and service is great! It's my second time here and everytime I come to Vegas from now on I'll definitely be stopping in. I ordered the spicy yellowtail roll and the crunch scallop it was delicious

I was staying at the nearby Hard Rock Hotel and the dealer overheard my party discussing whether or not to put in a reservation for Nobu that same evening.  She recommended that we come to Kaizen instead, strongly insisting that we could get the same quality sushi for a quarter of the price.  I was sure she was exaggerating, but figured that if her recommendation fell somewhere in between complete hyperbole and the truth it would still be a worthwhile risk.

This was one of the best meals I've ever had in my life, and Kaizen will be on my go to list whenever I'm in Vegas.  They have more "riceless" rolls than I have ever seen, each one more delicious than the next - this isn't the typical crab meat stuffed into a cucumber you'll get at most sushi restaurants.  The Scallop Volcano Roll integrated mushrooms in a manner I had never before seen at a sushi restaurant, and I'm not ashamed to add that I was drinking the mushroom broth afterwards like soup - it was simply amazing.

Is the quality better than Nobu?  Of course not.  Is the taste on par?  Yes, definitely.  Add in the 2 for 1 happy hour and this is the best combination of value and taste in Las Vegas.

-got takeout from here late at night

-they specialize in specialty rolls (you know the ones with all sorts of fish and different sauces covering them)

-would come here again if I was staying at hard rock

-parking lot is kind of busy

Went here 2 weeks ago as Gangnam Asian BBQ had an hour wait at 9pm on a Sunday.  Based on other reviews, looks like they get overflow from Gangnam often.  Food is mediocre, although plentiful.  Service is friendly but we had different wait staffs coming by.  They check on you verbally but they don't seem to notice that your drinks get low! Overall very average, we don't intend to come back.

Their sushi is nothing special and its rather over priced for what you get. The happy hour over at the Henderson location is better for getting drinks before hitting the club (10p-2a). The only thing this place has going for it is that it's open late.
Off the strip and reasonably priced. Friendly wait staff. The saketinis and avocado train are must-haves!! Absolutely delicious.
Good select of sushi rolls, and they came out pretty quick. Service is good. Restaurant ambiance is higher end, reflecting traditional Japanese with a modern flare.

I am new to sushi and the chef helped guide to some great choices. Very friendly and mellow vibe. I will be back before I head home. Nice happy hour with buy one get one drinks. Girlfriend like the decor.

Very good menu and great service!!!! Don't sleep best sushi in Vegas!!!! Don't sleep on this jewel! Very food happy hour menu as well as regular! Very close to casinos and a lot cheaper! If you want good sushi try this place!

A-OK sushi place located across the street from Hard Rock. The sushi prices are a little steep but im sure its because of the high rent location. The quality of the sushi was just ok and the decor was boring. The service was a little slow and had to order not from the sushi chef but a hostess/server. Dont think i will be back if i am in the area and want sushi.

We're in Vegas for a volleyball tournament at UNLV and chances upon Kaizen and WOW!! what a find! The salmon nigiri was excellent.  Crispy rice was delicious along with great hand rolls. :) Great atmosphere!

Where do i start.. Kaizen Sushi is a Japanese restaurant  in front of the hard rock casino. Or at least it tries to be.. First, it's korean owned (like most sushi places..
In case you didn't know, sushi rolls were invented in korea, not japan), they serve Japanese food, but not traditional Japanese cuisine, if that's what you're looking for (try Ichiza). I came here for sushi, and to my dissapointment, the sushi was not fresh, I've been here twice and both times the fish was old.. From tuna to uni, the sushi was old and dry. Not to mention the size of their cuts.. For the price they charge they should at least make up for quantity. I've had an order of $6 nigiri that filled me up more than their $22 chirashi bowl (mix sushi bowl). Ok maybe not... but you get the idea.. The only reason why they dont deserve a 1 star review is the fact that they have friendly people working there, and they are open later than most sushi places in vegas (they close at 4am).. so prepare to order a couple of Sapporo's and Sake, and hope it makes the food taste better.

Came here for dinner for the first time. No wait. ordered our food. our hot sake and beer, appetizer, and one of our entrees came out. Forty minutes later, still no food. We ask our server to check up on it. He never came back. We asked another server and he took care of us. Eventually we got all our food and he gave us 3 more hot sakes on the house, which made it a little better. I was super hungry to begin with, so I was not in a good mood at all and I couldn't enjoy the sushi I ordered because I ate everything so fast. This review is based mainly on poor customer service. Food was average.

This is my favorite Sushi place here Las Vegas. The ambiance is cool and modern contemporary. The servers are friendly and attentive. But most of all, the food is great. Fresh and delicious. I highly recommend this place.
Delicious! Only a few people when we came at 5:30 on a Wednesday. Service was really fast and the quality of the sushi was good. We got a Rattle Snake, Banana, and Mango Lobster rolls.
Large menu and very accommodating staff. My meal was excellent plus it is bogo after midnight on drinks Sunday- Thursday.
Amazon yellowtail ... amazing everything. This is my second time here. Orange blossom is the go to, but if that is not your thing, everything is fresh and great quality sushi.
This was an enjoyable experience... Sushi was great and they were playing hip hop?!? Like Whoa!!!! I am definitely coming back!!

Very clean and modern ambiance. Friendly staff and well priced rolls. They offer a diverse combination of rolls with various seafood and meats, as well as entrees, desserts, and drinks. You can sit at the bar or tables.

I was disappointed when I came in there to eat horrible service I was just sitting there waiting for sombody to take my order or ask me if I need anything and for 25min nobody said anything just looked at me so I got up and walked out in I will never go eat there and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
Hands down the best sushi in vegas. Been going here for years! Also be sure to try the avocado train or the scallop volcano roll! Awesome staff!
Unique menu. Lots of interesting choices. Simple but cool atmosphere. Quick service and a great place to go before a flight. Have been here 3x.

My favorite sushi bar in Vegas! I've been multiple times and the food has never disappointed. The prices are reasonable. The drinks are good. It's right across the street from The Hard Rock. It's easy to find but not overly crowded. A must stop for me!

Been here before food is ok not the best sushi rolls in town for sure . This time I sat at the bar And sushi chefs were totally out of touch and I practically had to yell at them to get my rolls, but the retarded thing is me and my friend were the only guys at the freaking bar.

This place is sooo good.  They have a large variety of rolls, and they are almost all delicious.  It's a great place for a small group of 4-5, and they stay open really late.  We always go when we visit Vegas.  And for the people who don't like rolls, the entrees such as teriyaki chicken and udon are good as well.  They flavor the veggies and udon very well.  

Our favorites:
Lasgana Roll
Avaocado Ball (kinda pricey but totally worth it)

Skip the shitake mushroom roll.

Every time I come to Las Vegas I tend to stop in here for a  meal.  It's never a disappointment.  Always seems to be so fresh.  It's Amazing to me how the desert seems to get stuff shipped so that it's as fresh.  Theres a nice selection of fish here and if you're into rolls it won't disappoint.  Also a good selection of sake and a few Japanese beers.  But do stay away from the chicken Karaage until they figure out their seasoning which makes the chicken dry as f_ _ _ !   Trust me on that or if not, at least ask if it's dryyyyyy!
Horrible service. . I am accustomed to being told of sushi bar specials and chef's recommendations.if  you want cheap bad service ..this is then your spot. . DON'T WASTE YOUR  TIME...

Kaizen is great. 5 Stars and great for late night dining. 
I love the rolls and chicken teriyaki. Big portions.

the sushi was a'ite.. but way way way overpriced.  we've had better at an all you can eat joint.  

it's clean.. and the service is good,  but nothing wowed me or made it stand out... the names of the sushi were clever!  i'd probably never go back.  plus i think it's overpriced.

it was ok.

Take your time and enjoy the experience... Great sake choices too ;D  It's been a while since I had really great quality sushi; thanks to Mel!  All their rolls are done exquisitely and with great detail.  The menu does provide you ample choices so you should listen to your gut and instincts to choose what you should have.  All in all, the service is extremely attentive and prompt.  If you're not getting your food quick enough, it's most likely due to your indecisiveness in selecting what you want from the menu.  I thoroughly enjoyed myself and would make the effort to wander off the strip to eat here again.  If you're staying at the Hard Rock Casino, it's right across the street in the same complex with CVS.  Enjoy, eat sushi, and please drink some of their wonderful sake too.
So good ! Sushi was perfect had a good waitress everything was prefect l. Will come back and tell my friends

Average sushi at best.  We ordered yellowtail appetizer, Kai roll, Salmon killer, and Kiss of Fire rolls.  Good but not remarkable.

Service was basic.  Recommendations were not anything more than pointing to a menu.

Even the recommended Chocolate truffle dessert was average.

This place is always a must visit when we land in Vegas! The food is delicious and the service is always fun. The lighting makes sets the mood along with the killer music. No matter if you're with friends, family or that special someone, Kaizen is the perfect spot for great sushi and a good time!

This is our to go spot while we are in Vegas. It is a very hip place and it is right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel. The food is excellent and the service is good as well. Will we return? Yes, it is our Vegas sushi place.
Amazing sushi !!! Party of 4 and we were greeted at the best. Great attention from servers. Defenetly come back
I came in around 230p on a Monday so the place was not busy.  Service was good.  The California roll broke too easily but the salmon, tuna and unagi sushi were decent.  Green tea ice cream was good.
I love Kaizen! My girlfriend and I always go here all the time and it's always awesome! The rolls are always great and the decorations and environment is so well done!

Quite possibly the worst sushi we have EVER eaten.The fish wasn't fresh.it was overpriced and amateur.if you wanna call yourself a sushi restaurant....Learn how to make sushi.And  if you can't afford to keep fresh fish in the house.....don't call yourself sushi chefs.Also.I Ordered the seared beef tataki....It came out ice cold.GROSS food.Save your time and your money.This place should shut the doors before they give someone food poisoning.Word to the wise...they order cheap ahi that is not sushi grade and they use it for sushi.Please bring a roll of toilet paper.Your gonna need it when your colon explodes on your ride home.
Don't eat at this joint.seriously.Unless you have an extra three days to spend running to the bathroom......

We came late on a Friday evening and were seated immediately. The sushi and sashimi were incredibly fresh tasting and the rolls very tasty with fast and friendly service.  The ambience is contemporary, inviting and romantic. They have a nice selection of desserts. We had the chocolate truffle and it was so delicious. We wanted to lick the plate! They are open until midnight and off the strip with ample parking so easy in and easy out. Definitely recommended!

Came in on a Sunday evening for dinner and was greeted well and seated quickly. Not a super busy place during the evening/dinner time which is nice because we needed someplace low-key to eat. Being from the Pacific Northwest, I am picky with seafood and sushi and I was impressed with the sushi here. The tuna was very fresh and the roll was made well. My friend got salmon and it was delicious and fresh. The price is not crazy which is also what attracted us here. Overall great place to have a low-key dinner.
Tried this for something new near UNLV. Delicious!! The Chicken Terriyaki Roll was yummy and the veggie tempura was great.
Great place to eat with friends. Food was good from soup to entree. Service was also good and reasonable. Would definitely come back to this place and grab more sushi and katsu!
You must try the Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna. Very fresh. Also they have a great happy hour on weekdays.

Ambience: Solid A here. The lighting is dim, and makes for an intimate feel. Decor is simple with traditional Japanese and modern touches.

Service: It's an overall B to B-. The hostess and wait staff is friendly and just the right amount of attentive. Sushi chef was cold. I am so used to friendly, outgoing sushi chefs, so while he was by no means rude, his customer facing skills leave something to be desired.

Sushi: And of course the most important aspect of. Sushi restaurant. Unfortunately, this is a C to C+. As a frequent sushi nosher and lover or nigiri, I was more than a little disappointed. What I ordered: salmon, yellowtail belly, uni, and unagi. The unagi was the best of the 4. But honestly, it's pretty touch to mess up since its BBQ'd. Flavor was good, although the unagi sauce was cloyingly sweet. The salmon was second best. Standard. Not bad, but not great. Slightly flavorless. The yellowtail belly and uni were terrible. I was really looking forward to the buttery fattiness, but found it entirely flavorless and stale (the ends were hard which I've never experience with sushi). To be honest , I choked down the uni. Sad because it's one of my favorites to order. It had an odd metallic flavor that again, I've never experienced. Additionally, the nigiri itself was really sloppy. Most all fell apart as soon as I tried to pick them up with my chopsticks.

Wish I could have given it at least 3 stars, but the food quality is obviously a big factor. I've been here a few times, so this isn't based on a one time experience.
This restaurant has good decor, nice ambiance and looks very clean and hip!  Food is excellent so stop by and get your sushi fix on!  Service is excellent by Ivan!!
A Very solid sushi experience. Nice variety of rolls and other traditional dishes on the menu. Fast and polite service. Not bad considering it's in Vegas.

I know everyone 'loves' Kaizen, but I've been here a few times (7-8) and I've never really loved it.  The eastern location is better though bc they do have the half price sushi but still.  Their sushi is high priced, and they dont have all you can eat, so you end up spending a fortune.  The few good things I've had were the jalapeno roll, which was actually really good, but I feel this place is more 'americanized' sushi which I hate.  I love authentic food, but this place is just ok.  I hate to give a less than spectacular rating, but I've never had a great meal from here.  If you come here for late night sushi, hit up musashi! Its down the road on paradise and way better! They have happy hour EVERY night from 11pm-3am.  

The service has always been good, but the food is just ok to me.

When it comes to food service and price point I would give Kaizen Fusion Roll five stars as far as customer services goes however they'll come in rolling at a 1 lowly star. So this review will average itself out at 3 stars. 

Here's the situation. My friend and I went driving around looking for a place to eat at around 4a and yelped the nearest location. Boom Kaizen popped up near UNLV. 

The food, for the price is awesome, I got a baked salmon roll. Delicious. Unlike all the other all you can eat places here and original. He got some type of calamari roll and something else. 

Adding an $11 lychee flavored sake and a green tea tempura ice cream (but they don't serve vanilla flavor which didn't really make any sense to me but who am I...) who couldn't be more pleased?

Well... let's start from the beginning. 

The serve here was beyond poor. Upon entrance the two girls that we were working had just the most unengaging attitudes and missed so many marks. I had to ask 3 times for the same 7UP, the miscommunication was so obviously there that the poor service just had to be mentioned.

I mean and I'm not to be a stickler about table courtesies, but all the servers that took our dishes away or served us just stuck their whole bodies right between both my friend and I - based on my memory as a server, aren't you supposed to come around the side or wouldn't that just make more sense? Anyway - it was an odd experience. Given I understand it's 5:30 in the morning at that point everyone wants to go home and they're shoving people out, but the place is still an establishment and the restaurant clearly strategically placed itself across certain hotel&casinos for a reason, but the place was dead on a Saturday night for obvious reasons...
