I mean it's obviously not the food, the food is great and decently priced.

Worth it if it's LAST LAST minute late night dinner and you're near the UNLV campus.

WORST customer service ever. I got there one night and paying the bill, I was told my credit card was declined. So I gave another one. The day after I checked my bank account and noticed I was charged on BOTH cards. I called and I was told to wait few days and the charge on the first card would have disappeared. I waited... nothing changed. I wanted to talk with the manager, but apparently this guy is NEVER available. I called and went there in person several times with my bank statements printed out, none could solve the issue. Eventually spoke with the manager, who told me to send to his email copy of my bank accounts with the statement showing (like I have all this time to waste? Do they think Im making this whole deal up for 26$? What about giving me a free meal and PEACE OUT?). I did emailed him all documents...He NEVER answered back. Called again, he was not at the restaurant. I'm so pissed that I've wasted all this time and got robbed. It's just unfair. Be aware of how they treat their clients!

This place it's amazing the food and the service are awesome. Every time we come to the Platform show in August we have dinner here! You can't miss the Spicy Tuna Salad and the Avocado Train delicious. We were there last night a have a great time! If you stay at the Hard Rock it's waking distance!

It is the second time we have been here. Really good service and good. I like the chicken karaage most since it's really unique! Slightly breaded but superb juicy! Surely, it will be better if you order two bottled beers during their happy hour.
Good place especially for groups.  Pretty solid sushi and although it's in a strip mall, I actually prefer it since the prices are reasonable and it's nice and low key.
Mmmm.... I had the green chili tempura roll salmon nigiri and a California roll. Everything was delicious! Great service...

Great restaurant just 5 minutes off the strip. The sushi was excellent and moderately priced. The total was probably half what it would have been at a more well known sushi bar in Vegas. Service was also excellent, the waitress was right over when our glasses were low to refill them. Highly recommend and will return next time I'm in town.
Delicious. Enjoyed the octopus sushi, salmon sushi and shrimp tempura roll. Really good udon. Nice chicken curry rice. Good meal, service & atmosphere.
Been here a number of times over the past few years. Always a must have.  The service is great and the food is amazing.

Best Sushi I've ever had.  Yes, I'm sober.  I travel frequently, and this is without a doubt the freshest salmon I've ever had.  
-salmon tataki
-sunset roll
-kiss of fire

You're welcome.
Yum! Great garlic edamame, wonderful fresh sushi, and the ceviche was delicious. Cool vibe, creative menu.
Great food... we stop by 3 time a year. We are from cali. Love Las vegas. I bring customer all the time from local to international all of them love the spot.
The sushi was delicious and the service was excellent. Great atmosphere and I will definitely recommend to a friend!
It is close to the hotel and convenient.  It fulfills food needs and in a tasty fashion.  But compared to other sushi places it is ok.  Let's leave it at that.

It's really hard to find a great sushi place that's consistent. I purchased a Groupon for this place since it was close by my house. I took a friend for lunch and we were told we don't get the special lunch prices if we use a Groupon. So in the end, it really didn't save us any money. Regardless of that, we were one of two parties there during that time and our rolls were delivered far apart. Plus, all of the rolls were so-so. I wouldn't go again.

Came in a few times with my boyfriend, once with his dad & another time with our friends. Both times the food was tasty- our favorite was a  salmon roll topped with a creamy sauce and macadamia nuts, and this has been the only place to have it. But at $20 per roll, it's the kind of place we go to only when we'll be sharing with many people. It's close to my work and open late, which is great considering I get off work around late some days- but if I can't afford to eat there then it's not a viable option. 

The interior is nice, with long wooden tables and an open feel despite the small size. The music doesn't really jibe with the asian food theme, and there are large TV screens along some of the walls playing random video.

Overall the food is tasty but expensive. For the same price range I could have multiple courses at Ichiza. The salmon killer roll IS especially good, so I would go back for that sometime, but expect the bill to run a bit high. It can also be awkward navigating out of the parking lot given the location and all the one-way streets.

Very quiet when we went in for an early dinner. Right across from the Hard Rock you can walk across the street. They were nice-made us some rolls from a very busy menu of rolls. We ordered a cold sake thought it was coming in a larger bottle, our bad but for the price we asked to just get the LARGE bottle. The next size up. It made sense. So they came and nicely poured a half empty bottle of that sake. Not sure if they poured it out or someone else had a half bottle....Regardless they were happy to do this. When we didn't finish it of course, it was huge, we thought we'd cap it and take it with us to our Hotel. WE do this at every restaurant in SD all the time. Cork your wine and take it with you if you don;t finish it. In Vegas where everyone walks around the streets with alcohol, no big deal right. Well our waiter was happy to go back and put in a to go container but the owner stopped him. Said it was illegal that we couldn't take it with us but he was happy to put our name on it. Well, what when we came back in a few weeks or months.?? He wasn't nice at all, or apologetic. Rude and didn't care really. Totally ruined the feel of this place for me. The sushi wasn't amazing anyways and in Vegas there is an abundance of killer places to eat.

Totally average, non-memorable. I think a lot of other working girls go there. Also the wait staff is beautiful. Nothing to really report other than that.

nice ambiance, upscale motif, a bit classier than most local places tend to be. The Sushi bar is very uncomfortable though.
Transfriendly- A
Excellent food and excellent service. The Kai roll is a must. The location is perfect. Definitely will come back again.

I fell in love with this place when I was working in a Vegas show in 2012. I live in Los Angeles and I visit Las Vegas quite often. There wasn't a single Vegas trip that I didn't stop by Kaizen to have my favorite sushi. I've been to hundreds of sushi restaurants including LA's top rated and most expensive - no one can compete with the taste of food like at Kaizen.
My favorite is a chicken teriyaki bowl and garlic edamame. My spouse loves the avocado train , Palm Springs, orange blossom rolls and pretty much everything else that's on the menu. 
Top sushi restaurants with an amazing environment and music !!!
I'm definitely signing my name under it. 
Armen Way #dwtslv

I was at this place at a weekend for a date night with my girlfriend. I'd have to say the cherry blossom tasted spectacular, had great appetizer selections and especially our server Victor delivered great, timely service! Will surely visit here again in the future! Also a very nice interior! Awesome Sushi place!

This place is amaaaaaaazing!!! The rolls came out fast, they were reasonably priced & they had amazing green apple flavored sake.. It was so smooth you couldn't taste any alcohol!

Service was great, atmosphere was nice, they play music videos in a huge screen, and they also have large tables for groups, as well as private tables for couples.

I'd definitely come here again, their menu is large with a lot of great choices!!

Sit at the sushi bar and you will immediately notice that something is off. The counter height is at least a half-a-foot too high - check it out.

Their spicy crab hand roll ($5.50) looked something out of a scary anime movie. It was a crumpled up sheet of imitation crab soaked in a warm red mystery sauce sloppily stuffed into a sheet of nori. By the time it was handed to me it was soggy and clearly unappetizing. I've *never* seen a spicy crab hand roll look like this. I would even go as far as saying it was really gross. I dare say it tasted even worse than it looked - warm, chewy, and messy. Somewhere in Japan, this has got to be considered illegal sushi.

Our sushi chef's demeanor was deadpan and straight up unfriendly. I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt but we soon caught his drift and decided to leave after another order (a scallop sushi roll which was ugly as shit, and made without care).

Just when I thought we cut our losses and were off to another establishment to save our supper, I was given the "Sorry, sir, our system is down, can you pay with cash?" What complete crap. I should've called their bluff. It's been 5 years since I've encountered that in Vegas. Visa, Mastercard Inc., and the Better Business Bureau should be notified.

The industry folks love this place, and I don't understand it. Avoid at all costs.

It's kind of hit or miss with this place. Decent but I've had much better. Servers are sometimes nice but seems like a lot going on behind the scenes. Chefs are fun but sometimes seem over worked and grumpy. There are actually very few sushi bars I know of that are actually owned by Japanese owners, but when they are, you can be sure that they take the art of sushi making very seriously. This place, not so much.


I tried it again. Fish was fresh and tasty. If only the busboy spoke english, he might've heard me say i didn't want anymore tea. Instead, he reaches over my plate to grab my cup and then proceeds to spill it on my jacket sitting on the seat next to me. Not to mention he ran my food to the wrong person. 

Wish the bussers would learn how to communicate properly...and, why isn't my server bringing my food anyways???
As soon as me and my boyfriend walked in we were immediately served , the place is beautiful and great customer service ! Will deff come back here for our sushi !

I lived in Japan for two years and ever since then (almost 10 years ago now) I have been searching the U.S. For authentic and amazing sushi and this place had it! The "beef sashimi" (they call it something fancy but that's what it is) is AMAZING! And the three rolls we got were just as good! I would be be surprised if my boyfriend and I came back before going home!

4.5 STARS

I WISH there was a place like this in LA: what can be better than late-night sushi?!? We always make sure to visit Kaizen when in Vegas...

The Lowdown:

- HAPPY HOUR starts at midnight (!!!)
Prior to midnight this place might be empty, and it sometimes begins to fill up late on weekdays. 

- FOOD - High quality ingredients.
Albacore & salmon sushi melt in your mouth. Actually, everything we've tried is delicious. The shishito pepper appetizer didn't disappoint (a personal favorite, which I often use to help gage the overall quality at sushi joints). I'd say this place is comparable to ever popular Katsu-Ya in LA.

- HUGE MENU
It takes a while to peruse the entire menu and get a feel for the many specialty rolls - there's something for everyone.

- LOCATION
I like the fact that this is an off-strip, "locals' favorite" type of place. 
Very cool, un-touristy crowd.

- PRICES
Its surprising to know that so many people think this place is expensive. Haven't you noticed that EVERYTHING in Vegas is expensive?!? In terms of sushi prices I'd say this joint is average, and the Happy Hour prices are a real bargain!

* WARNING *
CHECK YOUR BILL!
I'm docking half a point because the last time we were here they "forgot" to charge us Happy Hour prices, and gave us a bill with regular prices instead. NOT cool. Of course they fixed it when we spoke up, but if not for this incident Kaizen would be nearly perfect  :(

I love this place, my favorite sushi in Las Vegas.  The mango lobster roll is fantastic.  Only negative is that sometimes it can get weird in there as drunks from the Hard Rock wander in.

Important tip: After midnight, bottles of booze are two-for-one.

My friend and I just landed in Las Vegas after a very long flight and we hadn't eaten in ten hours
We came to the plaza where this place is because we wanted a foot rub
We went into some barbecue place but they kept saying that everything took a really long time and I was very hungry so we came into the sushi place which is the most amazing place that I've ever eaten in Las Vegas
Food is incredibly fresh everything was good we ate several rolls soup salad sake steak and I would come back here every day

It's completely delicious the service is very fast everyone's very attentive and it's totally got a clean Vegas five

I would highly suggest this to anyone and the guys who work in and sushi counter is very cute

Waitress was nice the seaweed salad is excellent the Mississippi is delicious the Eda mommy was fresh and steamy in the Orange Blossom Hill is the best get that and don't miss the steak salad it's yummy

Hands-down, The Best Udon I've ever had. Period. 

Living in Pasadena, I'm constantly searching high and low for good quality udon. I don't know why it's so difficult to master. It seems like good ramen is easier to find in LA than good udon.

I had my fingers crossed when I ordered the udon at Kaizen but wasn't expecting too much. But my first taste had me closing my eyes in ecstasy.  I was in heaven.  I was incredibly starving at the time, so that might have swayed my opinion a little, but the broth was delicate and complex and oh-so-delicious. The noodles were the perfect texture.

The only downside is that the service wasn't good.  After waiting forever I had to flag someone down to take our order. Then they forgot our order of edamame. Food took a while to come out too.

But it's all worth it for the Udon!!! YUM!

The Mister and I are staying at Hyatt Place and wanted sushi and spotted Kaizen from our hotel window. We get here and there is a sign that reads 'Voted best sushi in Las Vegas." We are excited but when we walked in, it was empty at 1 PM on a Saturday and was reluctant to try.

I was pouting because I wanted AYCE sushi but the mister noted quality is more important than quantity and he was right!! I ordered the Kaizen roll...it was such a marriage in my mouth!!! Try it! Also their green tea ice fream doesnt taste powdery but creamy! Their portions are generous as well. The mister ordered sashimi 10 piece and he vouched the fish was fresh.

The place looks like it is more for the dinner crowd judging by the many speakers and projectors.

They got my vote for best non AYCE sushi in Vegas so far!

We were staying at Hard Rock & walked across the street for dinner. What a gem this place is!

My husband had a Philadelphia roll & said it was so fresh & delicious. 

I was looking for something vegan so i asked if they could make me a teriyaki bowl (which was on the menu but with meat or shrimp) with tofu. They did & it was very good! 

We were very happy with the food & service.

I would go back again.

The ambiance is great. When we walked in they seated us immediately, our food was very good and served to us very quickly, our waiter was very attentive to our needs, and I will definitely be back again. I had the Shrimp Killer Roll and it was absolutely amazing!

Solid Solid Solid, my fine yelp friends!  Came here for lunch, had a great prix fix type option, but decided to go completely a la carte.  LOVED the spicy tuna roll, just gave my tongue enough tingle to satisfy.  Hamachi was tasty, and wasabi oyster shooters were pure heaven - ooo-fa!

Amazing food and service complimented with kind and courteous staff. Great choice for a late night meal with nice music and ambience.

Rainbow roll and cherry blossom are great choices and are extremely fresh and delicious.
I had RoadRunner delivery from there. I always really enjoy their rolls. Especially the Japanese lasagna. It's the best I've had!
Good spot to get your grub on. Music wasn't to loud. Friendly service clean. All around good eats

Incredible Delicious!!! Open late night just across the Hard Rock Cafe without the eye-gouging prices from the strip.  Was actually suggested by the valet at the Cosmopolitan ( In Vegas always pay attention to the suggestions of the Valet and the Taxicab Handlers on the hotels) 

Have eaten before at Sushi Roku and Shibuya and this place is as good, maybe even better than those! Try the Unicorn Roll it was amazing and a steal at ($14)

Me and my wife loved it and we will be back.

This is our second dining experience at Kaizen Fusion Roll. We we very happy with the friendly service and the wonderful rolls. We drive in from Boulder City but it is worth the drive and we will come in more often. We tried 3 different rolls and each was excellent. Experiment, you won't go wrong!

If you have read some of my other Vegas reviews, you will know that I am not local but I visit very often and for extended periods of time.  I also have a lot of friends who live in Vegas and work in the service industry.  As a result, I have tried a large number of sushi bars and restaurants both on and off Las Vegas Blvd.

A friend of mine who has lived in town for 18 years took us to Kaizen one night and we sat at the bar.  The food was pretty good, but nothing to write home about.  The nigiri was average, but the rolls we had were nothing special.  It might have just been the night we went, but something did not seem right with the items that came from the fryer (like the tempura).  One plus is that the price was fair and the place was open late.  The service was friendly, but a bit slow.  Overall, I will not likely go back.  With so many options, this restaurant failed to make an impression and for the price point, I prefer Hamada down the road.

First Impressions:
Clean place. Nice decor. Good atmosphere. They have a TV.
It's a nice and quiet place, but there weren't many people there, so it might be different when it's packed.

About me:
I'm Japanese. I love sushi. I go out to eat sushi once a month or so by myself. I was in Vegas just for the weekend.

Summary:
I went at around 8:30 pm, and they were out of uni & toro. I ordered mainly nigiri sushi and not much stood out. I also got the chicken katsu, which wasn't bad but nothing special.
Food: 3/5 - Average
Service: 4/5 - Good
Overall: 3/5

Review:
I went at around 8:30pm on a Sunday night with a friend. I made a reservation twenty minutes beforehand, but the place was almost empty when we arrived. The first things I always order at a sushi bar are toro and uni. They were both out, but it was 8:30pm, so it was understandable.

I started out with albacore belly, mackerel, salmon, ikura, and tuna. I usually always order albacore belly, mackerel, and salmon as they're a few of my favorite sushi. The ones I had here weren't bad, but they didn't taste great either. I was here with a friend who doesn't eat sushi as often, so I ordered the tuna (something common) and ikura (slightly obscure) for him as well. The tuna and ikura tasted better than I expected, but my expectations were set a little low after eating their albacore belly, mackerel, and salmon. I may have ordered something else as well here, but I'm drawing a blank.

I didn't want the bill to get too large, so I ordered chicken katsu to share with my friend. The chicken katsu was a little thin, and they were cut into pieces the size of a pencil (in terms of thickness/width). This is personal preference, but I preferred the pieces to be a little fatter/wider.

I wanted to finish off the night with some more sushi, so I asked the sushi chef for a recommendation and ordered the madai. It was actually pretty good. Possibly the best sushi of the night. I ended up ordering another serving.

The bill came out to be ~$100 for the two of us, which is average for a sushi place (not too cheap, not too expensive). I paid $60 ($10 tip) for the meal.

During the meal, the waitress made sure I didn't run out of my tea (she asked if I would like more when I was low), so that was nice. She also asked us multiple times how our meal was going. So the service here was pretty good.

Conclusion:
It's a decent sushi place, but it wasn't good enough to make it a go-to sushi bar every time I'm in Vegas. I think it's worth exploring other options.

Food: 3/5 - Average
Atmosphere: 4/5 - Good
Service: 4/5 - Good
Overall: 3/5 (weighed on food score)

Other thoughts:
I went to a sushi place in San Diego called Sushi Ota about a month prior to visiting Kaizen Sushi in Vegas. The sushi at Sushi Ota tasted incredible, so it raised the bar for my future sushi outings. I may have rated Kaizen Sushi higher if I hadn't visited Sushi Ota.

After wandering around the strip seeing many Pokemon and other characters like a fat guy in a bikini, I really needed something to cleanse my palette. A friend recommended this place.  My group started with the grilled ika which came with a spicy sauce and this awesome scallop mushroom app that was in a cream sauce topped with a charred cheese - do delicious, I just wish I had some to scoop the extra sauce. Then we had a few roll by then the scarring that occurred from the fat bikini was gone. But we stayed for dessert - fried tempura cheesecake and deep fried ice cream.

Excellent food. Great staff, fun environment. Fair prices. 

I ordered the paradise roll at the advice of the waitress and it truly was paradise.
I absolutely love this sushi spot. It's gorgeous inside and has the most amazing quality food!! The staff is friendly and service is fast! I highly recommend trying this place out.

HANDS DOWN THE BEST SUSHI I HAVE EVER HAD!  Found this restaurant thru an acquaintance back in 2010 and never ate raw sushi until I came here and it has changed me.  Ever since 2010 I have been on a search in multiple states to find sushi that can rival KAIZEN but have failed.  This destination is a must for every vegas trip I take.  Favorite sushi is the "sexy roll!!"  I could eat 3 orders by myself.  Great restaurant!!!  Keep it going!!
This is probably one of my favorite sushi places in Las Vegas. Food is always fresh and the service is always great!

Great food. Great Service. A nice "off-the-strip" option. The super reasonable prices almost made me forget that I was in Las Vegas! Also, I was there around 10pm. They have a reverse Happy Hour that offered 2 for 1 drinks. I'll definitely go here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

Back again, one year later. Never disappoints!!!!
If you want great sushi at a very fair price, you need to come here!

10/10 Would recommend. Good lunch deals, for that quickie to satisfy you and your hangry friends. You rock, don't ever change. 
Forever yours, 
Lizzie McGuire
I have to add more words because nobody likes just the tip.

Came all the way here bc I wanted to Gangnam kbbq but they were so busy so we headed Kaizen instead. 
We got the Lasagna, BBQ and California roll.
And it tastes absolutely amazing. We loved the bbq roll tho. 
The service was great. We were seated right away and servers would always check on us. Will come back definitely!(:
Heard It was great and we were not that impressed. I'm not one to write negative, but I'm sorry our rolls were a bit fishy. This place came highly recommended so maybe It was an off night.

I have a 2 years baby and unfortunately they asked us to not feed him with the pasta plate we brought for him!
We were very disappointed since my wife had to go feed him in the car!
We spent over a 100$ and this is the last time for us there!
Nice atmosphere and very friendly staff. Robust menu with plenty of tasty options. I would recommend this to anyone staying close by!

Nice service !  Nice food!
You have to come in hereb
Yaki udon and salmon roll is so perfect
And it's also cheap!

EXCELLENT sushi rolls and a lot to choose from!! Had the krazy boy (deep fried California roll), Tiger eye, and one other. Soo good. Also had the chicken teriyaki bowl which had lots of veggies and rice which was great, as well. Prices very fair and affordable. Great service, they even called a taxi for us after. Will definitely be back. Only a few minutes off the strip.

This place has a great modern look with a great ambiance. The food is great and the lunch special is quite the deal. The california combo - central that came with california rolls, miso soup, side salad and my choice of beef teriyaki was enough to fill me up. I highly recommended this to anyone that enjoys Japanese food.
1st time here, the service is great & the restaurant  is so beautiful! Definitely recommend it.

Definitely worth checking out. It's crowded and always busy but easily the best sushi spot in Aliante. Get the AYCE and try all they have to offer. We came specially for Min, sushi chef, he is a master of his craft.

Absolutely a must try! if you love sushi, I believe this is one of the best places! my personal favorite roll is *salmon killer 2* i'm not a spicy fan, BUT the salmon killer two has the perfect amount of spice and flavor is delicious also! the staff is friendly too!
Great atmosphere, and beautiful location. A must see in the city of Vegas if you're over by the Hardrock hotel and casino. We had the Rose roll and Tokyo roll lil to no rice and tons of flavor.

Don't come to this plaza unless you're strapped with weapons....or at least pepper spray. Even a stun gun would be nice.
Kaizen was okay but damn...this plaza was one hot mess!!!
We haven't parked for 2 seconds yet and bums are already asking for money.

But this sushi place is nothing to write home about. Service was spotty....even though we came on a late Sunday night. After they brought us our drinks and water, we were ready to order some sushi rolls. We had to flag the waitress down, TWICE. It wasn't even busy!!! There were about 5-8 other tables. They didn't bother checking back on us....what if we wanted to order more sushi?!?! I totally would have by the way. We ordered a spicy tuna roll and also a Sunrise Roll. Sushi was delicious and their menu was never ending. I would've loved to try a few more...but DAMN...it was pricey!!!! Our sunrise roll was $13!!! Most of the sushi rolls ran from $10-14 per order. Umm, yeah...no. You're better off going into the heart of Chinatown or even further...(wayyyy further) off the strip for better priced sushi.

Also..side note: if you get cold like myself, BRING A JACKET WITH YOU!!!! They like to keep their fish and customers fresh and cold. Thought I was in their freezer box for a second.

Won't be coming back again. And this side of town is enough to scare the sushi out of me.

In a very convienient location for those staying at the Hard Rock Hotel, and nearby on the strip.  Stay out of the overpriced, overrated Casino sushi joints and take a quick ride down to Kaizen.  The sushi is fresh, staff attentive, and the beer and sake floweth.  

You can have your choice of traditional sushi, sashimi, or get adventurous with one of thier tasty specialty rolls.  The SPICY TUNA SALAD is a must try; large portions of tuna with a fresh mix of greens.

This is one of my favorite sushi spots anywhere, and the best I have had in Las Vegas.

My favorite late night sushi restaurant. As long as you're having a good time and of course ordering food and drinks they will stay open. Usually close about 4 am, it's also a great meeting spot before hitting the strip. The vegas roll is my favorite!

I'm still in love with Kaizen! I hadn't been back to Vegas in a year and a half. I wasn't about to skip going to a Kaizen before returning home. My boyfriend and I ordered the garden salad, octopus and cucumber salad, octopus sashimi, the tuna and shrimp in a cucumber roll, an avocado roll, and a chicken teriyaki roll. We love food! Everything was delicious, so much so that I was ready to go back the next day!! It's nice to get away from the craziness of the strip and have something so close by!

I am a big fan of Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi. Sometimes a restaurant fits perfectly into your day or even your week. In the fall of 2014 I had been in Las Vegas briefly and had quickly grabbed takeout from here. I remember thinking the ambience was fun. Returning to Las Vegas in December of 2015 I used Yelp to track down this sushi restaurant that I remembered enjoying but couldn't remember the name of.

Since I was traveling for work I was often on my own for dinner. Walking into Kaizen I was instantly welcomed and the staff was more than happy to give me a table to myself since the restaurant was not too busy. 

Over the three separate visits I made to Kaizen I got to sample a variety of rolls, all of which I enjoyed:
-Philadelphia Roll-specially requested for this to be made with salmon and cream cheese inside and salmon on top
-Sexy Roll-spicy tuna inside topped with fresh tuna, smelt eggs, and tangy sauce
-Crunch Roll-deep fried shrimp, Yamagobo, cucumber inside topped with tempura crunch and eel sauce
-Red Rock Roll-deep fried shrimp and cucumber inside topped with spicy tuna, seared tuna, and spicy mayo
-Hot Night Roll-deep fried shrimp and cucumber inside topped with spicy tuna and eel sauce
-Orange Blossom Roll-deep fried chopped shrimp and crab inside topped with salmon and tangy sauce

Everything I had was delicious and the service is polite and quick. Definitely great to stop in for dinner when traveling for business. On weekends the restaurant can get significantly busier so expect to sit at the bar if you're dining solo.
AMAZING! I would definitely come back here when I visit Vegas!!! Dragon roll and kiss of fire is delish!

We had dinner here our last night in Vegas, and it was such an excellent choice. Everything from the food and the customer service to the decor was fabulous. We started out with salmon cheese sticks, and they were so good that I contemplated getting another order. I had to restrain myself. We moved on to the sushi rolls. We had the salmon tempura, calamari tempura, and tiger eye rolls. The rolls were fresh and delicious. Amazingly delicious. Kaizen has become one of the best sushi restaurants I've been to. It is located a few minutes off the Strip and is definitely worth the trip. Usually, I don't go to restaurants more than once when I'm vacationing since there are so many options, but we've already mentioned Kaizen for our next trip.

The surprising thing about Vegas is how few great dining options there are late-night.  Sure, every hotel has its late-night restaurant but they're generally pretty average.  This place was great!  They had funky rolls and good drinks and at 2am we weren't expecting anything this good.  Would definitely return.

It's open til 4 am!!!  I love that it's close to the strip so I can satisfy my late night sushi cravings after partying in the clubs.  

My favorite roll is the First Kiss Roll.  It's kinda expensive at $15 but it's SOOOOOO good.  Besides that, the only thing I really get is the $5 spicy tuna rolls.   

Gone here many times and it never disappoints me, except for the one time where it was 3:40am and last call was at 3:30am =(

Late night sushi across the street from Hard Rock. Pretty good at 2am. Had a crazy girl roll, Nevada roll and spicy tataki roll. Could have passed on the NV but the other two were tasty. Friendly waitstaff. Will come back again for sure.

I am jealous of you Vegas locals!

You have a place to get sushi at 4AM on the weekdays and up to 6AM on the weekends?!

Yes it is a TAD bit more expensive then other places, but the rolls that we purchased were delicious. 

We had Spicy Tuna, Las Vegas, California, and Night roll.

The hot tea was one of the better ones I've tried as well.

Sushi is not overfilled with rice, the crab (if not imitation) in the California roll is not drenched in mayo. 

The staff was friendly, and service was good. 

It is also easy to order because their menu is loaded with pictures, so if you are not sure, feel free to order with your eyes.

The restaurant is located in a strip mall by the Hard Rock. The inside decor is really "cool" and what I guess I can describe as "fusion". On the outside you wouldn't really think anything of this place, but hey it's whats on the inside that counts. They even have a DJ playing some 90s music for that extra "hip" feel. It was more than welcomed.

For late late late night-- or early morning cravings of Sushi, check this place out.
Awesome. I loved it. It was my first time trying sushi and my kid also adored baked salmon rolls

I came here because of a friend's recommendation and I'm so glad I did. It's a bit off the strip, near the Hard Rock and the area (I guess LV in general) isn't the safest... but the restaurant itself is cute and cozy inside. We enjoyed all of the rolls we tried and found the fish to be fresh and the service to be friendly.

Let's paint the picture. I show up for dinner alone, slightly before rush so I sit at the bar. Wow! Just wow! The Sexy M roll was so freaking good. I mean I could have ordered three of those! But my stock definitely couldn't have taken that kind of work. I also got the Palm Springs roll, this was also wonderful but that Sexy roll stole the show for me! The guys were wonderful! I wish I was in town longer so that I could go again!
Most fairly priced sushi anywhere close to the strip. An okay selection of rolls and kitchen entrees as well as great, fast service. Would gladly return here if we stay at the same hotel next year.

DELICIOIUS!

And they even have chopped fresh wasabi.   

I got a roll and a bunch of nigiri, and everything was awesome.

Loves it.

They now have a section where rolls are half off.  The last time I've eaten here was probably 2 months ago.  So hopefully they will still have it.  I thought this place was just a little expensive.  They do have a lot of creative sushi/dishes.  I see I'm writing for the paradise location.  This location has been much more busier.  The henderson location seems to be slower and less crowded if that suits you.

Oh yeah my favorite sushi spot away, yet not far from the strip. They have great service, delicious sushi rolls, and nice decor. The sushi is inexpensive to average. It's located right across the street from the hard rock, so it won't take you more than 15 mins to get here if you're staying on the strip. If you are craving good sushi and don't feel like waiting hours in order to get it, just drive or take a can here. It will be worth it!

Truly disappointed.  The service was horrible and when I pointed it out I got excuses about the kitchen.  Don't make excuses, take responsibility for the poor service.  There was staff standing around talking to each other instead of serving customers.  The food was just okay, not super great.  We won't be going back.  I wouldn't recommend this place, there is way better sushi restaurants in the area with better food and superior service. Never going back.

This place is awesome. I have eaten here twice and the rolls are fresh and quick. The staff is so nice and unlike other places that serve sushi to locals like me, the wait staff here seems to be both traditional and friendly. They have good communication with each other and all of them check on you. I appreciate this place for its atmosphere and the friendly attitude of the staff!

Well I have mixed feelings about this place. It's close to my apartment so that was a plus. Looks nice and upscale inside. What took it back down was the wooden chop sticks. I think if you go upscale make the chopsticks upscale too and stop cutting down trees. The menu is huge!!!! 

Ok so the BBQ roll isn't good to me. The meat was chewy. Too chewy I swallowed many bites whole because I couldn't break it down. Crunchy roll was good. Tried the crazy boy it was interesting. Not bad but I just didn't like it. I had ordered the Katsura roll to try it but it never came. They charged me for it and then I told them I never got it. They took it off. 

Ok so here is where I get picky. One if I order something bring it to me. Two 3 different people came up to our table asking if we are done eating and paid yet. Seriously I ordered rolls a few times relax and let me eat or wait for the goof.  When I'm done eating I'll let you know. And three when we walk in and I tell you we want a table instead of sushi bar don't suggest the sushi bar over and over.

This a a great little place off of the strip. Everyone on my group was craving sushi so we decided to hit this place because it was close, in a little shopping center across from the Hard Rock.  It's small but don't let that fool you.  We were quickly seated and orders were taken right away.  Talk about great sushi. Everything we had was great. I had a dragon roll and crunch roll. There prices are pretty good for the quality and size of your rolls.  Pineapple sakitini is a great cocktail to order.  

I almost forgot that they stay open until at least 4am everyday, a must for vegas if you are into hanging out late. So if you have a late night craving stop it.  If you haven't had enough to drink they have buy one get one free.

The only reason this has 2 stars is because the food was decent, and another waiter came and asked if we needed anything after we had sat there for 45 minutes, waiting for our waitress to come ask us for our order. Then our second waiter forgot about us as well. The food was cold after 2 minutes of getting to us, and we literally almost left them a pile of barf to clean up. $0 tip for you guys! And we are normally the type to give 20-25%
If you are going here expecting a 4 star restaurant such as Nobu, you will be disappointed. As a regular sushi eater, this place does not make the cut.

Every time I eat sushi in this city I'm mad at myself. It's always bad. Always. 

This time it was the worst. The yellowtail sushi was boring and the rice was stale. The salmon hand roll; uninspiring. The spider roll came out cold. Not warm, not cool.  COLD. It had been in the fridge. The fried crab was soft and soggy, not warm and crunchy. It was horrible. As in the worst sushi roll ever. I don't even know how the sushi 'chef' looks himself in the mirror. He should be ashamed. 

The server took my order but demanded I also write it down on their silly paper myself to keep track of what I ordered. 

That, and I never did get that glass of water I asked 2 different people for.
Really good sushi and great service. We are locals and love this place. Check out their happy hour if you get the chance.

The last time I was in Vegas this was the last place I  ate before my flight. It was delicious!  Best sushi I ever had the avocado train is amazing!!  I went home and craved this place for weeks. 
I loved there fresh ginger not the cheap pink ginger that most sushi places use.  all there rolls are pretty amazing and at a great price for Vegas. 

I just flew in for another convention and this is the first place I stopped. I think the service was great the sushi was Fresh and location is great right next to CVS for me to pick up some stuff before I get to the over priced hotels. I'll definitely be eating here a couple more times before I fly back home.
Great ambience and food! Good place to eat with friends! Service is fast and good. Loved the soup, baked salmon and the Katsu. Would definitely come back and recommend to friends

There are times when the thought of leaving the house outweighs the feeling of- if I don't eat sushi right now, I will, in fact, die. I really don't like to get sushi delievered because, it just is never that good, but desperate times call for desperate measures. Plus, I just wasn't ready to die. I used the roadrunner food delievery app and it let me customize my order exactly how I like it (I'm one of those annoying cant order directly off the menu people) . Food was delievered to me exactly how I wanted it and I got to eat with my favorite dining companion, my cat- Ape. I also did not have to wear pants like a civilized person. I took my first nom, and it was delicious!! Cold, fresh and yummy. I also love their "beef tarta" . This place is great. If you can crawl outside with pants on, they are open late and super friendly inside.

The general consensus was that the food was ok with the exception with a few items that was better.  They were very accommodating to the 14 girls we had.  The biggest complaint I have is that the rice fell apart in my rolls.

Nope. The sushi rice wasn't cooked properly. I admit I am an idiot for ordering uni but it came out a little darker of a color than typical and it didn't taste quite what I am used to. Maybe not 100% fresh. Edible not enjoyable. They were nice enough to take it back though. Not what I am used to very under par.  Maybe you need to get wildly intoxicated. Terrible place. The worst sushi I've ever had.

Took Yelp advice and this was the closest place to eat.   Couldn't print their coupons but they said they would honor them....NOT!!  We ordered sake bombs because we had coupons and they only honored one and called it a birthday coupon, after telling us both were free.  Food was good, presentation great, service not so amazing.  We aren't the Hard Rock crowd, but came for food and deserved better service.  The presentation was amazing and the sushi good, but the service lacked for us old ladies.

Prices are up to par with most average sushi places.  Nigiri Sushi is about $5-8 depending on which fish.  Cut rolls are $5-12.  The spicy tuna salad seems to be a favorite.  Alas the salad seemed to be just a generic salad that they bought at safeway/vons.

The Hamachi was fresh and the two pieces were nice and big.  I wasn't that hungry so I didn't try that many things.  Though the korean bbq roll was a nice try to something new, it wasn't that special to make me want to order again (may as well just get korean bbq shortribs with rice), as there are so many other rolls to try.

I'd go again, prices and quality are up to par, and this time I'd try the other rolls.

Good for rolls, decent for nigiri (it's no sasabune).

Yelp, you're fired. Four stars?! All I wanted was non-AYCE sushi, rated decently,  and near the strip. Jesus H. Christ! It's a fail when you come into a restaurant starving and you leave with everyone in your party invoking the Lord's name with his middle initial.*

Things started out okay with them seating us promptly. We drooled over the menu and ordered enough to feed every child in Botswana. It went downhill from there. The first piece of sushi, two pieces of uni, took almost an hour to get to our table. WE WERE WASTING VALUABLE GAMBLING TIME! Everyone at the craps table is depending on me to get back in the game.

The sushi man was a little stingy. It wasn't like I was ordering a 49 cent taco from Del Taco in South LA and then complaining to the cashier, and then to the manager that there wasn't enough meat in my sub-dollar taco, all the while getting approving "um-huh"s from my significant other standing behind me. You know? They could've been slightly more generous. 

What's funny is I think they were Thai. Thai reminds me of Thailand. Thailand reminds me of my vacation to Phuket. In Phuket, we journeyed to a steakhouse that was highly, I mean HIGHLY, rated by Tripadvisor. So I thinks, maybe we's getting a good deal on expensive steak. My partner orders a ribeye, bone-in, because that's how us gangsters roll. The waitress retorts, "Just to let you know, it's a little chewy." My partner responds, "What do you mean?" Waitress says, "Are you Malay?" My partner, looking confused, says, "No." Waitress replies, "Have you had a steak before?" HAHAHA. Okay, screw you guys. It was funny at the time.

ANYWAYZ. You're better off going to some of the better AYCE in Vegas and not stuffing your face. You'll pay the same amount, or less, and get better quality sushi.

*In almost a decade spent in church, they never taught me what what Jesus's middle initial stood for, although the whispers say it may be Herbert, but it wasn't from me.

My personal favorite when in Vegas. Four of us went again tonight. Had four or five different controls, some sushi, some sashimi and even some oysters. As usual, everything was fantastic. Maybe a little less attentive than I'm used to Kama maybe could have improved on that but overall another great time at one of the best sushi restaurants in town

 I've been to this place on three or four occasions. It never lets me down. From the sushi to the sushi me to the cut rolls, this place is top-notch. I also like how it's not so formal. It's a place where you can be somewhat formal or completely laid back and just enjoy some amazing sushi

amazing amazing amazing. By far the best sushi I ever had in my life. I am happy to admit Im a local here. I come as often as humanly possible.

I first discovered this place about two months ago. Everything is good. My favorite is the crispy rice appitizer. It's just yum.

matter of fact... I am heading there now! they're open late, perfect for the casino workers and late night crowd like us!

Best sushi we have had in a long time! Highly recommend this place Great Sushi excellent service. Very cozy and welcoming atmosphere, love the area under the little lights your facing the bar basically. It's a small place but it's delicious sushi definitely   recommend the Nevada roll and the avocado one so tasty!!

Kaizen is a destination restaurant worth the flight to Vegas.  The sushi chefs are incredibly talented and come up with some really fresh combinations.  My favorite?  The Rose Roll!  Why?  Because it has no rice or seaweed, it's all fish wrapped in fish.  I have them add some jalapeños on top to give a bit of spice.  Amazing!  Fresh sashimi and nigiri, doesn't get better than this. Also the prices are super reasonable, we fed 9 people for less than $900 and this included drinks, food, sake etc.  Will go every time I'm in Vegas!

Terrible food, fish not fresh and the manager was our waiter.... He was very rude and unprofessional. Didn't try to help us at all! I asked for the manager again because I didn't believe it was him and the same guy came, talking about how he is the manager, the CEO, and the owner.... Who talks like that? All I wanted was a roll off my bill, he bargained with me asked if I wanted 50% off of one of the rolls.... And than didn't give me the discount!!!!!

This is my favorite sushi place of all time. I want to move to Vegas just for the sushi here!! Service is great and the rolls never disappoint! Fish is always super fresh and tasty.  I always get the white rose roll avocado train and my new favorite is the spicy tuna salad. If I could eat here every day I would but i have to make the four hour trip to Vegas just for my yummy sushi rolls :(  love this place and the ambience. Great for night owls like me and also love the music. I rarely leave yelp reviews but I have to for  kaizen! Please move closer to LA!

This place has a lot of potential, considering the fact that the location is pretty good.  The place attempts at an identity; dimly lit rooms, walls and menus decorated in sleek yet simple design.  Bold and different from other sushi venues in Las Vegas.  Overall, not bad.

Even the food is designed to look cute and all.  You may notice the sushi takes a little bit longer to prepare than other venues, and obviously it's because they're taking their time laying out and arranging the sushi to make it look nice.  Makes up for a nice Kodak moment if you're into that kind of stuff.  It's impressive, but the bottom line is that no amount of decoration can make a delicious meal.  The fact is, the sushi tastes bad. Really bad.

To be fair, the sushi may be OK for first timers or real causal sushi goers, but it just doesn't cut it for me.  The biggest reason is that the rice is terrible.  It doesn't mix well with the sashimi at all.  It's always because the rice is cooked too thin,there's too much rice in the roll, it's not packed correctly with the sashimi, the list goes on and on.

The fish is OK, but not mind-blowing.  The best way to find out if a sushi joint is good is to eat the most perishable fish on their menu.  I always try the Ebi(Shrimp), Ama-ebi(Sweet Shrimp), and Uni(Sea Urchin) as starters.  Try one of these as a Nigiri (Fish and Rice only, with no tacky sauce), and you'll know in a heartbeat if the fish is fresh or not.  It doesn't matter anyways because you shouldn't order Nigiri at a sushi joint that doesn't have AYCE unless you wanna put a hole in your wallet.

The price is pretty overpriced as well.  I know it's near the Strip and everything, but it seems that's all you're paying for at this point.  The food does no help to justify the price of the dishes.

Oh, I just want to point out it took nearly 20 minutes for them to prepare a California Roll.  Unbelievable.  I don't care if it looked pretty because when I'm hungry I can eat anything that looks close to edible.  The thought of waiting another 20 minutes was insane.   I can't imagine how much longer it will take if I ordered it during their peak hours.  If you go there around 10-11pm when they're busy, good luck ever getting your food..

In conclusion, considering that the food comes out looking pretty like a flower arrangement and takes a long time, its more like a lounge-like environment.  Go with a couple friends when you aren't too hungry, have a couple drinks and poke at the pretty food that takes forever to come out.  In that sense, it's an OK experience.  But as far as taste goes, stay awaaaay. 

PRO: Nice decoration, location is OK.  Sushi may be decent for casuals
CON: Sushi tastes bland, dishes takes a really long time to come out, no AYCE
Amazing place with very tasty sushi! Presentation is 10 star and customer service is impeccable. Also music is very pleasant and relaxing

This is probably now my favorite Sushi spot here. I decided to come here for my 4th Anniversary dinner and I don't regret it! The sushi is "REALLY" good and the presentation of it is so far the neatest I have seen out of all of my sushi experiences. Sad to say however that it was too bad I could only take down three rolls because my stomach seriously wanted to go for a fourth! I definitely recommend this place. The restaurant is clean, the staff is friendly, and the sushi is great.

It's great food but I'm not a fan of places that are not all you can eat, specifically saying for this here because the Kaizen by my house in Aliante (N.LV) is AYCE. So I was a little upset I came here assuming it was the same. Was no fault of their own and the staff was very good  won't be coming back though. It's so expensive to come here when all you can eat sushi is in abundance in this city.

I loved this restaurant. They were extra attentive and accommodating. I got the Kaizen Ceviche -- highly recommended! 

It's really close to the Bellagio where we stayed. It's not too out of the way. 

Definitely come out to Kaizen if you're in the mood for something delicious. 

Kyle
I've been coming here for years & always a great time! I usually get the hot night roll or chicken Katsu bowl, which is consistently yummy. Also a great late-night spot close to Las Vegas Blvd.

I was so happy to find this place...I was staying across the street at the Hardrock and nursing a major hangover that I had already attended to earlier in the day by ordering eggs benedict from room service ( good room service FYI )...anyway still lagging and trying to decide to rise and shine or hermit in my room when my friend said he was coming over...so oh shit, guess I better get up...he asks me what I want to eat and I say Sushi downstairs....I start getting ready and start imaging what I will order once at Sushi, my friend gets there we head downstairs walk in the sushi spot and God Damn it...I'm 10 minutes too late and they are closing...argh....so they recommended across the street...I'm glad they did.

Yeap its an American style sushi spot ran by maybe Koreans with all kinds of fried sushi rolls...which is exactly what this hungover girl was craving anyway.

Albacore with crispy onions ..Yum
Salmon nigiri...Yum
Shrimp tempura roll...Yum
some kind of bulgogi roll..Yum
and some other specialty roll, can't remember...

Everything I had was delcious and fresh....service was fast and friendly and I felt happy here...the hangover required that I be around only a few people and the HardRock was totally over crowded...

They are open super late for those like me who crave things late at night!

I was so skeptical, as I am a total buffet girl when it comes to Vegas.  I've heard any other ethnic cuisine in Vegas is absolutely disgusting... but this place proved me incorrect.  The baked scallops in their sauce was so good.  No words can describe it.  We walked over (not a great idea, but we were hungry and didn't want to wait in the cab line) from Hard Rock after partying it up at Center Bar (awesome time too) and ate there at 4:30 in the morning.  I especially liked the cheers we got when we walked in, looking awesome I'm sure, after a night of excessive drinking and partying.  The place is a like a club that serves sushi.  There is a deejay spinning tunes and with the exception of the sushi bar, most of the restaurant is dark.  The food though, was absolutely fantastic.

I went in here for lunch. The place was quiet and I sat at the bar. The sushi chef was quick with producing the order. They even have fresh wasabi. Maybe it was because it wasn't busy, but I felt they were a little over attentive. Having people constantly on me for refills or taking plates detracted from the sushi experience. Additionally, one of the staff was hitting Youtube for the music videos playing on the big screen.  Pay for Youtube Red at least so the advertisements don't jar the customers, again detracting from the experience.

Food - 5 stars
Cleanliness - 5 stars
Service - Exceptional but over whelming - 3 stars
Ambiance - Youtube adds - 3 stars

ok this review may have been blurred by my inebriation as well as my company at the time, but it was a damn fine experience.

what better than hot tea, cold sake and fresh sushi at 5am after a silly night of drinking?  i never thought sushi was a good late night food, but i guess anything can when its that late.  yeah, this place is open till 6am on the weekends.  this whole concept intrigued me.  i didn't even mind hearing the new britney cd in its entirety...

for our dinner (breakfast?) she had a house salad with some wild dressing i sampled that was very good.  the best roll we ordered was some scallop roll served in a sauce of curry with mushrooms...awesome.  i deducted one star b/c i was very excited for the korean bbq roll (i'm a huge, huge fan of short ribs) and it didn't do anything for me, too chewy for a roll...was terribly disappointed.  otherwise, food was excellent.

the hot tea was good, i don't know why i drank more but the sake after a whole night of drinking was strangely appealing.  

like i said, i ate up this whole experience.  the newest fan of sushi and sake at 6am!
Great sushi...happy hour is great and staff is funny and friendly and let's the customers create their own sushi :)

Was looking for a good place to eat sushi, and this one had pleasant reviews by my fellow Yelpers. 
It is located in a plaza with other restaurants, a 24/7 salon, and retail stores. 
I love the ambiance and customer service. They are attentive and helpful. Nicely decorated with elegant simplicity. 

We ordered the avocado train, spicy rainbow roll, and the baked scallop. All in all, we were speechless the whole time we were eating because it was that good! The avocado train had a delightful surprise with an avocado ball at the end of the roll. What is in it, you ask? You gotta order it and find out! The spicy rainbow roll was a good balance of spicy and fresh fish. Lastly I love the sauce on the baked scallop roll. The mushroom and scallops were super good! 

Would definitely recommend this place to friends and family!

Service is outstanding and the sushi was good. The rolls are good and creative. If you like spicey with sushi this place will treat you well. It also has basic rolls but their own spicey creations are good. Also got the the gyoza, after living in Japan for three years wasn't inpressed with the gyoza. Decent but if you come and are looking for an appetizer I wouldnt go with this one, but nonetheless the food and sushi and service was good, so I would check it out if you're jonzing for a cool place and some good food.

We went here after a very late night on the strip. Right off the strip, and uber ride was very cheap so location was amazing. Walking into a place at 3AM, you would expect a place to look like dirty and run down. This place was the complete opposite. Very nice and very clean. We're helped right away and given some suggestions and their best sellers. Their menu is so BIG. We just went with what was suggested. Some of their maki rolls were not traditional but they were very good. I enjoyed my meal as did the rest of my party. Highly suggest this place if are out late and are craving Japanese cuisine. Also they have unlimited passion fruit ice tea!!

Would I return to the place?
Most definitely. This place exceeded expectations
Great food!!! Will come back again. Must try the Jay roll and the tatami roll. Came here all the way from LA.

Almost all of my sushi experiences these days are AYCE, so it was nice to go out for a few rolls and know I didn't have to prep for stuffing myself. Prices are definitely high given Kaizen's proximity to the Hard Rock Hotel and ordering two rolls will easily set you back for more than a typical AYCE dinner. However, I do think the quality of ingredients is better, the rolls are thicker, and there's a little more effort put in to justify at least some of the price. 

The restaurant is hip and modern despite its Strip Mall location. There's weren't many customers on a Tuesday night but it did look like most of them were tourists. We sat at the bar and ordered the Shishito Pepper appetizer to start. I was surprised by how many peppers they gave us. They were served with bonito flakes on the side, which I wasn't quite sure what to do with. Do I eat them on top of the peppers? Between bites of the peppers? I ended up drizzling soy sauce on the flakes and eating them with the peppers, making it easier to stick together. We also ordered the Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna (always a favorite), Katana Roll, and TT Girl Roll. The Katana had just the right amount of heat and the sauce served with it tasted like Cool Ranch Doritos. I do think it was ranch based, and I never knew how well ranch goes with sushi, though what doesn't go well with ranch...? My boyfriend enjoyed the T.T. Girls roll, I liked the eel on top but thought it was a little too saucy. 

Overall a pleasant experience at Kaizen. Don't go in thinking you have to eat like you would at an AYCE place. It was a lot of food and I was thoroughly satiated at the end of the meal. This is certainly a cheaper option than eating at Nobu at HRH, but if you're trying to really get down on some sushi and don't care too much about quality or ambiance, there are plenty of AYCE sushi spots just behind UNLV that may serve your wallet and appetite better.

This was a great local find when I was staying at the Hard Rock Hotel and didn't have a car. It's right across the street in an unassuming strip mall. (Plenty of free parking if you're driving, btw!) I was impressed with the hip, modern and clean design. Definitely wasn't expecting this place to be that stylish. 

The hostess was friendly and seated me right away. She also was my server and was very on top of things. The prices are about average, but not as ridiculous as the casino sushi places. The best deal I found was the chicken katsu bowl, which was around $10. It was the most delicious katsu I had in a long time. It was moist and the serving size was perfect. I hate when katsu is dried out and tough, but this definitely wasn't the case here. I had a good miso soup and a roll too. I can't remember the name of the roll, but it delicious. The fish was fresh and the sauce complimented it perfectly. My server came by several times to check on me and refill my beverages. All in all, I had a great experience and I will definitely be back. Saw lots of good dishes going by that I would like to try next time! But, trust me, try the chicken katsu!

Whack. 

The food was decent, but nothing was that memorable.  I would've liked my salmon skin salad to be crispy. 

The bad service overshadowed the experience there. The wait to get change for the bill must have taken over 15 minutes. It's not like my friends and I had a complicated bill either, we paid in cash.

The Mexican bar after the Indian restaurant next door is much better than this place.
Not cheap but very good. Good sake selection. Creative dishes. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. What more do you want?

There are a few times in life where you stumble across a little gem. I just had this experience. I'm a sushi aficionado and going to the many sushi places I've been to, this one rates at the top! Beautifully presented yet so delicious you can't stop ordering another roll. I highly recommend this place and their 'Sexy Roll' and 'Rose Roll'. Pure genius. I'll be back.

My previous Vegas trip on Aug 2010 a group of my friends (living in Sin and HI) and I came here. And being from Hawaii we are exposed to excellent sushi, so I already knew I wouldn't find it as high-quality as I would back home. BUT it actually was pretty decent. The prices where very reasonable to for how good, big and fresh it was.

I tried the "First Kiss" being raved about from my friends which was exactly what they claimed. I also tried the salmon and hamachi negiri. 

I'll be sure to hit this spot up again on this years Vegas trip!

My favorite local sushi place in Vegas. Avoid the big names on the strip - this place is just as good at half the price. All the locals know this place and hang out here.

This is one of the few sushi places I know of that have a Fried Banana Roll. At less than $10, the roll is ridiculously well priced and delicious. Which brings me to my next point - the prices. 

The prices are extremely reasonable. They have their roll with all the bells and whistles at $13-$16 a roll, but with a plethora of well-topped rolls at or less than $10, it's a bargain. Quality is top notch, and this is coming from a guy who lives in LA. 

Drop by here and grab yourself some sushi (did I mentioned they're open until 6am on Fridays and Saturdays? Insanely convenient, I know)

A good friend of mine turned me on to this place...was pretty skeptical at first but was pretty satisfied at the end of the meal which was at 5 am!! The DJ was still spinning and the chefs were still grooving and making my custom made sushi!! Can't complain now can I ? :-) You have to have the King Crab Miso Soup as a starter!! The Jalapeno poppers are great along with the rainbow roll and the lobster rolls! Yummy!!! :-)

I have eaten here several times, and each time loved this place.  Quality is excellent, and the platting is nice.  My only criticism is that either the tables are too high or the chairs are too low ..... when I eat there I feel like I was back in 1st grade sitting at a desk made for middle-schoolers.  Highly recommended.

Recently went here again and it was just as good. I can't get enough of this place! I love that they have a DJ (I don't know if that's a regular thing, I was there at about 12 on a Saturday). The place is open until 6 am on Saturday, which is awesome. It's a really fun place to go and they make the sushi pretty quickly. We ordered the Hawaiian roll (it's very different than it is at other places), the baked salmon roll, 1 oyster shooter, and the Rainbow roll (the total was $45..not too bad). And of course it was all very delicious.
I go to Kaizen Sushi about once a week and I love their food I recommend anybody looking for a good sushi place to go there and their prices are very reasonable

It's pretty disheartening that I've had my favorite roll, to date, a thousand miles from home. 

Went to Vegas in March and stayed at the Hard Rock. The fella and I had a craving for sushi, and found Kaizen in the strip mall right across the street. We strolled over and proceeded to order an obscene amount of food. Everything was good, until we got the Kiss of Fire, which was AMAZING! Nevermind that we already scarfed down 3 rolls, tempura, edamame, and nigiri  - we HAD to have another one. That good.

The atmosphere here was nice. Clean, modern, bright. The service was great. The price was definitely reasonable. If I lived in Vegas, I'd be there pretty consistently. 

Seriously. Go. And if you don't order the Kiss of Fire - you're just dumb.
This is a great sushi restaurant. Visiting Vegas for the first time and loving it. The chicken katsu bowl is delicious. Ask for a side of eel sauce to make it 10x better

Had Korean BBQ bento box at lunch it was awesome. The miso soup was tasty, salad crisp dressing was killer and the BBq was as tender as filet mignon, cut it with a fork (yes I used a Fork). Portions were large as well. Service was excellent and very friendly. Korean BBQ is one of my favorites, I've eaten it all over the world including Korea and I've never had better.

While visiting LV, my friends and I really wanted to eat some sushi. The first place we "found" seemed to either not be open or no longer in business, but just our luck Kaizen was right across the street. They have a fun atmosphere and a sizable menu. I couldn't decide what to pick!  I chose a few interesting rolls, and they were very good. 

Good job Kaizen!

Great menu! Welcoming vibes and heard nothing but amazing reviews from friends and family! Food came out in a timely manner. Fresh fish and great food. Amazing service and super accommodating! Highly recommend!!

Kaizen has a pretty big selection of rolls, and some quite different from other places in town. They also have a great spicy garlic edamame which was hot and fantastic! I would definitely like to try more of the rolls as I like the unusual ones. I would need a few more tries to see if I might become more of a regular here.
Amazing food and great service! Love coming to this place. Love the orange blossom roll!

I love coming to Kies in sushi roll for a late night by Irene is a great waitress and she will take care of you especially after midnight. She is a great hostess and waitress and will take care of all your friends and family's needs. Excellent customer service and beautiful scenery.

For a hip sushi restaurant with very cool decor and most importantly DELICIOUS  food that won't break the bank, Kaizen is perfect!  

Everything I've eaten there so far is soooo yummy~  They have your typical rolls but they've also got a great selection of different things too.  There's this crispy rice appetizer that's topped with spicy tuna a drop of hot sauce that is something so simple but great.  That's just one of many tasty treats there.

At the end of every meal though I've always got to finish with the tempura green tea ice cream. =D

I've brought my friends here and now it's a one of our regulars we always eat at.  Great food, ambience, service.....you can't go wrong!

This place has a nice atmosphere, but that's about it. I know it's a fusion restaurant, but I'm not sure what's they're fusing. I didn't order any sushi, maybe the sushi would be better. I'd ordered the teriyaki beef bowl. It just taste like pei wei's food. We also got a udon...however we didn't know they had stir-fry. I thought udon was going to be in a soup. The flavoring of the udon tasted like the vietnamese saracha chilli sauce mixed with sweet and sour sauce. Absolutely gross.  Maybe their sushi rolls are better, but I think they'd overpriced their food and you could get better sushi at other place for better price.
Bento boxes are cheap for lunch special!:) food looks good though. Nice ambiance. Desserts are great! Good customer service.

This is another late nite, post-partying on the Vegas strip spot!
It's funny because I have never eaten sushi @ 2am before!!!
And it was so yummy!
I especially enjoyed the bulgogi roll and Sexy roll.
So if you are craving a late-nite sushi, check this spot out because they close @ 6am!!!
YaY!
Amazing Sushi and Sashimi, great atmosphere and open until 4am!?! Best Sushi restaurant I've ever been to in Vegas!

The service is crazy fast and the polar opposite of "chatty"...which I liked. The rolls were tasty and there is a huge selection. Really, the only thing they could improve is to get fountain drinks. I'm annoyed by paying $2.50 for a can of Coke that obviously is not refillable. We were seriously blown away by how fast they got our food out to us.

I love good sushi and sashimi. Fresh, the right temp, reasonable portions. I like to taste the fish, not have it hidden and smothered in sauces. 

Kaizen is a great place to go in Vegas. With so many choices in town, this place is a great place to enjoy quality sushi and sashimi. The food is spot on, and the prices are reasonable. The vibe is open and bright. They have the little things like fresh wasabi and know the difference between sushi rice and steamed rice.
This is our 2nd night in a row. The food was delicious and service was top notch. We will be back for sure. We eat the salmon steak and udon. Both dish were tasty.

If you are in Las Vegas and want to have sushi in unpretentious place, then try Kaizon on Paradise. The last time I was here it wasn't so good but because of Leo...... it is much better. Give it a try and ask for Leo as you sushi chef.

It was freaking awesome! Really was some of the tastiest and freshest sushi I've ever had. Try the Shogun roll. The tempura was cooked to perfection, and the accompanying apple sake was a showstopper.

So I have a bone to pick - W and I walked through the front doors that had a huge sign saying "LUNCH SPECIALS *EVERY DAY*!" When we asked the waitress about the lunch specials, she said there weren't any lunch specials because of CES. If you're going to do that, take that sign out on the front. Otherwise, it's just dishonest, and super irritating.

Ordered to share: miso soup, rock and roll, silver state roll, and the scallop volcano roll. Scallop volcano roll was def the fave and hope to find something at home like it.
First time here. Really nice atmosphere. Great sushi! I highly recommend the fire cracker roll.

eh.
way too expensive for the mediocrity of the sushi.
there are SO many better places to choose from.

I am no sushi expert, but both my brother and I agree that this may have been the best sushi roll we have had and not a bad price. The service was great as well, I drink a lot of water and my glass never even got empty.

Loved this place. Nice quiet spot off the strip, and with off-the-strip prices. Went twice during a week-long work trip there and it was a nice respite from the pretention and BS elsewhere in Vegas. The rolls were inventive and terrific, with good quality fish. I sat at the sushi bar both times and found the sushi chefs to be friendly and knowledgeable, and struck up a wonderful hour-long conversation with a fellow solo customer that lasted well after our food was done.
On my moms this shit smack. I got a Hawaiian roll. It was solid. It had the texture of tuna but it was abalone. The service was a1. My cup was neva empty you feel me.

This is defiantly one of the best sushi places in Las Vegas. Always consistently delicious sushi. I come twice a year for a trade show and I don't miss this place. I look forward to having sushi at Kaizen. The crispy rice is one of the best I've tasted ever. And also the spicy tuna salad is my favorite. 
I live in LA where sushi is king. Thus place is better than any place in LA. A must gem close to Hard Rock Hotel. Serving is always spot on.
Fresh and delicious sushi walking distance from the Hard Rock Hotel. Extremely affordable price. I've been here over a dozen time in the last couple years. Highly recommended.
Came here for happy hour - amazing decor and prices. Do yourself a favor and get off the strip for dinner!

My girlfriends who were in town staying on the strip wanted sushi and since I am a local and have a car I demanded we leave the strip and go here. We ordered the avocado train roll, the unicorn and another I don't remember the name of... But let me just say not only was the presentation of the rolls great, the flavor was amazing! They were beyond happy with this place which made me feel good. The venue is clean and I really like the set up. Some intimate tables on the side but the middle has big long benches for a unique seating expierence. Would be great for a big group! The server was incredibly friendly and helpful with his suggestions for what we should order. I am looking forward to coming here again.

No all you can eat. This ones for the tourists. If you want all the sushi you can eat for 25$ go to spring mountain road. Good sushi here, but you get as much as you want anywhere else in vegas. Don't be fooled!

Go go all you can eat!!!

One of the best sushi places I've ever been to in the U.S. I was skeptical at first with reading some of these reviews. Im so glad I listened to my daughter and came. It was her birthday so her wish. We ate the Unicorn Roll, Orange Blossom, and the T something girls roll. Delicious!!! And highly recommended. We'll be back.

Holy mackerel... I was not expecting this dining experience. Just arrived from LA to visit my grandparents for the holiday, got out of the care home way later than expected, hotel check-in was a mess, all the boyfriend and I felt like was sushi. It was 10:30 and everything was about to close at 11. We gave up on the "epic Vegas dining experience" and just picked the highest rated sushi joint on yelp that was open. Some place in a strip mall. (Eyebrow raised)

Just upon walking in, we were shocked to see and feel such a nice and trendy vibe. Clean, classy, good music, nice bar, neat tables. We sat at the bar and opened the fabulously photographed menus. Sushi spots with photos is a major plus for me and they had EVERYTHING photographed. We picked a bunch of stuff and were blown away with not only the taste/freshness/quality of fish, but the presentation, price/portions, service... Just everything. The bill ended up being $122 and trust me... we were really going for it. Anywhere else back in LA would have racked up to $200+. 

We stayed and hung out well after we were stuffed to the brim. The ambiance is nice and I felt like I was getting a special type of Vegas experience without all the hustle and bustle. I will absolutely be showing this place off to friends who join me on future trips. What a treat!

Oh yeah... And it's open until 6am. AND they have a happy hour that starts at midnight. GENIUS!!!

I posted photos of what we ate - albacore topped with fried onions, filet mignon salad, white rose roll, sea bass & unagi. We also had saki bombs, the largest portion of edemami ever, uni and crispy tuna tostada things. YUM YUMMMMM YUM

Consistently solid sushi spot. A little pricey given its just like any other sushi resturaunt (you cant really fuck up sushi for me lol). We did notice the sashimi we ordered was warm? Room temperature is appropriate but it being warm kind of sketched us out a bit... The fish could be fresher, but overall I enjoyed Kaizen, just as I usually do. Will keep coming back.

Stopped in here after Yama Sushi had an 50 minute wait! The decor reminded me of a nightclub. We ordered Gyoza and an assortment of other sushi rolls. The service was pretty good.  All of the rolls were pretty good, but the real standout was Japanese lasagna. it tasted different from Sushi-mon's or even Yama's because it tasted more like it should be called 'Japanese Mac N Cheese'. it was refreshing and interesting tasting. 
The Gyoza was not as awesome. I'm not a fan of deep-fried gyoza.
This place definitely hit the spot for my sushi craving. However upon leaving the restaurant i realized it wasn't the same as Yama sushi. Still good, but not the same.

This isn't my first time eating at kaizen but decided to do a review. I love their food here. It bums me they no longer do all you can. I remember the last I went they do all you can eat. I don't know if it was seasonal. But my favorite entrees here would have to be the baked salmon or the beef teriyaki. The serving fills me up. Other than that, I do love their baked rolls. I would definitely recommend the baked lasagna. Super duper good. If you're into tempura roll I would recommend the crazy boy roll. 8 pieces for only 7 bucks! I love the eel sauce. The food is great overall. For service wise, it's fair. You'll have the good waiters and sometimes the bad ones.

This place is located right across the street from HR hotel ( home of trendy Nobu). We come here when we have a larger group or a mixed group who like a wide range Japanese food. The fish is very fresh and some really good non traditional rolls for those who like them, The atmosphere is casual, the staff very friendly and the prices are reasonable.

Stopped in for some late dinner encouraged by the reviews here but still skeptical. I sat at the end of the sushi bar so I could watch the food being prepared. I was impressed with the care and attention to detail. I asked for an eel hand roll which was made quickly and well. I decided to try one of their crazy fusion rolls and ordered the Unicorn. All the ingredients came together well and the slightly spicy, slightly vinegary sauce really added some kick and acid while letting all the flavors of the fish and shrimp and lobster come through. Staff was friendly, attentive and efficient. Prices were reasonable. Overall I would definitely come here again and recommend it to friends.
Best sushi place in Vegas .. And one of my personal favorites .. Everything tastes on point with good quality Service and friendly staff !! The satisfy my sushi cravings!!

let's start with the food. wtf, so every piece of sushi I picked up break apart before hitting my mouth. I ended up with a soup of ell sauce and rice. second, the service, two servers working together and after ordering more food ( at this point I was so hungry and it was late, I wasn't leaving) so dude takes my order and joy, oh sweet joy. comes by asks if I needed anything. I replied , no I'm good thnx. she comes back with a check. at this point I had to point out there's more food coming. haha I was like wow. not to mention that I asked for a bottle of fiji and she placed it on the table after a few minutes I go and pour it and it was frozen, I mean not a drop can squeeze out. like can you not tell the damn thing is swollen and frozen and she was like " I'm sorry the busser must of left it in the freezer" I'm thinking... didn't you notice? probably she just didn't care.
This placed my left nut and joy sucked my right. so at the end of the day, I guess I left happy. lol
I definitely don't recommend it and suggest for them to work on service and their sushi chef's or people pretending, really need to get training or start giving a shit. 
two thumbs down. never again.

While I was in Vegas for my friends birthday, we decided to get some sushi. This place came up when I searched, "all you can eat sushi." Sadly, it wasn't. But we stayed and gave it a shot.
