The service was awesome. Our waitress was friendly and patient with all 7 of us. We ordered a variety of rolls, and every single one of them was delicious. 

They also had some late happy hour, which is after 12am, and it's buy one get one free.

Very clean place as well. 

Give it shot!

Total quality management.

Look it up: http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Kaizen

Edamame and cold tofu with ponzu both delivered.

Mountain of salted goodness on the former, rectangles of soybean with sweet homemade ponzu sauce on the latter. Loved both.

Rolls were massive if unmemorable. Rainbow featured an assortment of fish, Mackerel Madness was pretty mad with mackerel and more ponzu sauce.

Yet a week later not much stands out from either.

Reasonably priced and a space that tries to be as cool as possible.

Call it three stars for reaching middle management.

What a fun little sushi joint. While we were in Vegas for the long weekend, we had a late night (2am) craving for dinner and of course, almost nothing was still open except buffets and Kaizen sushi. Score one for the sushi joint. A taxi driver recommended the spot to me and I have to say he was on point.

Walking in, it's a small place. But the decor is warm and inviting, as are the staff. They were playing music videos and tables full of people appeared to be having a great time doing sake bombs. 

Their menu is HUGE. It's almost near impossible to make a choice based on all the yummy pictures and descriptions. But I settled on the Japanese steak and veggies (yummy shiitake mushrooms) and my friend ordered the albacore and the beef tataki (sp?) The food was so delicious that even as we stuffed ourselves silly, we made sure to wrap up the leftovers and take them back to the room. 

The price was affordable, service was quick, knowledgable and friendly, and they called us a cab to go back to the room. And did I mention they're open until 3am? Kudos. I'm definitely a fan and will return next time I'm in Sin City.

Oh my. I can't gush enough about this place. It's across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino. We were craving sushi while gambling there and almost went to Nobu. Thankful for checking Yelp we came here instead to save a few bucks. I can't tell you how happy I am that I came here! We had the Kaizen cheviche which was heaven. Then we had the Kaizen scallop dynamite which is baked with mushrooms and cheese. I would have ordered another had we not ordered rolls. I'm a scallop fan and this was just mouth-watering good! The prices are reasonable and I'll admit I'd pay Nobu prices for this deliciousness. Don't be fooled by those high end places. Come to a local spot like this and have a great meal!
I like the fact that this open late, so when you just heading out from a vegas show and in the mood for a hot ramen, this is the place to go! Fast service and food is great!!!

This is a new spot that we will come to when we come to Vegas! The food was sooo good! The eel bowl was so good, the hungry roll and philidelphia roll was great too! Everything tasted fresh. The waiters are attentive but don't know if because there were only 3 guest here on a Sunday but none the less great staff. If u Check in on yelp and do a review u get a free something lol explains why there are so many reviews lol great place great food and great staff:) 
If I could change just one thing it would be the can sodas, no refills. It didn't bother us mich but just maybe something we would of liked to know before ordering a soda.
Great sushi. The menu has a lot of different choices to choose from with all you can eat. I definitely always recommend this place to my friends.

This place was AMAZING :) 

The sushi chefs were personable, friendly and had some awesome sushi recommendations :) 

The restaurant was clean, had a great atmosphere, good bar selection and fabulous service.

Must try the avocado train and orange blossom roll

Absolutely amazing sushi sushi spot here in Vegas!! Definitely try the KISS OF FIRE ROLL, my favorite. Great staff, great service and the restaurant is beautiful. We came here every time we're in town.

It's open late, it serves sushi(meh sushi) and the prices seem to reflect the fact that it's across the street from the Hard Rock. That combination is not something that will ever make me want to come back. Not to mention all 3 of the rolls I ordered were sloppily made and didn't seem to be the freshest of fish. Pass!

High quality fish, fusion cuisine. Their sushi is incredible!!! Good selection of wines.Very good service , cozy atmosphere. Expansive, but reasonable if you take into account organic ingredients. Furniture must be updated / changed as soon as possible. We go there for good food and willing to pay the price , stays open for industry till 4... give it a shot.
I don't yelp... but this place was so good I am sitting at the table writing how amazing the sushi is! Screw Nobu. Walk across the street!

Love this place! Go weekly since we were staying nearby when we first moved here. Get the same thing every time - tempura shrimp or lobster roll and chicken katsu. And of course sake and beer. The place is lively and there is a video screen which is a bit loud, but works in this place. 

Service is excellent. We love Tom. This place is also kid friendly and my daughter's favorite place to eat.

First time here and came on a Saturday night and was quickly seated. Love the ambiance and the open concept.

I ordered the Baked Salmon Roll and  the tempura appetizer! The food came quickly and both were very good! I love that the rolls weren't huge where they weren't falling off which I love!! The tempura wasn't overcooked either and not too greasy! 

Lastly the service was impeccable! Everyone checked on us and always made sure our drinks were topped off! So glad we came here!! =)

Living in Seattle, I'm spoiled with fresh sushi. Who knew that I would find it in Vegas too?

There are a bunch of different rolls, each drool worthy and the prices are fair. If you're a big fan of mussels, their mussels are huge!!! I love it.

The decor is modern and very spacious. The restaurant is off the strip, but totally worth the trip out there.

Also opens until very late :) aka 4am... for all you party animals you.

came here by accident. the  korean bbq place nearby was closed. but turns out this place aint too shabby.  i love the decor and with our big group of 15+, we sat at the long tall table by the door.  i can't review what everyone else had but my ahi tuna salad was BOMB! too bad it didn't stay in my stomach long =\

the service was good probably due to the fact that we went during lunch time when it was pretty much dead.

I saw the amazing reviews and really craved sushi so I came here with my mom. I hardly go to vegas so I'm not familiar with anything. Everything on the menu looked really good and sounded appetizing. Or it could've been that I was starving. We ordered a few plates. The seared salmon appetizer was way too salty. I had to tell them to take it back. And all the items on the menu was mainly tuna. Halfway eating I was starting to get sick of the smell and taste of tuna. This experience wasn't what I hoped for. If I'm ever in vegas, I probably wouldn't come back.

Sushi was ok but one of the nigiris had bone in it and we saw a bug next to our table :( the toro was 20 dollars for 2 pieces which was too much in my opinion because it didn't even taste like anything special or mind blowing. This place I believe is overpriced and overrated !!! I would've given 3 stars because the other sushi was good but service was slow and they weren't even busy that day :(

I love eating here. They usually have some sort of special fresh fish like tonight blue fin tuna. I don't know why more people from hard rock don't venture over here. Its way better than most of the places over there and right across the street.

My wife and I were their by chance. The Korean BBQ next door was closed for maintenance and we decided to grab a quick bite here. Suffice to say, we ordered Uni and it was the worst mistake we could have made. It was spoiled!! I immediately spit mine out in my napkin and my wife ended up swallowing hers out of respect and embarrassment of not making a scene. I feel very bad for her and upset with this establishment. They should have known better than to serve rotten Uni. Uni is best within three days. Their Uni must have been over a week old judging by the  texture, smell, and horrible taste from being spoiled. Well the next day my wife started feeling sick and her condition has gotten worse as the day progressed. Fever, vomit, and so on without embarrassing her more. The worst part is we were on vacation and the last day of our trip she got sick. She hasn't been able to eat all day.  I hope she gets better soon. They comped only the rotten Uni. They should have comped our whole meal and then some for what they are putting my poor wife through.

I don't see why people like this place so much! They have horrible service! It's seriously the service that gets them the 1 star. First of all no one was even in the front to greet you.
We ordered two hot teas and NEVER got them, but was still charged for it.
The sushi rolls were good. The food is good don't get me wrong. But the waitresses that work here don't even want to be there. 
Some other waitress that wasn't even helping us in the first place got us water. And apologized for her coworkers mistake. Wait why are you apologizing...? The Asian waitress should be apologizing. Anyways I definitely will not be coming back. Management needs to check up on this because several people are complaining about the service. 

On top of all that another customer walks I'm after us and gets his drinks and food before us? Thanks for the slap in the face.

This place has a Japanese name, but definitely Korean owned.

I suggest to order togo to avoid this situation.

Open really late and great sushi

I have stopped in here on numerous times to Vegas. Mainly because i get into town late and after a full day of traveling i need somewhere "non vegas strip" to eat and relax.

There best roll is hands down the "sexy roll" but ill let you be the judge cause there all good. The waitresses are nice and the place has a nice layout. Nice top 40 hits with a huge screen where they play the music video to whatever song is playing. Kinda cool to watch if you dont wanna chill at the bar and watch whatever sports game they have on.
One of my favorite weekday lunch spots. As a local it's hard to find a decent off strip sushi place that is good and has fair prices. They have awesome lunch specials and a hip fun environment.

my second time here and I will be returning. We picked up some friends from the strip who were visiting and they wanted sushi. I tried another local favorite but it was an hour wait. Kaizen was just a 30 minute wait and I'm glad we did.

The service was great. The orders were taken almost as quickly as our drinks were brought out and rolls were quick to follow. They all had excellent flavors and our out of town friends agreed we made the right selection on where to eat. Very clean and a friendly staff.

Fresh and delicious sushi! If you don't want to spend lots of money at the casino sushi bars or at Nobu@Hard Rock (which is across the street) go to Kaizen. They have a GREAT AMBIANCE!, cool vibe and current music/videos! They have a long sushi bar with a couple of plasma TV's where you can watch sports. The menu has many options- our favorite was the roll that had salmon, macadamia nuts, avocado and jalapeno! YUM!  DO NOT GO TO Yokohama for sushi which is diagonally across the street. I don't know why it got so many good reviews. Go to Kaizen...you won't be disappointed.
Very delicious food!! Try the garlic edamame ! Great ambiance and friendly staff! This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in Vegas!!!

2 rolls, a beer and a large hot sake for under $40 bucks...in Vegas...yeah. Almost unbelievable, but true.
The rolls were just ok. It was only better than fast food because it was fish and rice. Had it been coated in grease, it probably would have tasted about the same. It was just ok.
The price was fantastic - the sake was good. Cold beer is always cold beer. The waitstaff was friendly and sweet - the sushi chefs looked like they were biding their time until something better came along and you could taste it in the rolls.
It was walking distance from my hotel...a little off the beaten path from the strip... and I like this.
Visiting Las Vegas and was looking for the closest sushi place to me and found this place. Sushi combo is a great deal and the fish tastes very very fresh! Great food for a great price!

BOO. So disappointed.

Came here around 8 on a Saturday night after Yama's Sushi had a 30 minute wait.
Soon as we came, we were seated immediately which was good because we had a party to go to at 10.

Each of my friends ordered a hot/cooked dish and a specialty roll; I ordered the chirashi (sashimi sampler on rice) because I didn't want to be too full for the night's festivities.

In 15 mins, my friends each got their cooked meal - seafood curry, chicken katsu, and chicken teriyaki donburi. Told my friends to eat as my food was surely to come out soon.
I watched my friends eat as I drank water; and watched more and more people come into the restaurant. 
Before I knew it, my friends were done with their meals. And I started noticing that the groups of people that came after us were getting their sushi. This was about 30 mins after ordering.
We kept looking for our waitress for the next 5-10 minutes but, no one came into our section. We, finally, had to wave down the hostess to check on our sushi.

My friends' specialty rolls, finally, came. But, at that point, their food had already settled and they weren't hungry. 
Finally...after an hour of waiting, my food came. By that time, I didn't even wanna eat it.


For a city that has all these AYCE and stellar sushi spots, Kaizen should be lucky to be open. And with service like this; forget it!
Food was good , service was even better. We ordered the Kai sushi roll and the Nevada roll . sushi is just typical sushi to fix your cravings .

so to start this review id like to say that the manager of the company never returned my phone call but did call my brother back who threatened to call the health department on them and responded without saying sorry or taking any responsibility for not 1 but 3 of the 4 people getting sick. But instead defended their food and any possibility of it happening. Nor did he offer any sort of reconcilement. Thursday morning at 3:45am we sat down and ate with a group of 4. 1 of which only ate her 1 roll but the 3 of us shared the rest. It took 2 hours for the stomach pain to start. An hour later is when I first began throwing up and the rest of the symptoms that come with food poisoning throughout the day and through the night. I was supposed to go to the lake thursday am and had to cancel that and had surgery planned friday morning which had to be rescheduled due to the pain and weakness i had. My brother called the restaurant on paradise where we ate, he never got a call bak until the next day he called again and said he would be calling the health department as stated and only then did he get a call back. The manager brought up the idea of us drinking alocohol, mind you i didn't drink as i needed to be up for the lake. Wasnt at all apologetic for the incident only tried basically putting the blame on everything but the restaurants food. I would also like to state that i posted on my instagram story about the incident and i had not 1 but 5 others stating they had gotten sick from the same company. So as of now i will be taking this into my own hands so i can let the public know about this company. I will be contacting the news station as well.
Teriyaki chicken bowl you can't go wrong ! I may have had this dish about a dozen times . It's big very filling and extremely tasty . For the price you definitely can not go wrong .
Near the strip but not on the strip.  Great sushi at a reasonable price... my 13 year old was craving sushi and our stop into Kaizen hit the spot!

I used to love this place. I would frequent this place at least once or twice a week. Any special celebrations I would tell my friends and family to go there. Anyway we came in with a party of eight and were told to wait for a table to be put together. We waited for about 20 minutes. Finally I told them we don't need to be seated together. We just need two tables. The lady said the available tables are reserved for reservations. I was like OK?!  There were six tables available and she kept insisting they are reserved for reservations. So I told the lady no worries we'll go somewhere else. She said OK bye. Which to me was funny because obviously she didn't care about customer service. We drove down a couple streets to I LOVE SUSHI. THE PLACE IS FANTASTIC!!!

Very good sushi--4 stars
Service----2.5-3 stars

Customer service is questionable.   We waited about 50 min for a table although we were told 15 min.  Don't order wine here.  Stick with beer or sake or soda.  She paid $13 for a GLASS of wine which sells at Costco for $8 A BOTTLE.  The person who settled our check didnt split the bill among the card but charged one person the balance.  It was really a mess and there were only 5 people in our party.  I would return but will keep these things in mind.

Ate here last night. It was pretty good. I had the spicy tuna crispy rice, the fire cracker roll, and the Crispy soft shell crab appetizer. The spicy tuna crispy rice was very good. and the firecracker roll was great as well. I wasnt a big fan of the crispy soft shell crab. I usually am, but this one had a pretty heavy batter on it much like the cheap frozen breaded shimp you can buy at the grocery store. Overall it was pretty good, and the staff was very friendly. They were out of large Sapporos, so they brought me 2 small ones...at the same time...I probably looked like a lush double fisting it in a sushi bar, but I dont mind that. :)
The menu had alot of very interesting and different combinations of sushi that I'll have to go back and try sometime. I'd recommend it if you are looking for a semi-modern take on sushi.

PS. I went to the one off of Eastern and Horizon ridge...not the one by on Paradise.

Kaizen Is not the cheapest sushi spot out there but the service and quality of the food makes up for the price. They're happy hour is on every night from 10pm to 2am and If you go on they're website you can print out a coupon to get a free Saki Bomb with a purchase of 15 dollars or more.

I love, love, love this sushi! I can't always dine in so it is good to know you can call in an order and pick it up, easy peesy! The food is fresh, the service is fantastic, and it is a great place to take people visiting Vegas!

Rolld here are super good and service was great! They had shishito peppers and chili oil which not a lot of sushi restaurants have nowadays. We came here late after a night out and they were open until 3am :).
Huge variety of sushi! The people working there are very helpful and energetic. The food was amazing as well! Definitely coming back!

Ok let start off that this place is probably where they invented sushi and the Japanese stole the idea from this establishment can't tell you how many times I go to this place everytime I go to Vegas but the amount of different sushi rolls they have are very unique

Happy Hour on drinks start at midnight Monday through Thursday and it's the best place to go and get budget stuff I do my sake bombs and then head out to the club after

Here are the things I tried so far
Bbq roll - out of this world

Yummy sushi.  I love coming back here everytime I am in Vegas!  The Baked Mussels for Appetizers are delicious.  Will order again when we come back.  Everything you order here takes great and the service is fast and very good!

This place is great. The way it's decorated gives it a really nice ambiance. The vibe made us wanna stay there longer just to chill. The service was great. And of course the sushi was fresh and delicious! The portions are big and the presentation is excellent.
Great staff, and the shogun roll was delicious. This place made a great impression on Vegas sushi!

Perhaps the most delicious halibut dinner with roasted veggies I have ever had. Very attentive waitstaff nice atmosphere and we were able to watch the Olympics on a large screen TV. Really exceptional food--would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.
lunch was  okay the service isn't the best the lady kept confusing me when i tried to order a bento box

Across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel, this place is totally convenient and super yummy. They have a ton of fun rolls to share, including a few no-rice rolls that low carb LA-eaters interested in drinking their calories in Vegas can appreciate (myself included).

Of course, I recommend the HARD ROCK ROLL and the SPICY TUNA SALAD that has huge chucks of tuna and nice, light dressing.
Kaizen on Paradise Rd is great. I like there Japanese Tai and the Blue Fin Toro melts in my mouth. The price is good compared to the strip restaurants. Must come try this place out

Staff is really attentive and friendly. Food was amazing, great options. I'm a vegan so I have to shoehorn that in here somewhere, because vegan. Also crossfit. Good food, good vibes.  10/10 would go Kaizen.
First Kiss Roll is delicious and service is very attentive. Open late for all you night owls. I come here sometimes twice a week! I would also try the green apple saki ...

We visit this sushi spot every time we come to Vegas. It is our go to for sushi and with good reason, their food is fabulous! I sadly didn't take any pictures because I totally thought I had reviewed this spot before. 

   I definitely recommend it. I always the white rose roll, Tako sashimi, and the tempura green tea ice cream. I did order additional items this time, the unicorn roll and a tempura appetizer. 

   The unicorn roll was good. The tempura was not the best I've had, but I've been to Japan comparatively, and not a lot of tempura here meets that quality. Not all tempura is created equal! Lol. 

   Our group ordered probably about 5 or 6 other rolls that everyone shared and nothing was disappointing. This place always delivers and they're open super late night. 

  Another biggie is their fish quality! It's great, never any questions or concerns about freshness.

Every time I come to Vegas, I make it a point to eat at Kaizen!!! Food is always delicious and menu is 14 pages! Best of all, happy hour is 10 pm to 4am! Buy 1 get 1 free alcohol! Love the service too!!!!

I must point out that I did not have any sushi here! So in order for this place to get a fair and unbiased opinion on their food,  do not count on this review. 

I came here simply because I was staying across the street at HRH and it was a walking distance for a drunk person. I got tired of burgers and pizzas, and I wanted something different. This place had teriyaki bowls at $8.95 a bowl. It wasn't a restaurant quality teriyaki bowl as I expected. Infact I have had way better ones in Socal at mom and pop places. However I m must say I do like the ambiance of this place. They got a sports bar style counter setup with some flat  screens. And behind the bar were the chefs making sushi on the fly. If I was into Sushi, I would definitely come here.  I was just so hammered that day where raw fish would've been a trip killer.  

This place is definitely worth checking out if you need a good walking distance munchies spot from the HRH.

Was there last nite. Friend took me to this place for a light dinner. The food was great and the price was reasonable. He has some sushi and steak and the screaming salad was delicious. Your money is worth at this place. Not to crowded maybe because it's a Thursday but no doubt I really enjoyed the food. Thanks for a nice dinner.

My favorite sushi bar in Las Vegas! Open all night (I think until 5 or 6 AM!  Very friendly, cool atmoshphe3re, great music and of course FANTASTIC fresh sushi! I have been here several times and it never disappoints. In a good area across from Hard Rock. Reasonable prices, great drinks... the only thing I would suggest is that they put seat cushions on the middle tables... they are cool but seats are hard!
A hidden gem across from the hard rock! Fresh sushi and amazing mochi! Please stop in if you can! So chill and relaxing in here with great food and people.

This is by far my favorite sushi place in town. I highly recommend the Rose roll.  And the staff is the coolest ever. Each visit to Vegas I bring my guest and we're never disappointed.  Thank you rocking sushi!

Good, not great, food with absolutely horrendous service. Greatly improved service could bump it to four stars, and having just one more server might do it.

Enjoyed the food, but the terribly inattentive service was inexcusable.
What they lack in customer service they definitely make up for with ambience and the quality of the food they serve the presentation isn't bad also
This sushi house has a relaxed atmosphere, fresh sushi, and good service. I will be back for sure. Thanks for the free roll!

Good -  The food is excellent.
Bad  _  service is terrible.  Lunchtime service would be better if I went to the kitchen to get it  myself.  wait staff obviously has little training.
              Ask for hot tea and you might wait 20 minutes.

Ugly  - Showed up 12:26 went in the open door and was told by the bartender(Bruskly)  to leave because they were not open yet... (Opening posted on door was 12:30???)

Beware of 24 hour sushi places - even in Vegas.  Tried to give us something that was supposed to be tempura shrimp but was actually panko then redid with the same veggies which came out overdone.  Forgot the chicken karaagi - then when it finally came out when we were done it was these odd little pieces, NOT karaagi.  Take heed.

I can say only amazing!

 The food SOOOOOOOOO fresh, 
  The please Extra clean, they all on top of what they need to do! 
EXCELLENT service!!!!
 
 Food ready Extra fast, the hand roll is HUGE it's 3 times bigger then any hand roll I've seen.

Highly recomend

I am staying at the Hard Rock hotel so the walk is not bad at all, it's right across the street so it is convenient. The place is really nice and cute with modern decor. The service was really good and everyone was really polite and friendly. I ordered the Kai roll and BBQ short ribs, which was really good. I would definitely recommend this place!!

This place is a most pleasant surprise! It's in a little strip mall, a 5 min walk from Hard Rock and The Alexis. Quick, friendly, attentive staff. I like the layout and how they compartmentalized the "booths". Food comes quick. Quality sushi so good i had to order same thing twice (snow white roll, YUM) cos my bf devoured the first plate even before he got his own (banana roll). One thing i really liked is that the rolls were tight so things aren't falling around the plate. 
This place makes me think we've been to the wrong places! Lol
Absolutely delicious. My udon was hot and tasty. The monkey brain perfectly prepared and the service super friendly.
Just go. Just eat here. Sushi is delicious, the atmosphere is super lax, & the service is good.

If you love fusion rolls, this is the place.  Mind you I've only been here once during my trip to Vegas but it was definitely unforgettably delicious.  We only got rolls so I can't say much about their other food.  However, the maki (rolls) were very creative and well combined ingredients.  It isn't cheap but definitely worth the money IMO.  

I would come back here next time I am in the Vegas area.
Definetly would recommend this place for tempura rolls. staff is friendly. came here outta the blue and wasnt dissappointed.
Snow White is super good! Fav sushi spot! The ayce is really worth the money and you just gotta check this place out! I go every chance I get

Awesome spot to get late night sushi off the strip! My large and rowdy group of friends rolled in around 2:30am with late night sushi cravings. Sorry we were so loud! Wait staff was great in accommodating this very rude group of friends. If your friends yell very loud inappropriate sexual things that may or may not disturb the other diners, this place will still not kick you out! Believe me, they are great! 

Do not under any circumstances order the baked scallops or some roll with jalapeños on top of it! Both my friends said those two items were gross. However, the roll I ordered that has ponzu sauce on it was delicious and I heard the Poke is phenomenal so could be hit or miss. The menu has excellent pictures so you can use your best judgement to make the right decision. Although, making right decisions and being in Las Vegas usually don't go together.

We came in at 6 on a Friday night and sat at the bar, had excellent service, everything was amazing. Started with the salmon and yellowtail nigiri and an order of egg rolls. Both cuts were super fresh, melt in your mouth type sushi. Then we went to the rolls, had a Tokyo and Bing roll. Amazing! Topped it off with dessert, or as we do....another salmon nigiri! Definitely recommend for anyone staying in hard rock or the Hyatt.

Kaizen is at a great location. We came because it was very close to our hotel after we got to Las Vegas after midnight, and it was surprisingly amazing! (So I decide to give my first yelp review ever)

The staff was really nice and friendly, he recommended us the avocado train and a few other rolls which were all great. The fish was pretty fresh and the sauce was delicious! Highly recommend the avocado train if you're a big fan of avocado :)

They also had happy hour which we could buy one drink and get another free :)

I've been here a few times and let me just say, avoid on Saturday nights at all costs. The atmosphere is awful, a trashy crowd lingers and don't forget the extremely loud and cheesy music, its uncomfortable for anyone wanting a dinner where you don't feel like you are in a college-esque nightclub. The hostess couldn't be any ruder either, saying we couldn't get our food at the bar, and then she changed her mind after we were seated at a table- its like we are at a sushi bar at a strip mall not the Queen of Englands quarters, no need for the snobbery. Anyways, the sushi chefs are awesome and very friendly, and any other day or time is great to grab a bite to eat here, they also have Saketinis that are soooo adorable and delicious.
Your korean bbq is the bomb! It's very delicious! I enjoyed eating here! Very modernized!
First time trying a sushi place out in Vegas! Green chili tempura is super good highly recommend trying out this place if your in the area!!!

Came to kaizen with my mom while visiting Vegas. Our friends suggested we try kaizen because they love it. I'm vegetarian and they were very accommodating. The sushi roll i created was amazing and the garlic edamame was delicious. They service was very attentive and friendly. We will definitely be back our next time in town.
Those is our goto place for sushi in Vegas.  You can walk across the street from Hard Rock.  Great rolls, great sushi.  Cooked foods are great too.  Highly recommended!

Worst service ever!!!!! I'm never coming back here again! Our server sucked, he was rude and extremely unprofessional. We were a party of 6, out food took forever and when we complained about it, an employee who claimed to be the owner, yelled at us!
Excellent flavors here, ordered a few rolls and wished we would've found this place earlier in our trip!  Try anything with eel, one of the best I've had.

First, I have to thank Mary P. for this suggestion.  Actually, she suggested the location in North Las Vegas. But still glad I came here. 

I was staying at the Hard Rock and wanted some sushi. Had Hamada's 2 nights prior (see review) and it was horrible. Had to redeem myself.

Service:  Tons of staff to the point that you will always have someone at your needs.  Good job Team Kaizen.

Now for the food.  Tried their Spicy Tuna, Chicken Katsu w/Brown Rice, Baked Salmon,and Caterpillar Roll.  All were tasty, fresh, not fishy, and made to order. My co-worker had a special roll created exactly how he wanted it.  Always good when they can improvise. 

Can't wait to try the location in North Las Vegas.  Only issue with this place is that they lack AYCE. But they stated they were better than the north location.  We'll see, I will be the judge

This is a great place, nice atmosphere! I had the  shogun roll and shishito peppers, all fresh and delicious! My friend had the scallop volcano roll and loved it. Her first time having shishito peppers and agreed they were delicious.  Parking was easy and away from the strip and casino crowd. Good for families or a fun date. Also great options if you aren't into raw fish.

Decent food.   Great atmosphere.   I had the shrimp  tempura and it was good.  Not great but good.   I like the fact that they're open super late we came today primetime I would probably only come back late night it's not gonna be my prime time spot in the morning but late night I might give it another chance

Probably the best sushi I've had and I've tried several spots in LA. sushi is fresh (pleasantly surprised by the real crab in the Rainbow Roll), service is fast, and it's a nice relaxing spot to go before you start your night! May even be back here later since they're open til 6 am. 

Very close to the Hard Rock!

Looks like our new go-to spot for sushi when we come here.

After a long night  and a long drive, I wasn't too impressed with this place. We ordered 3 different rolls and they must've thought that we were ordering from the kiddie menu. Even the sauces could be measured by a squirt. I don't know if this is the norm or if they figured that we wouldn't recognize the bite sizes until we reached home. The only good thing was that it was open at 12:30 in the morning.

Ordered the tuna sashimi plate didn't care for it. 
Ordered the double yellowtail roll, didn't enjoy that as well.
Ordered the kiss of fire it was good but not great. 

I've been to kaizen a few times, usually it's on point and decent quality.  This time I don't feel like that was the case. Tuna sashimi was warm and fish did not look fresh. That kinda put me off on the whole meal.
Great sushi, good atmosphere. Unusually odd music choice (DJ techno dance music? Insert gag reflex here. Was i supposed to BYO Molly?) but it IS Las Vegas so what do you expect?

The restaurant is super clean and modern.  Hip and electric Music is playing in the background. Servers are nice and I would recommend this place to anyone.  The sauce can be on the sugary side fyi. Ivan was super nice.    Request him.

This restaurant made my fiance and I physically ill. It is by far the worst sushi joint I have ever been to. Not only did they completely screw up my takeout order, but they served us bad fish. I called to speak with management and was told I would be called back the next day. I called back the next day after my call wasn't returned, and again, no manager. Same thing for day 3 and 4. Only after threatening to contact the health department was I coincidentally given to the manager. Who offered no apology, and instead offered a $20 credit for next time. Why on earth would I return to a restaurant that made me sick?? Anyway, I was eventually offered a $11.99 cash refund. Which is a complete joke, not to mention insult. I will be contacting the health department this morning, as this is not acceptable. This place should be shut down for criminal negligence.

Solid place for sushi. Good portions and large menu variety with fast service. My boyfriend and I got the spicy tuna salad which was HUGE (a bit too spicy for my tastes but still tasty). We also got the Kai and Twilight rolls and they did not disappoint. 

All in all, great place if you're nearby.

5 stars for being the only sushi restaurant open so late (conveniently across from the Hard Rock!)  The service was on point when I went and the food came out very quickly.  Only downside I see is that there aren't any private tables.  The Saketinis were delicious! I tried the pomegranate and lychee and would highly recommend the lychee.  The rolls were delicious, and if youre a raw food/sashimi fanatic, definitely try out the Rose Roll!  My server was very attentive and continuously checked in/out with me and my SO.  If you're drunk or hungry at 2AM and you're looking for an amazing sushi restaurant, then stop by at Kaizen!

I go to this place a few times a month for dinner because of the tasty food, shockingly good services and reasonable prices. Always stuffed by the time I leave.

Made the decision to go there for lunch and was happily surprised with their lunch menu.

Although I ordered my regular Chicken Teriyaki bowl, my friends ordered the "boxes" which is only available at lunch. Will order the Box next time since you get a lot of different types of food for the same price.

Love this restaurant!!!

JUST LEFT Kaizen. Sat at Sushi bar with owner/chef Danny- Let him create me dinner. TOTALLY DISAPPOINTING. Charged me $162 for absolutly mediocre sushi...stay away from this RIP OFF place. NOBU across the street, might be just as expensive, but the fish would be fresh and taste much better. A total rip off- NEVER again. If you go, don't say you weren't warned. HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!

Kaizen sits across from the Hard rock hotel nestled in the corner of the CVS plaza. Between Capriotti's and Ferraro's Italian. 

Here is the breakdown according to me. It's in my area.. it's slightly over-priced sushi.. and the service is sometimes good, sometimes they forget things.. lol.. what do you want from a place that is often pumping until 5 am. 

We head over there for a late night sushi fix, and most importantly.. the 2 for 1 .. ANYTHING from the bar.. after midnight. Usually that equals cheap sake and beer.. but it does the trick for cheap. Also I always see Carrot top there.. which is good or bad? You tell me.. it just is :] 

You can find me there on any given evening with a crew or just me and one of my foodie buddies.. mostly for me it's about the liquor and the broiled yellow tail fish collar. Yes... you read that right. if you don't know, now you know.. check it out. It's not that you can't get fish collar at other Asian style eateries, but this one is close by so I'm there most :)

Happy Eating!

Unique sushi like giant clam and abalone sushi..I didn't  like eating either one of them. The giant clam just didnt have much flavor. The abalone was like eating cartilage.

The fatty  tuna was good and some kind of fish belly sashimi was good. Service was soooo slow in the beginning. It took forever just to get started with our beer/sake. The sashimi is a bit better than an average place, but not great. Uni was not fresh. Sweet shrimp was not that great ($28 for 4 pieces).

We ordered 3 bottles of sake and 2 bottles of beer for 11 people. We couldn't finish 1 of the bottles of sake and asked if we could return it. They were ok with it.

Three stars it is, because the food is always fresh and tasty. I love the location and food, but the service needs major facelift. I've been here about 5 times in the last 3 months and the last experience was the one that made up my mind to stop coming to this specific location. 

In our seating area we were the first table to arrive and then a few other people arrived about 5 minutes later. We were immediately ready to order, but instead our waiter took their order instead...  [worst] thing a waiter could do.. in my book.

He came to our table 10 minutes later the came back with sushi that was completely drenched in sauce to the point where I could't eat it and the dish they served it on was so darn small  my food was spilling all over the place, so I asked for larger dish... weird... 

The place wasn't packed and it took another 15 minutes to get a check and get out. Ugh... Despite the repeated poor service at this specific joint, I still recommend Kaizen, but at a different location.
Delicious sashimi as always! There good here is always amazing and they have three best Miso soup. The staff is always great and it's spotless all the time.

my husband and i are complete sushi lovers.  it's not too often we absolutely love a sushi place, but Kaizen Fusion is great!  the environment is trendy with top 40 music videos playing on a large plazma tv.  the rolls are fresh and perfect for one-size bites.  our favorite was the "sexy roll" for spicy tuna lovers. price is reasonable (just a few that are $$), and the service is also friendly.  

afterwards we walk down the street to Hard Rock for some gambling and drinks to end the night.
The atmosphere was very nice. I liked the vibe of the place. The sushi was fresh and our waitress very kind. I would recommend it. Will be back when I'm in Vegas next time.

My Cali sushi style home away from home when in Nevada.  Was introduced to Kaizen by a local back in 2012 and now hit this off-yet-close-to-Strip spot most times I'm in Vegas (5-12 times/year).

They have a relaxed, nice vibe with friendly, efficient service and a great spread of rolls and solid quality fish.  

A great spot to sink some cold beer/sake and fill your belly with friends after a massive few days on the town ;)
I came to Las Vegas during the SEMA convention, and I been coming here to eat every day! The food is amazing! The atmosphere is very nice as well! I highly recommend coming here to eat!  yummyy
This place was amazing!  We were happy to get off the strip for a night and find a good meal at a decent price.  It was small but perfect !  Highly recommend
Food was great.  Roll was refreshing and had nice cut pieces of tuna on top.  Ordered mango lobster roll.  Would order again here
Closes at 4am but if you want to be served get there before 3am or they send you away. Really a bummer this place really used to be a great spot especially for industry and late nighters.

8/11/14 Came right when it opened so there was no wait and the host seated is immediately! I think we came to roll heaven!! There was a binder full of different rolls, it was amazing! 

The husband ordered the Rock & Roll, it has tuna, salmon, white fish, crab, radish, asparagus, radish sprouts and yamagobo, no rice and is wrapped in cucumber...I ordered the nabeyaki udon.

We liked the interior of the place all wooden tables with a long sushi bar and very nicely insulated, keeping us cool in the heat...We definitely plan to come back!

I frequent the Kaizen establishment closer to my house on Eastern Ave. I had friends in town and they were staying at the Cosmopolitan. I picked them up and took them out for lunch to Kaizen. I was surprised to order my usual items that I was used to but they were served differently. Not a bad thing, but it did catch me off guard. 
The service was ok, had a little issue with my wifes soda being frozen. They did bring a new one out. Overall, a good dining experience. Would recommend and return.

Sushi at 3:30am!  No, it's not a typo.  This place is actually open until 4am on a Monday night.  And it's the only place any of the bartenders, waitstaff, hosts, taxi drivers, and security guards at Wynn, TI, The Venetian, or Fashion Show mall knew about....  so I'll go ahead and declare this the latest-open sushi place I've ever been to on this continent.  (If you know of anything open later in Norcal, DC, or LV, message me.)

The taxi ride here from the strip was all of like $7.  Of course we spent more than that, because we first tried Tao for sushi, but it was closed.  Then Social House - closed.  Then Ra: cerrado.  Then Hamada: shut, barely.  Then here, after burning a few hundred walking calories and a yuppie food stamp on the taxi.  Once we got here, the staff was very friendly and welcoming.  And the place was actually about a quarter full - with the younger party-looking set.  No one raving drunk though.  The nigiri was a bit more expensive than that would've-been-$7 taxi ride per pair but not exorbitant for Vegas.  Not the cheapest or best I've had, but the salmon, yellowtail, and white tuna nigiri were all fresh enough and they did have some delicious, albeit very thinly sliced toro ($19/pair), again at 3am.  I mean if someone can satisfy my sushi craving at 3am on a Monday night making the fish taste good is gravy.  They also had some white tuna that is the "pure white" type we geigens love and large bottles of Kirin.  And we couldn't help but notice a group of 4 at the bar doing sake bombs dominoes style (which the undergrad in me says looked pretty cool I must admit).  

I doubt 3am sake bombs are even legal in Cali.  Along with most other things in this town.  Viva Las Vegas.

Had a quick lunch here before heading to the airport (leaving Vegas...so sad).

Thought that they had very inventive rolls, but was disappointed in the complete lack of a lunch special (was there at 1 pm) as well as the service. The waitress was pleasant and helpful, but was the only one working the entire lunch rush and couldn't handle everything. I sat at the bar and waited a good deal of time between each roll, and had empty water glasses the entire time.

I think the service is probably perfectly fine when there are more employees there, and the rolls were certainly tasty. Slightly overpriced in my opinion, but tasty. I'd say this place is worth a try if you're headed to the airport and want somewhere that isn't flooded with tourists.
Excellent service, great food, great ambiance (Olympics playing on multiple TVs....go Team USA!)

Amazing service. My water glass was always full and I drank about 4 glasses of water. The staff was very polite and courteous. It was slow nut multiple staff members made an effort to ensure my wife and I were taken care of. The food was great we the new Zealand mussels in dynamite sauce it was one of the best appetizers I've ever had at a Japanese restaurant. For the sushi we got the T.T Girls and Crazy Girl rolls they were great. All Kaizen was a great place to grab an early sushi dinner. Thanks Kaizen Staff

It was the afternoon after a crazy night and I was hungry and a bit hungover. I didn't want a fancy place. I didn't want a touristy place. We were staying at the Hard Rock so we dedided to check out the strip mall across the street. Kaizen Sushi was closed at that time, and even though I couldn't see what the inside looked like, the sushi craving kicked in.

We came back later on and I am so glad we did. I ordered a couple of rolls, one being The Hungry Roll.. oh my god! it was enormous.. I would have been good with just that!!

We went back another time with a pretty large group of friends and they were very accomodating. I tried some of the baked rolls, which were delicious and not so heavy as my beloved tempura rolls. Eveyone else's food looked good, and no one had any complaints. I had the Lychee martini which was very tasty. We also got the party started with shots with ty ku.. sooo yummy! I wish they had it in L.A.

Overall, I love how it is nice yet very casual. Also, they have such a big selection of rolls!!!!

My only complaint (which wasn't the restaurants fault) is that we had them call a cab for us and we waited for about an hour and they never showed up. We walked over to the Hard Rock and the taxi line was huge. It was hot and it was annoying..... not the restaurants fault, but something to keep in mind!

BEST SUSHI PLACE IN THE CITY. I've been here multiple times and the rolls meet all expectations. Freshness, Flavor, Presentation, Large Rolls, High End quality. Nice little setup too! The service is a little bit average but who cares! Drink and have some rolls :)

It is fresh, gorgeous, delicious food! Exceptionally friendly staff. Prices are a bonus. You get high quality food without paying Las Vegas Strip premium prices. On paradise across from the Hard Rock. 

Order the Avocado Train! Yummmmmmm!
The Sushi is amazing. The service and atmosphere is top notch. I would highly recommend this place.
Visiting Las Vegas from Canada and I really enjoyed the sushi that they had and their wonderful staff and service. Would definitely recommend.
Some of the best I have had, fresh and the staff is great! If you like sushi you need to try this palce.

The fiancé and I were staying at a near by hotel so we decided to give this place a try.  We were really surprised at how fast our rolls were served. Aside from the fast service this was probably the worse sushi I ever had in Vegas. The rice in the rolls was a bit on the hard sticky side, and every time we picked a roll it immediately felled apart. The rolls were on the smaller side and did not justified the value of the higher prices. The fish didn't tasted very fresh, in fact there was a fishy after taste to it. 

I came to the conclusion that the sushi we had was pre-made and had been sitting in a fridge for a while. My suspicion came from the very fast serving after ordering it, literally 3-4 minutes had gone by and we got our first and second roll. Our third roll came in at around the 7 minute mark. The third sushi roll was hot and it tasted like it had been microwaved, probably why the wait time was longer. My fiancé and I had the Philadelphia roll, crunchy roll...nothing crunchy about this, and lasagna roll. I was greatly dissatisfied with the sushi and have no plans of ever coming back here again.
Came here late starving. Sat down and ordered. Food came unbelievably fast with great quality. Definitely exceeded my expectation! Recommended!

We came here when another restaurant had an hour and half wait. We were unable to sit at a table either since all empty tables were reserved and tables were taken. This is a busy night on a Sunday. I was starving and just wanted to eat. We sat at the sushi bar.

The servers were nice and courteous. They were patient while we reviewed the menu. I had my mind set on KBBQ so I was trying to figure out what I wanted. I went with sharing the spicy tuna roll and ordered the nabeyaki udon. This was surprisingly delicious! The server cracked the egg in the udon and I asked for their spicy sauce. Their sauce was so good! The spicy sauce definitely packs a kick and they warned us to start out with a little since it's hot. I loved it! Delicious. The udon noodles were perfect and the broth was good. I don't usually eat udon at restaurants since I like to eat this at home so this was a great surprise. Thank you for making my night!

The atmosphere and music is great the servers are pretty knowledgeable about the menus and sushi in general, the sushi taste fresh and is a good size. Another little side note the sell some of the art pieces that are up for display at the restaurant. The happy hour is a pretty decent length only down side is there's no all you can eat but as long as you know what you want there should be no problem, my favorite roll is the Philadelphia roll :D
The best sushi spot In Vegas. I always come here when visiting. Try the salmon killer it's the best. I can't believe how the fish is so fresh.
It was ok :/ and kinda felt rushed when ordering. Over priced to and no all you can eat

3.5

we were craving raw oysters.. again. gosh, what is it about Vegas that makes me crave oysters all the time!?

we stopped in for a light meal. we got a plate of sashimi ($20), a roll, and of course, oysters (5pc for $12). 

the roll was just okay.. not to mention the spicy mayo was sweet (ew?) .. however! that plate of sashimi must have been one of the freshest and tastiest sashimi i've had. this was also my second time having yellowtail sashimi in vegas and i must say, Vegas gets shipped some darn good yellowtail. seeee ya tuna

our oysters were pretty good too but i like mine naked, how most oyster bars do them. Kaizen puts a little green onion, the orange eggs, and a ponzu sauce. still yummy and satisfying!

i'd definitely come back here again but only if im in the area for undftd/stussy or staying at the hard rock hotel.  also, come at night.. i think theyre popular for their sake specials during that time!
Very fresh sushi. I had the Mexican roll and ate every bit of it. Fast service and a must to visit!

Food is always good service is excellent love the quaint and family atmosphere the Miso soup is excellent the curry the chicken bone and especially the sushi is always good my favorite is the Monster Sushi
This place is awful. One roll cost almost $17 and was the same quality sushi you would get at Von's. You can get better sushi at a convenience store. Avoid this place.

Real good, but not exceptional. Priced slightly higher than average. Easy to spend $100 and not be satisfied (i.e full). Lot of rolls have spicy tuna so make sure you like spicy tuna! Cool modern design with decent service. 

Like to go at least yearly and would return.

fun and festive sushi spot off the strip. for those staying at the hard rock, this is a must. be careful crossing the street! it is a nice alternative 

sushi rolls are fresh and are made with some flair as well. the portions are fairly large (8 pieces) and make up for the slightly expensive menu.

watching the chefs prepare the sushi is fun too. the staff is very welcoming.

great for groups, or a casual hungover Sunday brunch.

I only gave this a star because the food was good. 
Let's talk about the service...good lord they were so gosh darn RUDE I am baffled. I came in with a couple of friends and it's 12am on a Friday night, I would get if it was super packed, but it wasn't. So we had to share a menu, 3 waiters were "waiting our table" the reason for the quotations because they were doing anything but tending to us. Not like we asked for much. Just some more water since we had to wait so long to order, get our food just everything in general. Then we look over and see one of our "waiters" taking sake shots with his friends instead of taking care of other customers. Also don't asked for anything else after they bring you your food unless you wanna get hit with a nasty attitude like it's an inconvenience. Terrible service, whoever did the hiring needs to be let go cause they aren't a good judge of character.

A funning thing about the name of this restaurant "Kaizen", according to my Japanese colleague, means continuous improvement of something and is the motto for Toyota motors.  

They said nobody in Japan would name the restaurant "kaizen". I guess it's because it implies that the dishes are not at their best if you are constantly trying to improve. 

Anyhow, this place is somewhat of a novelty for the Japanese because they usually do not see nor tasted American-style sushi rolls. We ordered the tuna poke, 16pcs sushi combo, 20pcs sashimi, calamari tempura roll and a spicy rainbow roll.

Nothing is really out of the ordinary. The poke tasted a bit odd but the sashimi and spicy rainbow roll were decent. A bit on the pricey side.

There's an overhead projection of random music and videos playing. A large bar on the side. The location was easy to find with plenty of parking.

I am in love with this place! From the ambiance to the food; I have no complaints. I have been going here for about 3 years now & have had my birthday here twice. I work as a hostess at a restaurant on the strip and get off pretty late at night, so it is very convenient that it is open til 3 or 4 am. The staff are all friendly and accommodating; I usually dine at the sushi bar and always have a great time with the sushi chefs. The decor is modern and fun, which is a nice change from your typical sushi restaurant. The pricing of the items are reasonable and not too expensive which is nice. Everyone should definitely try the baked New Zealand mussels; I get them every time.

I've eaten quite a lot of sushi all around the country, but this was NOT good sushi.  It wasn't awful.  But it was about as good as the sushi you might get pre-made from a grocery store.  "Mediocre" is the best I could possibly rate it.   

The decor in the restaurant was beautiful; a lot nicer than I would have expected for a strip mall restaurant.  And the service was fine.  But the menus were that cheap laminated stuff you find in low-end Chinese restaurants, with poorly lit photos of the rolls.  And the descriptions were all so formulaic:  Inside - tuna avocado, on top - shrimp, sauce - ponzu.   They all read like that so that none of them stood out to you.  They all sounded pretty much the same.

But most importantly, of the 4 rolls we ordered, none were outstanding.  They were all just blah with a slightly fishy taste to the sushi.

I would NOT go here again and I would certainly not recommend it to anyone. We should have spent the extra $$ and gone across the street to Nobu (in the Hard Rock) for some seriously amazing sushi.
Food and service were excellent! We were seated and served promptly. The kiss of fire roll is a great choice. Will definitely go back next time I'm in town
Awesome quality on all sushi. All fresh. The food was amazing.....but a bit over priced and bad service. I will come back just because of the hours, open late and great food.
Amazing! Such a wide and delicious variety. Love it Have to come here every time I'm in Vegas. Would recommend to everyone.
Happy to return.  This time sashimi. How do they get such fresh fish in the desert and I live by the beach local restaurants do not compare?
Great off strip restaurant... Decent prices with good saki selection... Sushi was good
The sushi here was great! Fun service and catering to any need. If you want a great time have V as your sushi chef and you're guaranteed a good meal!

One of my favorite sushi places, for sure! Hands down, best Japanese lasagna roll I've ever eaten. I had it for the first time there and honestly, no where else compares. I took my friend there for the first time recently and she loved it. Not having had sushi much, I told her to look at the menu, read all the descriptions and pick something with the type(s) of fish she likes. She did and ordered the Alaska roll which she said was really good. They have a great menu and I love how it's decorated. My only complaint is that sometimes the service is a tad slow, but they really do try their best, and that is ok with me. A lady next to me this last time was completely rude to the server but he didn't get upset and was able to pretty much turn it around, which was awesome. I don't mind paying their prices for what I get.. I've never been disappointed!
This is best place in town if you want to eat like a local across the street from hard rock olive everything about this place and prices don't bite

Food is alright, nothing special tho. The restaurant itself is beautiful and servers are very polite.
They're always checking on you.
They have a nice menu, nice sake selection. They're not expensive or crowded. It could be a very good restaurant.

Here's why I'm giving this place one star, hygiene. 
As soon as we sat down I noticed a piece of hair on the small soy sauce dish, not cool! But I decided to ignore it since my husband gave me his, as I was the only one who was going to eat.
A few minutes after we started eating I asked for paper napkins and as the server was bringing them to me one fell down on the floor. Surprisingly she picked it up and put it together with the other napkin she was bringing me... After giving me the clean and dirty napkin she took the dirty one with her saying it was dirty, and I honestly believe that if she knew we hadn't seen it she would have given me the dirty and the clean one. 
That was the end for me, I could barely finish my meal as I was disgusted.

It's a nice restaurant with good food but they could use hygiene.

I wish I could say that I was drunk and stumbled upon this sushi joint... but instead, I came here to grab a take-out lunch while I was staying at the Hyatt Hotel supervising a group of tourists to a trip to Vegas.  It would have made it much more entertaining if I did.

In any case, Kaizen Sushi is not a bad place to get your sushi fixing in Vegas.  They specialize in fusion rolls, so right off the bat, you know that you should focus more so on them instead of simply nigiri or sashimi.  The atmosphere inside reminded me of a very fancy bar, both very dark and roomy.  They have a pretty sweet deal for those night owls (or those trying to be) where much of their food becomes half off.  Considering that this place is open late, this place is definitely for those post-clubbing events.

For my mini lunch, I ordered the Calamari Tempura Roll, which came out to be about $8.  I love eating fried squid, and was interested in seeing their take on combining it into a sick sushi roll.  What I really loved about this roll was that even though it came in only five pieces, they gave me the extra calamari on the side.  It also came with a sweet dipping sauce.

My roll was okay.  Nothing to rave about to be honest, but it was a good way for me to get my sushi fixing for the day.  Everything else on the menu seems to be way overpriced, especially in Vegas when there are so many other eating bargains out there.

Definitely worth a try, but go ahead and gamble at Hard Rock and make some moolah first before you come here.  Then you can fest like a KING/QUEEN!

Parking is available outside in the plaza.

Whenever I go to Las Vegas and need a sushi fix. I only go to Kaizen Sushi. I have been to every sushi restaurant in Las Vegas and Kaizen tasted the best. The store is always clean and the food is super fresh. I would recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family.
Our favorite sushi place! Spent 5 years in Japan - this is as close as it gets!! Fast service amazing fresh food!

In essence...

No AYCE. Overpriced because it is so close to the Strip. $60+ with tip for 2 people.

My husband and I managed to land here for sushi on a Friday night. We did this because the line for Yama Sushi (which is my fave sushi spot in town) had a line waaaay out the door and to be honest I just did not want to wait that long. So. Enter Kaizen, which had good Yelp reviews, but alas, was somewhat of a disappointment. 

First with the good, the place LOOKS fabulous. Dark exterior, plays with lovely lighting and the tables are large with good spacing. Dinnerware and presentation is superb, but it better be since this place is so close to the Strip. Customer service is so-so. Although the entire staff yells as people enters/leaves, our service with food to our table was only okay. I ordered a hot green tea and it was brought out in a large cup, which I dislike because I enjoy my tea HOT. As it sits uncovered it cools down quickly and not once did a server ask to refill it. I prefer smaller cups and pots of tea for this reason.

Ordered:

- Edamame 
- California Roll
- Tuna Roll 
- Shrimp Roll
- Spicy Rainbow Roll
- Spicy Tuna Hand Roll

Pluses - size of rolls at least (kind of) make you not feel so bad about how much you are paying and that you cannot get AYCE here. PLUS, again, presentation is great and sushi is very good quality. The only qualm I had was with the Tuna Roll being a bit on the warmer side when it arrived at our table than I would have liked.

My husband is a super picky sushi eater (hence the very plain rolls we had). The place does have some interesting rolls, the spicy rainbow roll was decent, and large, I'm glad I ordered it as it did fill me up.

BEST - Edamame, just stinking amazing for some reason. Served steaming, with a good amount of salt, and a LARGE portion.

Not the best... again, price wise you can find just as good sushi elsewhere and Vegas, except you don't have to pay for the atmosphere and Jay-Z music videos in the background.... HOLY GRAIL!!!

We walked in and for a second, i thought I was in a Italian restaurant. Everything was so fancy and the host looked Italian. Then i saw the nicely formed, eye appealing varieties of sushi on the white plates.  As i looked through the menu, it was so hard to choose which roll to get. I wanted to try them all but my bank account wouldn't let me. The waiter was patient and made some recommendations. As soon as it came to the table we devoured them up, thus no picture was taken.  The rice on each roll was fluffy and not overly sticky, the fish was cold, firm and tasty, the rolls that had tempura waa freshly made, evident from the crunch and warmth of the tempura as you bit into the whole roll. My favorite had to be the roll with fresh tuna and roe. The roe just pops as you bite into it. In all we ordered 5 different rolls and spent over 80 with tip. I don't usually spend this amount for so little food and if I do it has to be spectacular. This place hit it out of the ballfield.

Came here for dinner on a weekday around 8 and the place was nearly empty. Had very prompt service and food came quick. Food was very flavorful and food. Drink choice for other than saki was lacking but overall very good experience

My wife raved about this place so when I just recently visited, we stopped by.  Not sure why there are any complaints about the service as I thought it was fantastic.  I'm guessing they have been working on their service and improving upon it.  We walked in and  were immediately greeted by a cheerful hostess/waitress (one that actually smiles).  Rolls were awesome, their eel sauce was amazing.  They had an appetizer I had never tried before, they were peppers that were sauteed- very delish!!  
I'd definitely come back foh sho!!!!
This place is so amazing, the staff was super friendly, very clean and inviting. The feel of the place from when I walked in was exactly what I expected, perfect.
Ambiance was ok....food was delicious.  My husband had the Teriyaki Beef bowl and it was bomb! I had the Sexy Magura roll and it was pretty good but nothing to write home about
Love this place!! Food is always fresh and the service it great. They are open late, so we end up here all the time.

We are visiting Las Vegas for the second time and we are looking for a cheaper sushi place! I love sushi and had it in multiple places before, but this one is great !!!!Awesome food and pretty atmosphere! Not busy and great service! The prices are good also, average i would say, but perfect for the quality!!

Good place for sushi i go here for lunch with friends they have good lunch specials and i also can go here at night there open late and its a nice place. Also the fish is always fresh which keeps me coming back.

This restaurant is a trendy and current restaurant.  I liked the artwork, the decorations, and the environment is inviting. Great food options and the service was quick, pleasant, and everyone was hospitable.   Great place to meet with friends, or have a quick lunch if you are in the area.
Freaking love this place! Come here every time we are in Vegas. Went in with a party of 18.. Awesome service and extremely timely. See you guys in a few months!
Good food, service, and atmosphere. The only thing I didn't like was how loud the music was. The sushi and service more than made up for it though.

Always come here. The guys that make the sushi are the best at it. Always have great customer service here. My favorite dish is the salmon skin cut rolls and spicy garlic edamame. My go to drink is the lychee martini! P.s. they're open till like 5am...dont ask me how I know lol
This place is bomb.com!!! Get the avocado train has got to be the staple! Servers are great sushi awesome bring family friends.

No doubt the best in Vegas. Top notch quality in terms of food, taste, presentation, service, environment, EVERYTHING! As a recent transplant to Vegas, this is absolutely my go-to place for sushi, a la carte or AYCE!

Excellent sushi!!

This place is located across from the Hard Rock in the CVS Plaza. It is a cool place with a nice atmosphere as far as sushi places go.

It is not an AYCE place and it will cost you quite a bit of cash if you eat like you are at an AYCE place, but the sushi is excellent and the staff is very friendly. I use to get sushi to-go from here all the time when I worked in the area.

Highly recommend!
Great sushi and great service! Super polite staff and they were really quick to make the sushi!

First time coming here.
Service was friendly.
The rolls were so good!
A little on the pricey side but well worth it!

We ordered the avocado train which was my favorite.
It is avocado lobster soft shell crab and crab. 
I had my usual spicy tuna roll. 
And we had a rainbow roll.
We then asked for another roll that they recommend.
He made us the orange blossom I believe it was called. 
It was great too!

The Japanese word "Kaizen" brings back memories of my B-school days, when studying operations management in the car industry.  Kaizen means "continuous improvement" - why would any restaurant want to name themselves this?  Maybe Kaizen Sushi is aware of its shortcomings and wants to strive to be the best.  HMMM...

Food & Drinks
I came here with a couple of girlfriends for lunch and we immediately ordered lychee sake.  Points for having this on the menu!  It might be the Boone's Farm of sake, but can't deny that it was goooood!  We didn't want anything too heavy to eat because we had early dinner reservations, so one of my girlfriends had sashimi, the other had a bento box of short ribs, while I had the ahi salad.  As you can see, the unifying thread was NO RICE  (we were going clubbing that night - we didn't want to look TOO bloated!)  Amazingly, these dishes were satisfying - the portions were pretty generous.  Because we ordered from the lunch menu, everything was reasonably priced.   No complaints here!

Atmosphere
Kaizen is located in a little strip mall, so we weren't expecting the place to look anything less than your run-of-the mill sushi joint.  However, Kaizen had some pizzazz - the walls were colorful and rock music was playing.  We felt like we had walked into a bar.  For what it is, Kaizen scores points for atmosphere too - no complaints here either!

Service
This is where Kaizen should practice some Kaizen.  Orders came to the table slowly and randomly.  The bento box came first, which had my friend & I drooling.  My order came last, and by this time I was ravenous!  They should have served our food all at once! 

So I'd give Kaizen 3.5 stars if I could, but I'll round up because their name suggests they are striving for perfection.  As far as the service goes, I should hope so!
All the rolls were fab! Best sushi I have had in years. If you are the area you gotta go!
TUNA POKE WAS AMAZING. Sushi was fresh and sashimi pieces were nice and thick. Everything was on point  even for being open til 4am

I have sushi several times this week in Vegas and this is far and away the best that I have had. Tastes amazing (ask for the fresh wasabi!) doesn't break the bank and is super fast. I was incredibly impressed. I will happily drive from LA to eat here.  So good!

Wasn't so impressed by this spot. The location is conveniently close to the strip, but the sushi wasn't anything great. Given that many of the Vegas sushi spots are AYCE, I expected the non-AYCE sushi restaurants to have higher quality fish. 
They have an extensive menu of Japanese fusion dishes. Seems like the popular thing to get here are their specialty rolls. My rolls were poorly put together, but I was okay with it, given that it was late at night and I was craving sushi.

You would think that when guests request two AYCE menus at the BEGINNING of the meal, the server would correct them. Clearly not the case in this half-assed sister location to Kaizen on Flamingo and Arville (who DOES do AYCE); paid for four to eat for two.
Outrageous pricing for mediocre food and minimal customer service. Get it together.

Went with some local friends while visiting Vegas. Did not look like much from the outside, but the interior is well done. Simple with an open feel. There is open seating in the middle of the room to utilize its space and to keep it from feeling crowded. Both the food and service were good. As noted by others it is open til 4 AM on most days which is a plus in Vegas. I was told by my friend that they have a DJ's performing during the late night. 

Will likely return when in Vegas next.

This restaurant is amazing!  We had grilled octopus, paradise roll and red dragon.  If truth be told 4 of us got 3 paradise rolls because it was so amazing!  I definitely recommend this place when in Las Vegas.

This is my favorite sushi place in Vegas... I have to say the customer service is amazing.. staff is always welcoming and polite.. we frequent here so almost everyone knows us and our orders. That's the best feeling ever...

Amazing service and delicious sushis. We had intended to go to a Korean BBQ restaurant in the same plaza but the wait was over one hour, so we walked a few steps to find this place. The restaurant had a nice ambiance with the white Christmas lights and the fringe curtains that separates the restaurant to different sections to create a cozy atmosphere. Servers are super attentive and you don't even have to flag them down to get a refill. We did family style and we shared our sushi rolls. They are very large and beautiful presented. The avocado train was picture perfect and tasted delicious with a big ball of crab wrapped with avocado! It was so beautiful! Their Ninja roll was a perfect combination of just a little spicy kick without being too spicy. Rainbow roll was just average. I would recommend that you order their specialty sushis and not your typical sushi rolls. You will be blown away!
Very pleasant atmosphere and delicious sushi rolls. We had the TT Girls and the Orange Blossom.  Heavenly! Highly Recommend!

The sushi is great and the chefs know how to make any roll you can think of classic or otherwise. Service is good hot food is good, and best of all it's NOT gougey Vegas pricing. If your stuck at the hard rock for some convention or something walk across the street and have a nice Japanese meal with some cold unfiltered sake and forget about all the money you lost at the tables.

I eat here often
For the past 9 years actually
The sushi lasagna is incredible and a must!
Soy paper!!!

I love sushi! 
I can literally live on sushi!
Kaizen Sushi so conveniently located, I come here every week.
It's a small restaurant. Everyone knows everyone!
It's like family! 
The waiters and waitresses are always happy.
They are always welcome us with a smiley face.
Our servers always know what we drink, but for curtesy, they always checking on our orders, asking if we like something else. Mostly we drink iced tea.
They serve passion fruit tea, always very fresh.
We tried the Sake (Lychee flavor) first time. It's great flavor, kind of sweet, but good, if you like sweet drinks.

My favorite items are: Sexy Rolls; Nevada Rolls; Crunchy Scallops Rolls.
I don't always eat raw fish, so I am happy to order the above mentioned. Those rolls are a very fine balance with great flavor.

Besides the rolls, I really like the Seafood Curry Udon. Personally, I don't eat very spicy food. So, I asked them to make sure the curry is very low, and a sauce is very light on my udon. They prepare it perfectly for me.
BF likes the Chicken or Beef Curry Udon.
Both of the meals are in great balance of either the seafood or meat and vegetables over the Udon (noodles) and the curry sauce.

For dessert, I really liked their deep fried green tea ice cream. It's a huge portion, so it can be easily shared. 

Love their recently remodeled dining room!
The white chairs are making the restaurant look much nicer than before.
The atmosphere is great. Music sometimes louder than I like, but high energy, so it doesn't bother me!

I noticed some art/paintings are displayed on the walls, and they are for sale. So if you like them, you can purchase it!
This is the best bang for your buck on Vegas if you want sushi. Amazing.

Wow what an AMAZING sushi spot!! Came here on our way into town and were fully satisfied with the sashimi Eddie the sushi chef prepped. The ahi, salmon and yellow tail tasted like they fresh out of the Hawaiian Waters's. Bonus the lunch was only $12.95 for 9 pieces!!!!

My husband and I went here for his birthday dinner since we were in town. The menu is impressive. So much to choose from! Taking a shot of the menu won't do justice. We ordered the Orange Blossom, Spicy Tataki roll, & Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice. All were so tasty! The Orange tasty was the one we favored most and it was recommended.

Wonderful place for lunch!  They have these lunch specials and all are big portions for a good price.  The sashimi combo was very fresh and the tempura was good too!
I have been there several times and my boss goes there almost every day.  The only waitress i have seen can work the whole lunch by herself and does a great job.
I am sure we will be back again!
I love this place!  We eat here every time we are in Vegas.  Reasonable priced, great selection, excellent rolls, and super friendly staff.  Have never been disappointed.  We will be back soon!

This is my happy place. Whenever I'm in Las Vegas, this is the very first place and very last place I go to as I'm coming and going - luggage and all. The atmosphere is great, the food is superb, the people are amazing. I can't think of a negative thing to say about Kaizen. Well, maybe that it's not in California???

It's not a touristy spot so it's not crowded. I've seriously been here at all times of the day and I've never had to wait to be seated. There is plenty of parking. I'm telling you, this place is so unassuming that I'm tempted to keep it my little secret. This place is so awesome though, that it deserves all the success and accolades.

The sushi at this place is some of the best I've ever had. The Shogun Roll is amazing. We ordered the bento box for our kids. They loved it. And had to order extra egg rolls because they are sooo good. We will come back for sure. The rolls are on the pricier end, $12-$15 per roll. Worth it in my opinion.

A little pricier than my guy and I like, but we splurge here every once in a while. Or we'll get our taste in sushi and then fill up on capriottis next door. Definitely recommend the banana tempura roll. Its the reason we go here. Its way super weird but way super delicious, trust me. Always had good service here. They're polite about the fact that we order 6 miso soups.
Our fav go to sushi spot! Extremely fast service and the food is DEEEEEELICIOUS! Guaranteed to leave with a smile and full belly :)
This is one of my go to Sushi place when I'm in Vegas. One of the most fancy but affordable spot to get your craving for sushi satisfied.

I love going here after work with my girls. Their sushi rolls are really delicious. My fave roll is the Avocado Train. Service is usually really good, but EXCELLENT when we get our fave server Jun. Yummmmm!!!
Great service. Very good food. Nice ambiance. We for Nevada roll, Dragon roll and Rainbow roll plus Kaizen ceviche. Super fresh fish all around.

Found this restaurant when we were staying at the Hard Rock Hotel (another story) and needed a place to have dinner. It was within walking distance & after checking it out on Yelp and seeing some good reviews, we gave it a try. Very good sushi & the manager and wait staff were very nice & attentive. We both had sushi & edamame and I also had miso soup.  We were both full when we left & the bill was about $40, including my ice tea and my husband's beer. We would eat here again if we were in the area, but since we would never stay at Hard Rock Hotel again, that most likely won't happen. If you like sushi and are stuck at HRH, this place should be on your list.
