The best sushi in town all fresh and amazing prices 
And also open 24 hours  . Everything on the menu tastes good, great services everyone is very friendly . We come here often especially late night because it's open late. Their happy hour specials are great !
Very nice sushi experience with reasonable prices for Vegas. Cute atmosphere for a casual date. Off the beaten trail but well worth it.
Fish was very very good. Tasted fresh, nice presentation, and good prices. Absolutely would come again.
If you come and eat there on an empty stomach, you'll definitely get your money's worth! If I lived in Vegas, this would be my go to spot!

I have been to this Kaizen (across from Hard Rock) 3 times and the one in Henderson once, and each time has been consistently wonderful!  My 3 favorite items are the spicy tuna rice crisp (2nd only to Katsu-ya in Studio City, LA, where I think this sushi originated), Korean BBQ Roll and Seared Wahoo Sushi (very rare to see this Hawaiian fish sushi anywhere).  The various  soju/sake martinis are great, the atmosphere is hip and relaxing, and this place opens until 4:00 am, 'nuff said!

The sushi looks pretty, but it was tasteless to me.
Was missing something on the flavor area, soon can't give a great review when taste wasn't there.

We came out for dinner after a long day at work. There are so many choices in the area, and we finally agreed to stop here. We made a GREAT choice. I do not eat sushi, but ordered the chicken yakisoba. It was worth the extra to have white meat. 

Very good meal.

I am not a sushi eater but I had some of the a la carte items like the chicken veggie teppan and it was so good ! 

Definitely great prices, and from what I can tell the all you can eat sushi is a great deal. 

I recommend the cucumber salad and chicken & veggie teppan.

We ate here when in Vegas for Defcon last year and I LOVED this place! The food was really fresh and the wait staff was really nice and catered to our vegetarian needs.   This experience before I began eating fish again so that was really important to me.  I loved the cucumber Salad (Sunomono) and the way it was served in a martini glass, vegetable rolls, cucumber rolls, avocado rolls, we delicious and plated beautifully as well.  I would definitely come here again especially to hit up the happy hour specials & free sake bombs when you spend $15 :) Yuuuuuummmmy!
This place was amazing :) would definitely come back again when I visit Vegas. Good ppl and fast :)

Within walking distance of my hotel, this place was a great find!

What I had:

Jalapeno popper roll: This was good but the cream cheese they used had no flavor. The outside was fried lightly and had a great crunch to it, even ordering it for take-out.

Las Vegas Roll: I loved this one. Would highly recommend it! 

Ordering take-out was super easy. The staff is friendly, and it came out pretty quickly. 

Will definitely be back!
Amazing and flavorful sushi, great happy hour (1+1 on alcohol, till they close). Very nice atmosphere, great service, it was the best food experience throughout this trip. Thank you so much!

Service was ok, but not the best. Ordered dinner for two from the sushi menu. We were looking for some soft shell crab. They delivered a breaded and deep fried something - was hard to even tell it had crab in it. One of the unagi pieces I ordered tasted a little funky, but one was ok. I read many reviews before opting to come here. I can't imagine even going to an AYCE sushi restaurant. To those who complain about price, we paid $60 for a light dinner here, but would have much rather paid the $200 elsewhere and gotten ten times better food and service. Couldn't go there though, because it was Wednesday. :(
Excellent sushi. Great for a little stop for a craving or an entire meal.
I love this place. My favorite is the spicy tuna salad. It's like a spicy tuna roll in salad form, minus the rise. I also recommend the grilled peppers and their fancy rolls.

Phenomenal!!!


Took my girlfriends here for a birthday celebration and they can't stop thanking me!!! The presentation of these dishes are perfection!!!
Been here since it first opened..  Still good to this day.  Love the music video playing..  Also enjoyed the strawberry nigori

Love Kaizen. Come here quite often after hours. Good rolls and prompt service. The staff could be more friendly but I'll deal with it for good food at 4am. They should have a children's menu too, kids are not going to eat a whole bowl to themselves.

We have eaten multiple times at Kaizen and they never disappoint, fish is fresh and the staff is friendly and prompt! Being from LA we are blessed with great sushi and don't eat sushi in the casinos so it was great to find Kaizen a few years back on one of our trips to Vegas!
Excellent.  We were looking for a sushi restaurant that wouldn't be overpriced and easy to get into.  Kaizen fit the bill and was great. More selections that you can fathom.

Fresh fish good service nice buzzy ambience at a fraction of the strip prices. 
Amazingly broad selection of sushi rolls.
Two thumbs up!

My favorite sushi place that I intend to go here for my Birthday to have a drink and enjoy the wonderful rolls here. My waitress here last time was ultra attentive and nice. The prices are fair and food is just amazing like I mean really good. It had me dazing in class one time because I wanted to go here to fix my sushi craving.
Probably the best sushi I've had, reasonable prices for good sushi. Good sized rolls. We had five rolls, only one we really didn't car for. The raw scallop roll. Defiantly thumbs up!

In a city of overpriced oversized greasy meals I am always happy to find some sushi.
Great ahi poke, farmed salmon :( 
Decent variety of rolls. Kinda pricey but I should expect as much since its Vegas and I'm from Vancouver!

I must admit I was a little skeptical visiting a sushi restaurant a little off the beaten path on the strip. 

Boy was I wrong!

Excellent service and outstandingly prepared well tasting fresh sushi. Guess where I'm going again on my next visit to the City of Sin

Btw: avocado train is a must have!

Enjoy!

By far the worst sushi restaurant I've ever been too...

My friends and I love sushi so it wasn't a surprise that we came here considering it was right next to our hotel. We got seated really fast and we were kinda excited about the menu since there was a lot of variety. My boyfriend and I ordered 2 rolls since we usually get that amount of rolls at other sushi restaurants thinking it will fill us up. Once my friends and I got our sushi, we were pissed off because the sushi had like 4-6 rolls. We just looked at each other like are you freakin' serious? I had to order another sushi roll because it obviously did not fill me up. When we got our check, it was about $105 since it included gratuity already. My friends and I ended up putting $120 instead of $105 since none of us had change. So we're waiting..and...waiting for our change. The workers during that time were giving us dirty looks cause we were still there and probably wanted to clean our table. So it finally hit us, where the fuck is our change? We asked the lady if we can get our change back and she gave us a dirty look. That bitch thought that extra $15 of our "change" was her damn tip. Like really? The tip that was on the receipt was already $15. So this restaurant tried to get a $30 tip from my friends and I when there was only 6 of us. Really? $5 tip from each person when the food didn't even fill us up? Shake my head at those workers man.
Awesome food , excellent service & I like the ambience , it was our first time here & we really liked it .

Great spot. I been here many times and definitely recommend it.  Food is fresh and service is always excellent. 
They have a late night happy hour.

Seriously underwhelmed. I came here after seeing numerous good reviews for this place. Wow, all I can say is wow this place was terrible. For starters I think it's in bad taste when they add mandatory gratuity for service. I feel a tip should be based on the service provided, which was decent but not out of this world. The iced green tea tasted like fish water. Waitress tried to tell me they add some special leaves or whatever but fish is fish is fish and that tea tasted like fish!!! The short ribs were greasy and burnt. The other rolls were decent but nothing I would come back for. Matter of fact we were left so unsatisfied we're on our way to get tacos now after leaving this place!

this was like a Japanese haven in Vegas. It was late .. actually close to midnight... you'd think no one would want to feed us anymore. But Kaizen was still ready to feed us dinner! 
I had the steak(Japanese style ) of course and my hubby got the humongous rolls.. can't remember the names. but I took photos nonetheless. I was pretty hungry, so names don't linger in my head anymore at this point. got myself a miso soup to start. it was good.our server was awesome. he was extremely attentive. he suggested great appetizers, great dishes.. and he  constantly checked on us. the presentation and the dishes were exceptional. everything tasted great and fresh. for the price, it is also affordable. For Japanese, this is a place to visit. you should not miss this once in Vegas. The ambiance just needs a little updating.  it should match what they are serving I think. lol.

Food is delicious and fresh here. The servers and host are friendly and young. Very cool urban pace and great food. If you are on a low carb diet try the rock and roll roll it's wrapped in cucumber and pretty delicious!
This place is fantastic! Delicious food, great service, and a wonderful atmosphere. I highly recommend.

if your a fan of sushi, but cant stand all the hoopla that comes with the vegas casinos, all you can eat buffet, and ridiculous prices. Then this place is for you.  The first and most important thing is the sushi was delicious! We had sashimi, different rolls, seaweed salad, the works.  the atmosphere is is very easy going, their's no rush to get you out, the servers are very friendly and helpful, and best of all its open until 4am on most weekend nights.
Being from out of town and not being a fan of the vegas lime light. (I only go to vegas for work.)  this place is off the strip, across the street from the hard rock cafe/casino/hotel, in a corner shopping strip.  We asked our waitress (sarah) from Japonais inside the Mirage about a local place off the strip where locals go. She recommended this place.  HEY! Sarah great call thank you. 
i understand there's more than one location, lucky vegas residents.  i will be back to vegas (unfortunately), but now i have a place for sushi were the real people can go.
Great service and even better food! We had the T.T girls roll and the Nevada roll and they were delicious! Try this place if you are here!

I was craving sushi and staying down the street from this place, and was just plain not impressed.
To begin with they didnt have a great selection, so I ordered a baked salmon roll, that was TINY and so full of cream cheese that it completely over powered the taste of the salmon.
On top of that they are one of those places that charges you a fairly normal price for a soda, I want to say it was like $2.50 or something... But it's in a can, so no refills. 
Service was slow, they forgot my miso soup. 

Could have been better.

Nice lil' place.. great service!  I got the shrimp tempura roll, which came out with a side of tempura sweet potato.. I wasn't sure how I felt about that, as it wasn't on the menu like that.. but it was really tasty, so it ended up being a nice surprise!  The roll was okay, but not tight, so falling apart was an issue.  For my 2nd roll, I got the Crazy Girl and it was awesome!  Huge roll with great flavor!  I wasn't blown away, so I'mma check out some other sushi places before selecting my "go to" spot.
Delicious food. Tempura udon is to die for. I would highly reckoned this place. The monkey brain was also very good. They were nice and prolly didn't have to wait very long for anything.

Tried the garlic edamame, sunrise roll, salsa dancing roll, and spicy tataki roll. All the fish was fresh and were good portions. However, the base sauce that they put on the plate can be a little over powering to the point that's all you taste. It's not a bad taste, but it can make the flavor of each roll blend together. We got the Bomba for dessert and it was great! One can be split between two people. Overall a good experience and would come back.

Can't believe I've never reviewed Kaizen before. It's THE GO TO spot for sushi, especially for those in the service industry as it's open late/early. I've never been disappointed with anything here. My faves are Charlie roll, yellowtail sashimi, and Kai roll. Definite date night spot!
Just plain perfection. The sexy roll is to die for.  On our last trip to Vegas, we ate at Kaizen three times.  Skip Nobu across the street, and come here instead.

It's off the strip. Affordable. Actually pretty good. 

The number of roll selections here was really overwhelming, but people like their choices. I think it fits the clientele and location perfectly.

If you're right off the strip and don't want to wait for hours getting to some fancy location on the strip, I highly recommend this location to hold you over on a myriad of Japanese-American creations.

Particularly friendly location if you're in town and near the Convention Center as well!

Dope af must have the rolls.
They have a nice vibe and the location is easy to spot when you are craving for Asian food

Wow! In Vegas looking for late night sushi, Kaizen was close to where we were so we had to try it! The menu has so many amazing dishes it's hard to choose! We tried the orange blossom roll and it's so good! (And the Salmon deep fried shrimp) highly recommend coming here you won't regret! Friendly staff, parking, fair prices and nice atmosphere! Definitely try this place! We will return!

We are visiting from Oregon and had been here years ago with local & out of state friends. This was our 2nd visit and we love it just as much as the first time.  Everything we ordered was fresh & fabulous!  Great atmosphere and great service.
Walked across the street from HRH for a late lunch Feb 26th, and we're glad we did. Our favorite was the Spicy Rainbow Roll.  We enjoyed the hip music and videos that were on, too.
Excellent sushi, fabulous salad and soup.  Peaceful atmosphere.  Will definitely be back.

Me & my wifey have been here more than once. First time it was so good. Now this is the 3rd time and it was clearly not the same. Crab Lettuce wraps were not fresh they taste different from the first time. Service was okay could be that it was a little busy.. the cooks are always great.
First time at kaizen. Arriving at around 5am and there are still many people eating. Although it doesn't have an AYCE menu , price is decent and food quality is still great!

I got the sea bass and tried my friend's unagi rice bowl.

Both were absolutely amazing. The miso glaze on the chilean sea bass was perfection and the piece they gave me was huge! I am happy with my dish.

Go for the avocado train if you're a fan of avocados like I am. From the outside it looks every other strip mall in Vegas. Whether you go 2pm or 2am, it's a funky nite-club with cute decor and great music! 
They are clever with their roll combination.  I can be funny about eating raw fish but this place dishes up some of the freshest seafood. Not bad for being in the middle of the desert!

Came here for lunch one day and was happy with the food and service.  I had the chicken katsu bowl and an order of California rolls.  Both were good and was a decent portion.  My friends had the kalbi short ribs and the bake muscles.  Both were delicious!  

If you have a sushi craving while in Vegas come here and you wont have to pay the outrageous hotel prices!   Decor was really hip and modern.  They blast hip hop music and have a large projection screen playing music videos while you eat.

Recommend Garden Salad with Ginger Dressing. The dressing is so good. Another one is Fresh water eel chirashi.
However, the waiting time for services takes so long. Not enough waiter and waitress.

I ordered Unagi Chirashi. It's awesome. The portion is bigger than I expected. There are 8-9 slides of unagi with delicious sauce. Price is also reasonable. Recommended! Unfortunately, checking process is tooooooo slow as there is only 1 waiter (who knows everything) handling all table.
All we ordered ( karaage, gyoza, yellow tail, scallop dynamite, jalapeño poppers & ika yaki, are really tasting good. efl/bdb 6/30/17
I tried the tiramisu glass for dinner tonight but I didnt expect the ice cream consistency. When it comes to tiramisu, I preferred a warm sponge cake texture better.

Ate here twice while in Vegas- once Friday night around 11pm... Place was packed but still sat down right away. Second time was Sunday around 9- much quieter. Tried 9 different rolls and they were all superb! Pricing is typical for sushi anywhere between $9-$20 per roll. Eat. Here. Now.

This is one of the best sushi in vegas. You must try the Silver state roll a lot of flavors going on that roll, also the crazy girl roll deep its a deep fried roll. Fast service everything we ordered is good. Try this place out.
Delicious sushi! I got the combo and couldn't finish it, and I've never been unable to finish sushi.
Cool place. Friendly servers. Very neat presentation. Food was good. Would bring friends or family or a date is recommended.
Amazing sushi at great LV prices. Gotta get the Golden Knights roll and the Ninja roll. You can expect to pay $17-$20 / roll on the strip. Average roll here is about $14. Can't go wrong here.

I love this place. I live around the corner so I order from here frequently and everything is always perfect. Best sushi in Vegas! I call in my order and it only takes them about ten minutes to have it ready. The girls who work here are all very sweet. And the prices are amazing!

Honestly, this place was ok at best I think.  Service felt a bit slow (maybe someone called out) and their food was sub par.  Don't get their Karage...it's simply chicken fingers.  Not good at all.  Their rolls are solid enough though.  It's the side dishes that were pretty weak.  I can't remember exactly what rolls we got, but I do remember them being good.  The decor and ambiance is nice though. Although the rolls and decor were nice, it just wasn't enough for me to bump it up to a 4 star rating.
We came here because of the good reviews on yelp. They had good food and good hours. Nice for sushi rolls off the strip!

Very attentive service with great food.  Had the server suggest a few popular rolls and we were not disappointed.   Clam miso soup, orange blossom and TT rolls were excellent!  Will recommended when in Vegas.

Great fast service, awesome selection of speciality rolls. I'm a sushi fanatic and I have no complaints. My favorite was the sunshine roll and the rock and roll roll. Give them a try you won't be disappointed!

I love good sushi and sashimi. Fresh, the right temp, reasonable portions. I like to taste the fish, not have it hidden and smothered in sauces. 

Kaizen is a great place to go in Vegas. With so many choices in town, this place is a great place to enjoy quality sushi and sashimi. The food is spot on, and the prices are reasonable. The vibe is open and bright. They have the little things like fresh wasabi and know the difference between sushi rice and steamed rice.

The staff was helpful and friendly when I asked for recommendations and navigating the menu. 

I'm not a huge fan of rolls, but they do have a large selection if that's your jam. I had a rice less fish forward roll and it was delicious. 

This place is a solid 5 Star..if you like sushi check it out

My cousin's don't even live in LV but they have made 5 trips this year mostly because of this restaurant. The fish always tastes fresh and amazing. The service is quick and efficient, and the atmosphere is cute with friendly servers. 

Some great dishes:
-ika yaki: never had anything similar to this at another Japanese restaurant and I'm sort of kind of sad I can only have it here instead of back home (although it is another reason to come back to Vegas..) it's soooo fucking goood. 

- bbq roll: such a diff take on a roll!!! I've gotten it twice now and it's so good. 

- rainbow roll: again, the fish is just so fresh.


I will continue to try diff rolls and update review.

Great sushi.  Terrible service.
The restaurant is set up very nicely.  We were seated in an elevated area between two other tables.  We waited about 10 minutes before any employee came by.  We were ready for drinks and to order when a server came to a table next to us (only because a diner at the table hollered for her to stop by).  She almost walked away when one of our diners asked her to come to our table because we were ready to order.  She told us she wasn't our server and would have him come to our table.
A couple minutes later, he arrived.  He suffered through taking our order.  He was writing it down, but we still had to repeat ourselves a couple times.  I had our drink order memorized at that point and slowly said it to him again.  Then we ordered about 7 different items.  We were really worried about getting the right items.  
The food began to come to us, before we got our cocktails.  I chose to wait a couple minutes for my drink before I started eating.  We ordered quite a few items, but I only tried a couple.  The cucumber salad was fresh, crisp and delicious.  I thought the beef sashimi was delicious, but my friend thought it was bland.  I had the chicken teriyaki roll and substituted with soy paper.  I highly recommend it.  Inside the roll is piece of chicken teriyaki, crab, avocado, and cucumber and they are placed on teriyaki sauce.  It was delicious!  The best part was the serving of chicken teriyaki with broccoli, mushrooms, and onions next to the rolls.  
4 cocktails and 7 dishes came out to about 90 dollars; not bad.  The funny thing was, when we wanted our bill, the gal who said she wasn't our server was able to bring us our check when we asked her to have our server do so.  Next time we're in Vegas and want sushi, we'll probably go here, but sit at the bar for more prompt service.
On a funny side note... one of the nearby diners was Carrot Top.

One of my favorite sushi has been made here:The  calamari roll.

This was my go-to place whenever I had a lunch break. They have good lunch specials. I would always get a katsu bowl ($8.95, I believe for the price).  It is pretty good and my favorite bowl that they have.  I have tried the beef bento-box that they offer but it was not very good.

The service is great, the host is very personable and knows my by name since I used to go there on a daily basis.  

Great atmosphere and the sushi chefs are great people you can have a conversation with!

Nigiri Sushi, Rolls and Sashimi was OK.  I just disappointed in Shrimp Tempura.  That was not tempura, but fried Shrimp.  Shrimp was fried with banko, I had to ask Tonkatsu sauce.
Rools and plates were beautiful, but I think most of dishes are bit over priced for that quality of fish.

My new favorite sushi place!  I tried it for the first time this weekend and liked it so much I went back the next night.  They are open late, the sushi tastes wonderful, and the prices are fair.  I can't wait to visit Vegas again so that I can eat here.

i can't believe i'd forgotten to review this place!  i was there last month and was so pleased by my meal here that i couldn't wait to yelp it.  but then i got distracted.  :/  it wasn't until a friend asked for vegas food recommendations that i remembered.  

anyway, this place is SO good!  here are my top 5 reasons for saying that:  

1.  it is open late... as ALL things should be in vegas, and sadly are not.  
2.  it is very reasonably priced.
3.  the traditional sushi is great, but some of the more creative rolls are freakin' rad!
4.  the service is polite and attentive... even in the wee hours of the morning.
5.  it's not quite on the strip but not on the other side of the vegas world either.

my only sad is the it's not in LA.  certainly belongs on my must-eat-there list whenever i am in vegas now.

Unfortunately I forgot to take any pictures. I only eat the veggie rolls so I had avocado rolls and veggie rolls. I also add jalapeño to them. Not to exotic but very delicious none the less. I also had the delicious garden salad with ginger dressing and avocado. 
  Everyone else had  ninja roll, screaming O, nigiri unagi, monkey brains, t.t. Girls. By the looks of how they devoured everything in sight I trust their rolls must have been fabulous as well. 
  The service was friendly and fast. Drinks were filled as they emptied and they alway checked to see if we were ready to order more food.

I don't even know why we stopped here - we had just gotten done with a food filled day, ending at Dog Haus in the same plaza and I have such a weakness for sushi, I just had to check reviews. Once I saw the great reviews, I couldn't pass it up, no matter how full I was. So we stopped in to sit at the bar and just have a drink and two rolls, rather than my usual boat of sushi and sashimi. We got the Paradise and Ninja rolls and I liked the Ninja Roll, but I loved the Paradise Roll. It's rare that I order rolls, and when I do, I'm always disappointed in the lack of flavor and heat. I'm not a fan of reviewing a place after just getting drinks or just getting an app, but these were both so full of flavor that I just had to add a review.

Stopped thru for late nite craving and was pleasantly surprised. This place is quaint, chill, and the service was on point, very attentive. 
Sampled several of the rolls (had the "baked Lasagne" to finish the meal. I was thankful The fish was fresh and decent prices comparable any respectable establishment. I'd recommend if your on this side of town.. I believe they have ayce, but not sure, nice set up w televisions and bar special was half price beer.
This is my first time eating sushi. Absolutely wonderful experience. Great service and very prompt. The location is close to UNLV. Must try and I plan to come again! I recommend the KAI rolls

Palm Springs roll was very good. The sauce was nice and the rolls didn't just fall apart when picked up.
Tuna poke bowl was good too. Just wished portions were bigger

My wife and I were looking for some place quiet and peaceful off the strip and we found it here!! The food was outstanding!!! Along with the service and presentation!!! We had the "Charlie Roll" and the Lobster Mango Roll fresh and delicious!!! You should check this place out!!!!

Kaizen is a great sushi spot in Vegas that fits right into the lifestyle here as it is open until 4am on weekdays and 6am on weekends.  When I used to work on the strip Friday/Saturday and get off work at 4am we would always hit up this place routinely for some good food and a drink after work to wind down. 

They have a nice sushi bar inside and plenty of tables for small or large groups. The lighting is dimmed a bit and there is always music playing giving off a fun vibe. I've become friends with quite a few of the staff that work here.  Good people, good service. 

The food is really good and the rolls are good sized. They have some great rolls like Silver State, Orange Blossom, Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna, Avacado Train, Super White Tuna is really good too. Everyone I have ever taken to Kaizen from out of state while visiting us has really enjoyed it. 


There are a few Kaizen restaurants in Vegas but this one is by far my favorite. It is located right beside the Hard Rock Hotel 7 Casino.  When or if I start working on the strip at nightclubs again I will definitely be returning to Kaizen on the regular.
Sat at the bar.  A bit of a wait, but great food and friendly service.  Sake and sushi!
This place rocks! We were starving and in a hurry. Super fast service and delicious fresh fish! Very nice staff as well. We will be come back
We will always eat here when we come to Vegas (we come here every year). Unique rolls, traditional rolls, great service and no loud slot machines!
Sorry fans, this place wasnt all that. The ambiance is good, but the food was mediocre.  The rice felt like it was old, not fresh, and that threw off the rolls. Maybe next time Kaizen!

This is my go-to spot whenever I'm out on the strip and craving sushi.  It may not be the most authentic place, but the food is fresh and tasty, service is good, and the prices are extremely reasonable.  The atmosphere is casual and they always have good music playing.  The best part about this place is the fact that they're open really late.  I've been here multiple times and never been disappointed.  Whether it's 7 pm, 12 am, or 5 am, Kaizen is always a good choice.

2 for 1 happy hour from midnight to 4am Sunday to Thursday is great!  Prices are a little higher than I had hoped but they made up for it with the portions there.  Easily the best late night sushi place I've been to in Vegas and I plan on going back soon.  Its closer than "I Love Sushi" in Henderson which is my fav so I will just come here when I can't schlep it all the way over there.

I'm so glad I yelped this place when I was staying at the Hard Rock. I was getting extremely tired of eating american food (ie Cheese Fries and Chicken Strips) at Mr. Lucky's 24/7, me and my friend were totally craving for some rice. =) I was confused by the location on the google map because we exited from the back side of the Hard Rock rather than the front and couldn't see any street signs. After walking up and down Paradise Road we finally were able to find the location. It's really easy to find, just make sure you exit the Hard Rock from the front, walk over to the Hard Rock Cafe and walk across the street towards the CVS pharmacy. A few doors down is the Kaizen Fusion Roll and Sushi. =) 

I loved that they were really trendy, with trendy decor (70's looking partitioners that split the tables) and they were playing popular upbeat music that got me back into the mood to party again (I was feeling tired from Rehab, I wasn't feeling up to going to Body English later in the night). =)

We got seated right away, the service the waitresses were giving was very attentive, and we got our food right away. =)

The food was DELICIOUS!!! =)

We shared a tempura roll and edamame (they hook up the edamame!) and the chicken teryiaki bowl. But it wasn't your trypical teryiaki bowl... it tasted stir fried so it definitely added more flavor to the entree! =)

Plus the meal ended up being like $20! Super cheap! =)

Even if I wasn't staying at the Hard Rock Hotel I would still come by here again for Sushi... another bonus to this place is that they are open late! I believe on the weekends they are open until 4 or 5am!

A MUST visit if you're craving for more than just american fried food and don't want to make the drive out of the Hard Rock.

I am staying at the hard rock hotel and it's right across the street so it's a great alternative if you don't want to spend a crazy amount of money at the hotel on the same or sub par foods. I really enjoyed the food and the service was friendly and hospitable. The place itself is decorated nicely and has a good vibe with music and lights. I would definitely come again.

The food was delicious! The fish is very fresh and the service was excellent. The atmosphere was comfortable and we were seated pretty quickly, there were so many choices to choose from and they all tasted very good, the price isn't that bad either!
Good sushi spot in Vegas with some innovative rolls. The restaurant has a good vibe away from the strip
This is probably the best sushi that I have ever had. The baked tuna shoulder was amazing.
Great restaurant to get away from the hussle of Vegas.  Service is attentive and personable.

We ate here on Sunday night after a hard work day at JCK. I loved how I could pick anything I wanted from there enormous menu. I got the spicy tuna salad for which have tuna poke and seaweed salad along with an actual salad below and there amazing dressing. Worth it. Then I tried special roll which was great and it had shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, and yellowtail on top. Then I ordered just a basic spicy tuna roll and added cream cheese as  you can do that here. To top it off I have the mochi ice cream which is great! The only reason why this restaurant did not get 5 star is because the service was piss poor. Get more servers as a Sunday night, off the strip with great priced sushi is gonna be busy. Go here if you want some good sushi! :)

This place doesn't disappoint! Fantastic sushi and price is decent. The only reason I didn't give it 5 is the service is always abit slow and my appetizer usually comes out half way through my roll. Kinda defeats the purpose of an appetizer.
The first sushi restaurant I met in lv, have a wonderful experience. I order Palm Springs roll and hungry roll.great service. I will come back next time

It was just ok. Their rolls are creative for sure, but the few that we got just didn't have any special taste to them, they were bland. Nothing to write home about, you can go to many other places around town and get far better sushi for considerably cheaper and have the option of ayce too. The service was on par with the food. Just ok. At $14-17 per roll, I really expected more. I guess it's just a hard rock tourist trap.

Good food, reasonably priced. They were able to accommodate our larger party very quickly which was nice. Service could have been more attentive. Pretty good overall. 

The beef teriyaki bowl & fried chicken sushi roll was really good :)

Awesome service! Great sushi!! 
Perfect if you're staying at Hard Rock. 

Good prices especially when you consider the location and proximity to hotels here in Vegas. 

Bring friends!

This is by far the number one sushi joint I have ever been to in my life I've probably been to over 100 sushi bars. There's no comparison!! Unfortunately there is no all you can eat but everything else makes up for it the service is amazing and the food is amazing. I'd recommend the energy roll and sit at the bar for the experience. You also have to get sake bombs..

After my husband has raved for years about this place, I go a 2nd time to see if I will finally like it. It is AVERAGE. The tastes of rice, crab, fish are pretty flavorless. And the fact that this is not AYCE, their portions should be a lot bigger. This place tastes like an average AYCE place -nothing special. The one nice thing are the hours. At 2 in the morning we wanted sushi and went here. I guess if you're walking by this place and want some sushi, go. But otherwise you are missing absolutely nothing.

Irene and Takky are the best!! They were super friendly and very helpful with recommending food! I would highly recommend the Salmon Killer roll and the Chicken Katsu bowl! I will definitely be back on my next Vegas trip :) Thanks again ladies you were truly amazing!!!!!!!
Tried this place thru Groupon since it was close to my work. Rice was undercooked and I had scale in the spicy Tuna roll. Overall, sushi and rolls weren't tasteful much.

In a word? 

Omnomnom...

Wait? Is that a word? It's a sound, for sure. And we made it a lot devouring our dinner at this great place!

Fresh, plentiful, tasty, creative. Oh man. I have a new favorite, fo' sho'. A little slower than some places (as others have pointed out) but worth it, I think. They take their time to make sure it's executed perfectly. Service with a smile and we lacked for nothing. 

The shitake mushroom roll was earthy and perfectly balanced with the crunch of veg and a touch of crispy tempura. Served with some tempura fungi on the side, and it's a complete dish! 

The Rose and White Rose rolls have been entered into my foodporn um, brain bank... ;) No rice (perfect for me): it's amazing fish, sauce, and a touch of veg here and there... WRAPPED IN MORE FISH. #winwin

We also had a soft-shell crab roll (the name escapes me and it's not on the online menu) that was similar. More fish wrapped in fish. Really. #happyMuse

We had a few other rolls, including the Rock and Roll, the Firecracker, a crunchy scallop roll (served with additional panko-breaded scallops! Yum!), and an unagi/avocado roll. All very, very good. The sauces were not overly used - Bonus points! - just enough to go with the flavor profiles they were trying to create. No sauce-drowned fishies here!

To taste the fish on its own (as Bentern says in his review, without the "tacky" sauce), we did order some nigiri including salmon, tuna, and uni. The uni, my favorite but not that of my dining companions, was fresh, sweet, and perfect. Always a great sign of a great place, IMHO.

Again I have to point out that I like that they don't pack their rolls with rice (and have a LOT of non-rice options). The menu is *extensive* (the online menu is a fraction of the options you actually have). In addition to the sushi and sashimi, they offer some entrees as well.

I don't mind a lack of AYCE because I don't eat enough to make those "deals" worth it. However, I could see the draw in having something here... They can be on the pricey side. That said, Friday night we had a hell of a meal between the three of us... a ton of great food, a couple cucumber salads (meh... just a lot of cucumber in a martini glass... wasn't impressed), some soup, and all those rolls. For... 70ish bucks? Three people? Not bad at all for what you are getting.

And now I am hungry... Dinner, anyone?

This gem was hidden in a strip, crowded with other food vendors. I ordered take out, as it was right across the street from the hotel I was staying at for business, and I was alone. :( 

I skimmed through the menu for a while, when the server came and asked if I was ready. I asked him to suggest some good rolls, hinting that I loved salmon. He recommended the sunrise roll, so I took that and an order of salmon sushi (2 pcs). 

I went back to my hotel room and was pleasantly surprised. The fish was very fresh and the sushi rice was nicely seasoned. If I am ever back in town, I'd love to try their other food!

One of my most favorite sushi spots in Vegas. When I'm near the strip I always like to come here. The service is always great and friendly and the food is amazing. My favorite is the Rose Roll (I've attached a photo of it) I'm a huge tuna lover so this one is perfect for me. I also tried the chili crab lettuce wraps tonight and those were really yummy!! They have an awesome happy hour where you buy one alcoholic drink get one free! I'm all about that. If you are near the Hard Rock Hotel, you have to come try it out!! It's open super late too which is great for us industry people.

I really enjoy d this Sushi restaurant.  I went at lunchtime.The food at served d quickly. The waiter was friendly but didn't tell me of daily specials and promotions. I thick any restaurant who offers special should start with them at the opening. This isn't an AYCE, so go as a group if on a budget.
Fantastic service and even more fantastic rolls. I recommend Kaizen to all my friends and family! Be sure to get the deep fried cheesecake. It's amazing.

Uni was the only thing fresh to me
 Service was great. Just old fish not as fresh. For me i will not return to this restaurant.
The beef tataki is so good, only place I've seen this dish and I loved it. Sunday through Thursday happy hour 12 - 4,  BOGO all alcohol.

The perfect spot for your late night sushi craving! We came a bit late (pass 3am) and still got greeted with smiles. The service, the ambience is great here and the food is amazing! It totally worth going off the strip for this one! Thank you Kaizen, we'll definitely be back for more :)
This place is the worst.  I saw a cockroach running out of the kitchen and i don't blame him.  Same old strip mall sushi you can find on any streetcorner these days.
Love Kaizen I come here after work and fish is always fresh ... :) Avocado train is what I order every time can't get enough of it. It's delicious !! Service is great

my cousins, friends, and i each ordered the two for one drink special and shared a couple large hot sakes. in addition to our drinks, we ordered the calamari roll, kalbi rib roll, crazy boy roll, and a tako appetizer that also had cucumbers and vinegar (i forget it's name). we thoroughly enjoyed our late night meal! i love how pieces of what is in the roll is also on the side, so you can tell what you are eating and enjoy more food! also, when we were ready for our bill, our waitress told us that we still had one more beer from the two for one special. she didn't have to do that!

Freshest fish. Perfectly steamed edamame (not mushy). Great service. Oh, and ORANGE BLOSSOM ROLL.

That is all you need to know.

This place is amazing! Came back two days in a row since we enjoyed it so much! The salmon cheese stick appetizer is super yummy. There is a good selection of rolls. I enjoyed the Unicorn the most. Great teriyaki as well, and better than your typical. 
The service and atmosphere is great for families and date nights. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone, and am sad that we don't live closer.

I found this place using yelp during our recent visit to Vegas.  The great part about this place is the late hours.  Me and my hubby was hungy at a late hour so I yelp the place and was pretty satisfied with the place.  Service was awesome.  It's close by the strip.  Awesome sushi and good food.  I would definitely go back there when visiting =)

WOW!
So many choices of tools to choose from!
If you are looking to try many different types of sushi this is the place

I love this place and frequent it regularly. It's perfect for industry folks who get out of work late because of their late night hours. Service is always friendly and quick. Their happy hour is awesome too. My favorite dish there is the Pepper Seared Tuna with Crispy Onions. Yum

I was craving sushi during a business trip in Vegas, and feeling super jetlagged and exhausted i just wanted something quick for takeaway before passing out for the night. Kaizen got great reviews and was a quick drive from my hotel, so I called in an order and popped in. The food was okay, but not great. The sushi felt like it wasn't very fresh and it was completely warm by the time I got it home (to be fair, it was 100 degrees outside but the car ride was only 5 minutes and the AC was on... so I don't think that could have been the culprit!). Maybe eating in is a better bet for the future.

This place is phenomenal and open super late night.  The quality is breathtaking and it won't break the bank.   I strongly urge you to try the kiss of fire.  They say it's super spicy but it's perfect and not to hot.  There are more expensive sushi places, I'm looking at you Nobu, but they aren't worth the extra scratch.  Come here when in Vegas.  It's across the street from the hard rock and it's skipping distance to the double down saloon.  Great service and great ambience.  Come hungry! The portions are big.  

Also don't just focus on the awesome sushi, their dinner plates, particularly the fresh fish, are worth ordering and are quite memorable.
First time here. We wanted to try a fresh roll and a baked dish. We were not disappointed. Service was also excellent! Would return.
Their sauce was amazing. The best sushi I've had so far. After a long night of drinking I was shocked to see they were still open. They did NOT disappoint I can tell you that

I love this place! I come every time I am in Vegas. I have brought lots of friends there and now they do the same. The sushi is great and the prices are fair. The garlic edamame is to die for. I can't get enough!!!

This place is not bad. I found it late night and decided to sit at the bar. I usually NEVER sit at the bar, but it looked inviting , and very casual, it was a friday night, around 11pm or so. They were playing techno music, I actually like the atmosphere. My date and I came in a for quick bite, and this was pretty fast and not very expensive. Both time that I have been there it has not drained my wallet for what i got. 1st time here i got a shrimp tempura roll ( 7bucks), not bad. and a cucumber roll(4 bucks). My date got the shrimp killer. ( around 8). Not bad at all. 

Second time I went i ordered to go, and I got a vegetable tempura roll,(7bucks) which i found to be VERY GOOD! They put avocado in it. I tried the spicy scallop roll, but I did not care for it. It has some kind of a red mixture, somewhat like tomato. I dont know. I have had better. Everything else was very good!.
Shrimp tempura roll. vegetable tempura roll. scallop roll, cucumber roll all came out to 24 dollars to go. I know i dont order extravagant rolls but thats cause im allergic to some of the stuff in those. So for me veggies rolls are wonderful. Ill prob come back again, because they pay attention to my fish allergy.
I come here alone sometimes after work, and I never feel weird. The sushi chefs talk to me, and they said they would remember my allergy if I came back, that makes me feel SO GREAT!

Really enjoyed this late night sushi place and after 5 hours of playing blackjack I was grateful to find a decent sushi place open after 2am.  All the other late night sushi places seem to close at 2.  Sat down at the bar, at 3:10am the place was surprisingly seated with about 10 other late night eaters. I ordered 2 rolls: King of Ocean Roll (topped with lobster, shrimp, tangy sauce and contained avacodo, asparagus, cucumber) & Sunrise Roll (salmon,avacodo on top, with spicy tuna inside and ponzu sauce).  The food was satisfying and tasted fresh, moreover very satisfying.  Service was friendly and prompt, 2 young Japanese sushi chefs working at the bar preparing the sushi.  Waitresses were young and cute, overall a very satisfying experience and exactly what I was hoping for.

The sushi was pretty decent and the atmosphere was nice but they're serving AYCE-grade fish (we all know the difference) at high-end fresh fish cost. I don't mind paying a la Carte prices when the fish is high quality and worth it. Go to the Kaizen on Eastern, where they do AYCE with the same fish and menu, that way you're not paying $50 for 2 mediocre rolls just because of location.

Thank you Kaizen for the great meal that was needed before our night out dancing. Michael was our server and we applaud him for putting up with us...he was attentive and laughed at our bad jokes. The ambiance wasn't too casual and not too fancy, which was perfect even though we were pretty dressed up. The sushi was DELICIOUS, fresh and nicely prepared. Two girls in our party ordered the miso soup with lobster and loved it. The sushi we ordered was great and filling. The best part about this place was that it wasn't that busy. We assumed it would get busier later into the night, since they are smart and stay open until 6am. 

I plan on returning again to this cute spot off the strip when I'm back in Vegas.

Let me tell you the BBQ roll is spectacular. I felt like a little baby Buddha was dancing on my tongue. This place is awesome and they even surprised us when they told us that starting at 12am  they had buy one sake get one free. Sake Bombs here we go

I like this place a lot because they have great food. I like them even more because they're open late. I've been here a few times after a night out on the strip, I don't know how exactly, but I've made it. I've had rolls and noodles and have enjoyed both with friends.

However, after coming here for a late night [sober] dinner recently I came to realize it really is a good sushi spot away from the strip. Especially since they have great deals - it was half off when we went for dinner.

It's good food, a great deal, chill atmosphere and great service. I must admit though, that i give them extra props for being open late and still delivering great service at such a late hour.

I walked over to get sushi from here and it was quick and easy. They have quite an extensive menu and the prices are very reasonable. I got the crab salad, Hard Rock Roll, and King of Ocean Roll. I don't feel like the crab salad was very flavorful, and they other rolls were good but nothing that I thought that was better than other sushi that I have had.

What a great surprise! In here our first time and the ambience, rolls, service and lighting was great!!
Loved the rolls and loved the late hours they're open.

average sushi and rolls, prices are a little bit on the pricey side... but not too bad.

i guess i went on the wrong night or something cus it was pretty crowded with only two waitresses. service was mediocre... it took me reminding the waitress and even the bus boy 3 times for hot sauce!! ughhh..... i was practically almost done with my rolls by the time i got it.

i even heard the table next to us ask the waitress if they were short on waitresses bc no one has taken their order..... :|
Food is is good, staff is friendly and helpful.  Raspberry sake is bomb good!!! One place I always stop in when in town

Came here after another restaurant was busy. Couldn't have been more pleased. The food was great, and the service was great. 

I'd happily come here again!

This is my favorite sushi spot in Las Vegas! The menu is incredible and hard to choose from. They have pictures of all rolls with helps you to decide. Absolutely the most delicious sushi!! Avocado train, golden knights, tune crispy rice, salmon killer my favorites!
Easy to miss. Great food and service. Many items on the menu. So much to choose from. A must to go

A great solid place for sushi, and even better for lunch. The bento boxes are probably the best deal on the menu in terms of quality, quantity and price. The thing that threw me off was the tempura shrimp bento was solid minus the tempura part. Instead of traditional tempura batter, they used the same batter as that of the chicken katsu which was a big let down for me as it was not as I had expected. My girlfriend had the pork katsu which bowl which was excellent as I picked off her plate as well as mine. If your in the area, give this place a try. I do hope though the tempura shrimp thing was a fluke and it was because they ran out of the proper batter. Otherwise, it would be a big strike against them as far as I am concerned.
Love this place! The bbq roll is amazing and that Salsa Dancing Girl roll...  so delicious.

This is off the strip so it was decent.  It's located inside a plaza like corner with CVS, hookah joint and some other restaurant/stores.  The waitresses here were friendly and sat us down very quickly.  I ordered the rose roll and something else I forgot but it was good.  I do feel like it was a place to pick up hookers or something...

Terrible that they don't tell customers that its not all you can eat!!!! Unlike the other restaurants named Kaizen. And aside from that took foreverrrrr for someone to approach us after we got seated & it wasn't even busy.  Food is Great though so its all worth it haha.

I've been coming here for years and it's still great. Fresh fish, huge creative rolls and friendly customer service. They are open late and the atmosphere is sleek but not snobby. I've never had a bad experience at Kaizen. One of my favorite sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.

Outstanding customer satisfaction ... I don't say customer service because Kaizen sushi goes above just serving their customers they anticipate and satisfy every craving you might have..the sushi is phenomenal and the friendly smiles and sincerity  is beyond expectation... I am always so pleasantly surprised by the level of expertise and mastership of their craft that i am left euphoric every time i eat here
Came here randomly late on a Tuesday - the service and decor was good, but the sushi (rainbow roll and kiss of fire) blows. Will definitely not return!

Decent rolls for a decent price.  I would put this on the same level as some of the sushi spots i frequent in the Bay Area.

What puts this place apart is that they're open late, till 6 in the morning!  Also, i was impressed with the service.  We ordered miso soup,  tempura & sushi and got our food in the correct order!  Its a win-win!

Yup! Super good. Highly recommend the "sexy roll" good roll, great sauce. Late night happy hour for late night revellers. 

Buy one get one for ALL ALCOHOL from midnight to 4am sun thru Thursday.
Happy hour is awsome here on weekdays !!!  They open late till 4am !!!  Good place to come eat sushi and hangout with friends !!!

Ended up coming here with a date to avoid the crazy New Years crowd on the strip! I was recommended to come here by one of the pit bosses while gambling. They had stated that this pale was open until 6 A.M. which was a major plus since It was past midnight at that point. Ended up getting to the restaurant around 1. We started off with a bottle of sake called "nothingness" which was pretty good. (Sweeter cold sake) The food was absolutely amazing, everything was fresh and delicious. The service was also very good! Since it was considered happy hour at that time they brought us an extra bottle of sake on the house. It was only a 5 minute cap ride from Planet Hollywood here which wasn't bad at all.
